content.text: NITK Surathkal Celebrates Constitution Day with Preamble Reading and Replica Unveiling NITK Surathkal, proudly celebrated Constitution Day, also known as Samvidhan Diwas, on November 26th 2024, to honor the adoption of the Constitution of India. The Preamble to the Constitution was read aloud. The event was graced by NITK Director Prof. B Ravi, the Deputy Director, functionaries, staff, and students, emphasizing their shared dedication to upholding the constitutional values and principles that are the foundation of our democracy. Event Highlights: Reading of the Preamble: The solemn ceremony began with the reading of the Preamble to the Constitution of India in three languages Hindi, Kannada, and English emphasizing the linguistic and cultural diversity of our nation. Virtual Participation: Today, November 26, 2024, NITK participated in the online reading of the Preamble to the Constitution in the 22 official languages and English via the Government of India s web portals, demonstrating a nationwide commitment to constitutional literacy and awareness. Unveiling of Constitution Replica: Prof. B Ravi, Director, NITK Surathkal, unveiled the replica of the original edition of the Constitution of India in the Main Library. The Constitution of India book is displayed at the entrance of the Main Library to facilitate the faculty and students to see and appreciate it. The replica edition contains the signatures of all the constituent Assembly Members, namely, the first President of India, Dr. Rajendra Prasad, the first Prime Minister, Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru, Dr. B R Ambedkar, Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, and many other distinguished personalities. The Constitution book is printed in color and is leather-bound with golden foil embellishments (Size: 12x18 inches). Engagement Activities: Various engagement activities were organized to foster a deeper understanding of the Constitution among the participants. These included an essay writing competition for faculty, staff, students, and schools within the campus, a painting poster-making competition, a quiz Q A session, and an address by Dr. Dayananda Naik, Mangalore University.

content.text: Test your knowledge and win big! Ministry of Defence Invites Citizens to Participate in Exciting Events The Ministry of Defence, in collaboration with MyGov and All India Radio, announces a series of events this month to commemorate the spirit of patriotism and promote national pride. These events are designed to engage citizens, particularly the youth, and to enhance awareness of India s rich history and cultural heritage. To celebrate this patriotic spirit, the Ministry will host a series of online quiz contests on topics such as India s war heroes, 75 years of the Indian Constitution, and India s cultural heritage and traditions. Additionally, a live quiz competition on BTR Tune will be held this month, adding to the excitement. Citizens are also invited to participate in a poll to choose the best tableau and the best marching contingent. This poll will be held on January 26, 2025, as part of the Republic Day celebrations. Interested participants can easily take part by scanning the QR code provided. Salient Features of the Events: Bilingual Quizzes: Quizzes will be available in both Hindi and English. Cash Prizes: The top 10 winners will receive cash prizes: 25,000 for the first prize, 15,000 for the second prize, 10,000 for the third prize, and consolation prizes of 5,000 each. Republic Day Parade Invitation: The top 250 participants, along with one companion, will be invited to witness the Republic Day Parade 2025 at Kartavyapath, New Delhi. Participation Certificates: All participants will receive online-generated certificates of participation from MyGov.in. These events aim to encourage citizen participation, ignite patriotic feelings, and promote a sense of pride and unity among the masses. For further information and to participate, please scan the QR code, or visit MyGov.in

content.text: Shri A.S. Kiran Kumar stressed that the process of learning has become more important than the learning itself. There is a need to challenge existing knowledge to bring new innovation for sustainable growth, without overexploitation of natural resources just for the sake of financial benefits. Prof. Avinash Kumar Agarwal highlighted the MoU for collaboration between the two institutes, which will allow bright students of NITK (who are among the top 10 in their class and have a CGPA of 8.0 or above) direct admission to the Ph.D. program at IIT Jodhpur. He stressed the importance of nurturing integrity, resilience and collaboration. On 24th November, the Sky track Foot Over Bridge connecting the Eastern and Western campuses of NITK over NH-66 was inaugurated by Prof. Govindan Rangarajan, in the presence of Prof. Avinash Kumar Agarwal, Director of IIT Jodhpur, and Prof. B. Ravi, Director of NITK. It has been designed with a lift to benefit physically disabled individuals and a gentle sloping path for cyclists, in addition to steps. The Sky track has become a local landmark, offering good views of the highway, both sides of the campus, and the statue of Shri U. Srinivas Mallya. Earlier the same week, an Olympics-standard swimming pool had been inaugurated by Shri P. Radhakrishnan Nair, Chief Coach of Indian Athletics Team.

content.text: NITK Surathkal Celebrates Jan Jatiya Diwas with Enthusiasm The National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK), Surathkal, organized a vibrant celebration of Jan Jatiya Diwas at Maharshi Valmiki Adivasi Budakattu Vasati Shale, Madhya, Surathkal, with enthusiastic participation from students and faculty. The event featured essay writing and drawing competitions, along with various games for students in classes 1 to 10, with 111 students actively participating. Prizes and certificates were awarded to all participants and winners, encouraging them to continue excelling in their pursuits. This event is part of NITK s broader efforts to honor and empower the socio-economic status of tribal communities. NITK joined the nation in celebrating the 4th Jan Jatiya Gaurav Diwas, 2024, held from November 15th to 26th, to commemorate the birth anniversary of Bhagwan Birsa Munda. From November 15th, 2024, to November 15th, 2025, the Jan Jatiya Gaurav Varsh will be celebrated to mark the 150th birth anniversary of Bhagwan Birsa Munda with year-long celebrations throughout the country. In alignment with the directives from the Ministry of Tribal Affairs and the Ministry of Education, Government of India, NITK organized various activities and programmes for the celebration of JJGD 2024. The institute is open to collaborating with stakeholders in organizing initiatives proposed by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs, promoting tribal art, culture, heritage, and history, and showcasing the role played by tribal communities in the Indian freedom struggle. Such initiatives aim to ensure significant socio-economic development for tribal communities. NITK remains committed to empowering tribal communities through various STEM-focused initiatives. The institute has launched projects to enhance educational and technological opportunities, including scholarships, mentorship programs, and workshops on advanced technologies, bridging the educational gap and ensuring equitable opportunities for all. NITK is dedicated to its mission of uplifting and supporting tribal communities, ensuring they have the resources and support needed to thrive in today s rapidly evolving world.
content.original_text:
NITK Surathkal Celebrates Jan Jatiya Diwas with Enthusiasm 

The National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK), Surathkal, organized a vibrant celebration of Jan Jatiya Diwas at Maharshi Valmiki Adivasi Budakattu Vasati Shale, Madhya, Surathkal, with enthusiastic participation from students and faculty. 

The event featured essay writing and drawing competitions, along with various games for students in classes 1 to 10, with 111 students actively participating. 
Prizes and certificates were awarded to all participants and winners, encouraging them to continue excelling in their pursuits. This event is part of NITK's broader efforts to honor and empower the socio-economic status of tribal communities. 

NITK joined the nation in celebrating the 4th Jan Jatiya Gaurav Diwas, 2024, held from November 15th to 26th, to commemorate the birth anniversary of Bhagwan Birsa Munda. From November 15th, 2024, to November 15th, 2025, the Jan Jatiya Gaurav Varsh will be celebrated to mark the 150th birth anniversary of Bhagwan Birsa Munda with year-long celebrations throughout the country. 

In alignment with the directives from the Ministry of Tribal Affairs and the Ministry of Education, Government of India, NITK organized various activities and programmes for the celebration of JJGD 2024. The institute is open to collaborating with stakeholders in organizing initiatives proposed by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs, promoting tribal art, culture, heritage, and history, and showcasing the role played by tribal communities in the Indian freedom struggle. Such initiatives aim to ensure significant socio-economic development for tribal communities. 

NITK remains committed to empowering tribal communities through various STEM-focused initiatives. The institute has launched projects to enhance educational and technological opportunities, including scholarships, mentorship programs, and workshops on advanced technologies, bridging the educational gap and ensuring equitable opportunities for all.

NITK is dedicated to its mission of uplifting and supporting tribal communities, ensuring they have the resources and support needed to thrive in today's rapidly evolving world.

content.text: NITK Surathkal Marks 22nd Annual Convocation with New Infrastructure and Collaborations NIT Karnataka Surathkal celebrated its 22nd annual convocation on 23rd November 2024 in the Silver Jubilee Auditorium. The PG and PhD ceremony held in the forenoon was graced by Prof. Govindan Rangarajan, Director of IISc Bengaluru and Dr. Bhujanga Rao Vepakomma, Chairman of KIMS Foundation Research Centre, Hyderabad. The UG ceremony held in the afternoon was graced by Shri. A.S. Kiran Kumar, Member, Space Commission and Former Chairman, ISRO and Prof. Avinash Kumar Agarwal, Director, IIT Jodhpur. A large number of graduating students and their parents attended the ceremonies, in addition to Senators, faculty and staff members of the Institute, media persons and invited guests. A total of 2078 students received their degrees in person or in absentia. It includes 1002 B.Tech (195 with Minor, and five with Honours), 758 MTech and MTech(R), 179 other Master s (MBA, MCA, M.Sc.) and 139 Ph.D. Nine B.Tech students and 31 PG students were awarded Gold Medals and prizes sponsored by various agencies for securing the highest CGPA. Both sessions were presided over by Prof. B. Ravi, Director and Chairperson of NITK s BoG. He highlighted key developments and progress of the Institute on various fronts, including infrastructure, faculty and staff recruitment, research projects, faculty and student achievements, campus events, placements, collaborations, contribution to national missions and local initiatives. He appreciated the hard work of the Deans, Associate Deans, HoDs, Professors-in-Charge, Wardens, Faculty Advisors, Nodal Officers, Administrative Officers, staff and student representatives. He congratulated the graduating students and told them to regularly thank their parents and well-wishers who helped in their life s journey.

For Kids Surathkal The Staff Recreation Club (SRC) of NITK, Surathkal, organised the Kindle for Kids programme in association with the NITK Central Library on 1 December 2024. The children of NITK teaching and non-teaching staff were invited to learn using the Kindle gadget and read from the choicest of the thousands of Kindle e-books available therein. Nineteen children of NITK staff participated in the programme and explored the Kindle resources. The children gave feedback using the interactive board in the e-Library. Dr. Shashikantha Koudur (Professor in charge, SRC) and Dr. Mallikarjun Angadi (Librarian, Central Library), coordinated the activity. Dr. Basavaraj Talwar, Dr. Deepu Vijayasenan, Dr. Bijuna Mohan, Dr. Beneesh, Dr. Murugan, Dr. Raviraj Moolangi, Dr. Shashibhushan Arya were present.

content.text: NITK Surathkal and IIT Jodhpur Sign MoU for Research Collaboration NIT Karnataka, Surathkal, and IIT Jodhpur have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to collaborate on multiple fronts, including education, research and outreach. The MoU aims to encourage faculty members from both institutions to collaborate on joint research projects in mutually interesting domains and disciplines. The MoU includes offering direct admission to Ph.D. programmes at IIT Jodhpur for meritorious B.Tech. students from NITK. Students ranked among the top 10 in their class who have a CGPA of 8.0 or above will be eligible for direct admission to the Ph.D. programme without the need to appear for and qualify in GATE or any written examination. Speaking on the occasion, Prof. Avinash Kumar Agarwal, Director of IIT Jodhpur said that this will be the beginning of a long-term collaboration between the two institutes. He invited the faculty of NITK to visit IIT-J and discuss with their counterparts. He also shared his views about NEP 2020, and mentioned the need for a highly flexible curriculum. Prof. B. Ravi, Director of NITK, welcomed the collaboration. Deans and Heads of different departments, who were present to witness the MoU-signing, interacted with Prof. Avinash and queried him about the best practices at IIT-J. Prof. Avinash Agarwal would be gracing the 22nd Convocation of NITK on 23rd November 2024, as the Guest of Honour.

In his Convocation Address, Prof. Govindan Rangarajan told the students to embrace AI for advancing the innovations but alerted them about its unethical use. He exhorted the students to cherish family values and improve human relationships to avoid being lonely and isolated. Dr. Bhujanga Rao commented that engineers should be proud of their profession since their innovations run the society, and proud of their heritage since India stands out in terms of its rich cultural heritage from most countries in the world.

content.text: NITK Surathkal Champions Gender Equality with Rising Female Enrolment The National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK), Surathkal, is making waves in higher education by empowering women and advancing gender equality. Over the past five years, the institute has seen a steady increase in female enrolment, reflecting its commitment to creating an equitable academic environment. In the academic year 2019-20, the female student population was a modest 21.8 . This figure has since risen to 23.2 in 2023-24. The B.Tech program has witnessed a notable increase, with female enrolment rising from 572 in 2019-20 to 791 in 2023-24. The Master s programs have grown from 445 to 519 female students, while PhD enrolments have increased from 243 to 336 over the same period. Overall, the number of female students at NITK has expanded from 1,260 in 2019-20 to 1,646 in 2023-24. To further support female students, NITK has established dedicated programs and initiatives catering to their specific needs. These include specialized career counselling services, leadership development workshops, and networking opportunities with industry professionals. Such initiatives not only provide educational support but also prepare female students for successful careers in their chosen fields. NITK also prides itself on the significant contributions of its female faculty members, many of whom hold key administrative positions, including Heads of Departments (HoDs), Professors in Charge (PICs), and Associate Deans, with 28 , 21 , and 25 representations respectively. Recent notable achievements by female faculty and students include awards and patents from esteemed organizations like IEEE, highlighting the continuous excellence and innovation at NITK. As NITK continues to champion gender equality, it remains dedicated to creating a nurturing and supportive environment for all students. By empowering women through education and STEM initiatives, NITK is ensuring they have the resources and support needed to excel in their fields. NITK is actively reviewing its curriculum to enhance educational quality and expand opportunities, particularly in STEM and research to help students.
content.original_text:
NITK Surathkal Champions Gender Equality with Rising Female Enrolment

The National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK), Surathkal, is making waves in higher education by empowering women and advancing gender equality. Over the past five years, the institute has seen a steady increase in female enrolment, reflecting its commitment to creating an equitable academic environment.

In the academic year 2019-20, the female student population was a modest 21.8%. This figure has since risen to 23.2% in 2023-24. The B.Tech program has witnessed a notable increase, with female enrolment rising from 572 in 2019-20 to 791 in 2023-24. The Master's programs have grown from 445 to 519 female students, while PhD enrolments have increased from 243 to 336 over the same period. Overall, the number of female students at NITK has expanded from 1,260 in 2019-20 to 1,646 in 2023-24.

To further support female students, NITK has established dedicated programs and initiatives catering to their specific needs. These include specialized career counselling services, leadership development workshops, and networking opportunities with industry professionals. Such initiatives not only provide educational support but also prepare female students for successful careers in their chosen fields.

NITK also prides itself on the significant contributions of its female faculty members, many of whom hold key administrative positions, including Heads of Departments (HoDs), Professors in Charge (PICs), and Associate Deans, with 28%, 21%, and 25% representations respectively.

Recent notable achievements by female faculty and students include awards and patents from esteemed organizations like IEEE, highlighting the continuous excellence and innovation at NITK.

As NITK continues to champion gender equality, it remains dedicated to creating a nurturing and supportive environment for all students. By empowering women through education and STEM initiatives, NITK is ensuring they have the resources and support needed to excel in their fields.

NITK is actively reviewing its curriculum to enhance educational quality and expand opportunities, particularly in STEM and research to help students.

content.text: One-Day Workshop on Data Unleashed: AI, ML Beyond at NITK Surathkal A highly engaging and insightful one-day workshop titled Data Unleashed: AI, ML Beyond! was successfully conducted at the prestigious NITK Surathkal on 26th October 2024. The event was sponsored by Warrier H.E.A.R.T HUB under the AquaWISE project and was jointly organized by the Department of Water Resources Ocean Engineering and the Department of Computer Science Engineering, NITK Surathkal. The workshop saw 218 participants, including students, academicians, and industrialists from NITK and nearby institutions. The workshop featured Mr. Padmanand Warrier, NITK alumnus and founder of Warrier H.E.A.R.T., who shared his experience on AI-driven decision-making and its impact on startups, inspiring attendees with a future-oriented perspective on AI in business. Another distinguished speaker, Bastin Robins, Founder and CTO of CleverInsight, provided practical insights on leveraging AI and ML for solving real-world problems. A team from CleverInsight, California, led a hands-on workshop offering participants an exceptional dive into AI, ML, and data-driven decision-making. The sessions explored real-world applications across healthcare, retail, and telecom, providing valuable insights for both new engineers and seasoned professionals. The event was coordinated by Dr. Pruthviraj U, Professor-In-Charge of Trans-Disciplinary (R D) Associate Professor, Water Resources Ocean Engineering, along with Dr. Mohit P. Tahiliani, Associate Professor, Department of Computer Science Engineering, NITK Surathkal. Dr. Pruthviraj U said that the workshop emphasized practical, hands-on learning that goes beyond traditional academic environments and even surpasses some of the top-tier industry practices. The participants expressed appreciation for the original and practical content. An experienced industry leader found the presentations to be insightful.

content.text: RASHTRIYA EKTA DIWAS NATIONAL UNITY DAY SURATHKAL NITK Surathkal successfully celebrated National Unity Day, also known as Rashtriya Ekta Diwas, on 30.10.2024 to honor the birth anniversary of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel. This day commemorates the efforts of Sardar Patel, who played a pivotal role in unifying the country. As part of the Unity Week, held from October 25th to October 31st, 2024, NITK organized a series of events aimed at promoting unity and solidarity among the campus community. These events included a Unity Run and a Unity Pledge. The Unity Run saw enthusiastic participation from over 400 individuals, including functionaries, staff, and students of NITK, who collectively showcased their commitment to the cause of national unity. During the Unity Pledge, participants reaffirmed their dedication to upholding the unity, integrity, and security of the nation. They pledged to continue supporting the cause of national integration and to work towards fostering a spirit of harmonious coexistence and brotherhood. NITK Surathkal is proud to have been part of this nationwide initiative that promotes unity in diversity. PC:

content.text: 3rd Indian Symposium on Offshore Geotechnics (ISOG 2024) A Landmark Event! Location: NITK, Surathkal, India Dates: November 8-9, 2024 The 3rd Indian Symposium on Offshore Geotechnics (ISOG 2024), hosted by NITK Surathkal in collaboration with the Indian Geotechnical Society, Surathkal and Bangalore Chapters, was a tremendous success! This premier event, supported by ISSMGE TC209 and IGS, welcomed over 200 delegates from academia, industry, and research communities worldwide. Highlights: Inaugural Address by Prof. TG Sitharam (Chairman, AICTE): Emphasized the importance of offshore geotechnics for sustainable and resilient marine structures. Industry Insights from Experts: Dr. Anil Joseph (IGS President), Dr. Arun Prabha (Mangaluru Smart City Ltd.), and Dr. Phil Watson (TC209 Chair, ISSMGE) shared their expertise on the growing opportunities and challenges in offshore geotechnics. Keynote Speakers: Featuring top professionals like Dr. Phil Watson (University of Western Australia), Dr. Subhamoy Bhattacharya (University of Surrey), and more. Presidential Remarks by NITK Director, Dr. B. Ravi: Highlighted the importance of geotechnical engineering in modern infrastructure, reflected on ancient Indian practices like Vastu Shilpa, and discussed the integration of AI, remote sensing, IoT, and multi-physics simulations in geotechnical applications. He reinforced NITK s commitment to creating a smart, sustainable, and resilient campus and contributing to Smart City projects. Technical Sessions Knowledge Sharing: Over 112 abstracts and 75 full-length papers were presented, covering a range of topics from offshore site investigation to deep-sea exploration and emerging technologies. Collaboration Innovation: The symposium provided a platform for networking, knowledge exchange, and envisioning the future of geotechnics. Kudos to the organizing team: Dr. Parthasarathy CR (Chair), Prof. Sunil (Vice-Chair), Prof. Madhavi Latha G (Vice-Chair), and Secretaries Dr. Sreevalsa Kolathayar, Dr. Sharanappagouda K, and Dr. Lohitkumar N, for a successful and impactful event.

üåä 3rd Indian Symposium on Offshore Geotechnics (ISOG 2024) ‚Äì A Landmark Event! üåä

üìç Location: NITK, Surathkal, India üìÖ Dates: November 8-9, 2024

The 3rd Indian Symposium on Offshore Geotechnics (ISOG 2024), hosted by NITK Surathkal in collaboration with the Indian Geotechnical Society, Surathkal and Bangalore Chapters, was a tremendous success! This premier event, supported by ISSMGE TC209 and IGS, welcomed over 200 delegates from academia, industry, and research communities worldwide.

üé§ Highlights:

Inaugural Address by Prof. TG Sitharam (Chairman, AICTE): Emphasized the importance of offshore geotechnics for sustainable and resilient marine structures.

Industry Insights from Experts: Dr. Anil Joseph (IGS President), Dr. Arun Prabha (Mangaluru Smart City Ltd.), and Dr. Phil Watson (TC209 Chair, ISSMGE) shared their expertise on the growing opportunities and challenges in offshore geotechnics.

Keynote Speakers: Featuring top professionals like Dr. Phil Watson (University of Western Australia), Dr. Subhamoy Bhattacharya (University of Surrey), and more.

Presidential Remarks by NITK Director, Dr. B. Ravi: Highlighted the importance of geotechnical engineering in modern infrastructure, reflected on ancient Indian practices like Vastu Shilpa, and discussed the integration of AI, remote sensing, IoT, and multi-physics simulations in geotechnical applications. He reinforced NITK's commitment to creating a smart, sustainable, and resilient campus and contributing to Smart City projects.

content.text: Eco-Friendly Olympic-Size Swimming Pool NITK Surathkal NITK Surathkal, inaugurated its new state-of-the-art swimming pool on 20th November 2024 at 5:30 PM. Shri P. Radhakrishnan Nair, Dronacharya awardee and Chief Coach of the Indian National Athletics Team, was the chief guest for the event, graced by the esteemed presence of Prof. B. Ravi, Director of NITK, Deputy Director and other functionaries. The pool enhances NITK s sports infrastructure, promoting physical fitness and aquatic sports. The Olympic-size pool (50m x 25m) includes 10 lanes and an advanced Ozone-based filtration system for eco-friendly, chemical-free water treatment. NITK will host the All India Inter NIT Sports Meet 2024-25 from 10th to 12th January 2025, featuring swimming, athletics, and power sports. The pool also supports various swimming competitions, training camps, and fitness programs. The project began in July 2023 with a cost of 7.39 crores. Despite delays due to the 2024 Parliament Elections and extreme weather, the project was completed successfully. This facility, which underwent maintenance during COVID-19, is now ready for use. Shri Radhakrishnan Nair emphasized the importance of physical fitness, stating, Being physically fit is crucial to escape natural calamities and maintain overall well-being. Regular exercise is vital for professionals to manage stress and ensure a healthy work-life balance. Physical fitness also plays a critical role in aging gracefully. I strongly advocate for incorporating physical activity into our daily routine, ideally twice a day, regardless of our busy schedules. The Director expressed gratitude to everyone involved in making the swimming pool a reality, saying, We hope this will be a good starting point for building mental and physical well-being. This swimming pool is indeed a jewel in the crown of NITK s sports infrastructure. We extend our heartfelt gratitude to everyone who contributed to the successful inauguration of our new swimming pool. Special thanks to the former Directors,CPWD,Registrar,Deans, SAS, Hostel and SE office,heads of all depts, faculty, staff and students for the constant support.

content.text: Swacchata Special Campaign 4.0 : Concluding Ceremony Surathkal National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal, successfully concluded the Swachhata Special Campaign 4.0, a nationwide initiative by the Government of India, on October 30, 2024. As per the directives of the Ministry of Education, Government of India, NITK Surathkal undertook the Swachhata Special Campaign 4.0 from October 2 to October 30, 2024. The campaign focused on efficient management and enhancement of office spaces, disposal of pendency, and Swachhata Hi Seva. Various activities were conducted, including Shramadan, Swachhata jatha, beach cleaning drives, Swachhata pledge, seminars, workshops, disposal of pending files issues, and competitions on waste management, slogan writing, drawing, and essay writing. The concluding ceremony, held on October 30, 2024, saw participation from over 400 individuals, including functionaries, staff, faculty, and students. Shri. P. Sravan Kumar, IAS, Probationary IAS Officer, District Commissioner s Office, Dakshina Kannada, Karnataka, was the chief guest. Prof. Subash C. Yaragal, NITK Deputy Director, presided over the event. The Mechanical Engineering Department and Central Library secured first place in the special campaign 4.0 cleaning activities, while the Department of CSE, Chemical Engineering, and EEE secured second position. Certificates were distributed to winners of the drawing and essay writing competitions. Shri Ram Mohan Y, Joint Registrar, NITK, was felicitated for his tireless efforts in keeping the campus clean. The institute extends gratitude to all the Functionaries, Staff, students of various Departments, Offices, Sections, Units, Team NCC, NSS unit, Students Council, NITK Clubs, and the organizing committee for their efforts in making the event a success. PC:

content.text: Tribute to the Architect of NITK: 122nd Birth Anniversary of Sri U. Srinivas Mallya The National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK), Surathkal, today commemorated the 122nd birth anniversary of its esteemed founder, the late Sri U. Srinivas Mallya. Originally established as the Karnataka Regional Engineering College (KREC), now known as NITK, Sri Mallya is revered as the Father of Modern Dakshina Kannada District. His enduring vision and steadfast dedication have been the cornerstone of NITK s growth and success. Sri Mallya served an 18-year tenure as a member of Parliament, from 1946 1965. His vision led to the construction of the New Mangalore Port, Bajpe airport, National Highway 66, and most importantly, the Karnataka Regional Engineering College (now NITK). On this auspicious occasion, respects were paid to the statue of Sri U. Srinivas Mallya at the NITK campus. The statue was garlanded by NITK Director, Prof. B. Ravi, Deputy Director Prof. Subhash C. Yaragal, along with functionaries, staff, alumni, and students at 9:00 AM today. In the light of this significant occasion, esteemed NITK Director, Prof. B Ravi, extended his deepest respects and heartfelt sentiments. Sri Mallya s contributions to the region and the nation have left an indelible mark, and his legacy continues to inspire future generations. He was a philanthropist who donated generously to various causes such as education, health, social welfare, and religious activities. He also supported the promotion of Gandhiji s programmes like Khadi and Village Industries, entry of Dalits to temples, eradication of untouchability etc.

NITK Surathkal Hosts Successful JOTA Event, Connecting Young Scouts and Guides Through Amateur Radio NITK Surathkal successfully hosted the annual Jamboree on The Air (JOTA) event on October 19, 2024, at the SEARCH (System for Emergency Assistance, Response, and Communication Hub) facility. This initiative was organized by NITK s Amateur Radio Club (VU2REC) in collaboration with the Mangalore Amateur Radio Club (MARC), aimed to introduce young scouts and guides to the world of amateur radio communication. The event received valuable support from Manipal Dot Net Pvt. Ltd., highlighting the importance of industry partnerships in educational initiatives. The event saw an impressive turnout, with a total of 157 students participating from local schools. Mr. Vishnumurthy (call sign: VU2VTI) from MARC lent his expertise to the event, guiding young enthusiasts through the intricacies of amateur radio operation. His presence highlighted the collaborative spirit between NITK and the local amateur radio community. Dr. Pruthviraj U, Professor In-charge (Transdisciplinary Research Development) at NITK and Project Head of SEARCH, and Dr. K V Gangadharan (call sign: VU2TAO), Custodian of VU2REC, along with the CSD PROJECT STAFF team led by MANISH (call sign: VU3FCT), played key roles in organizing and executing this event. Their involvement highlights NITK s commitment to providing enriching extracurricular experiences for students. As we face increasing global challenges, events like JOTA play a crucial role in preparing the next generation for effective communication during emergencies. By combining education with hands-on experience, NITK Surathkal is contributing to building a more resilient and connected community. The event showcased various engaging activities, including the setup of VHF stations for long-distance communication and the use of the VU2NIW repeater station for local connections. Participants enthusiastically took part in interactive sessions, filling the airwaves with songs, quizzes, riddles, and short speeches, bringing the spirit of amateur radio to life.

content.text: NITK Swachhata Special Campaign 4.0 We are happy to share some more highlights of the Running from October 2 to 31, 2024, the Swachhata Special Campaign 4.0 at NITK Surathkal aims to institutionalize swachhata and minimize pendency in government offices. We have planned an array of swachhata programs and events throughout the campaign period to reinforce our dedication to a cleaner, healthier, and more sustainable environment. This year s theme, Enchanted Cosmos, aims to inspire innovation, curiosity, and exploration of the vast universe. This four-day extravaganza, scheduled from October 17.10.2024 to 20.10.2024, promises to attract over 25,000 visitors and features more than 30 events across various technical domains, including Hackathon, Auto Expo, Gaming Events, Technights Projects, Robocons Expo, Tronix Expo, Drone Racing, Virtual Sky Tour, Engi Talks, ACM VR Expo, Tech Mela, and Pro Show and many more. Ltd., graced the occasion as the Chief Guest, and Shri. Prakash, Executive Director of The Hutti Gold Mines Co. Ltd., was the Guest of Honor. NITK Deputy Director, Prof. Subhash C Yaragal presided over the ceremony, accompanied by Prof. A.C Hegde, Dean Students Welfare, Dr. S. B. Arya, Professor in charge Engineer and Technical Clubs, and Team Incident. Stay tuned for more updates!i

content.text: The Government of India has approved Rs. 990.00 Cr over FY 2023-24 to FY 2027-28 for establishing 3 AI-COEs led by top educational institutions in consortium with industry partners and startups. In partnership with leading industry players interdisciplinary research will be conducted in these centres to develop cutting-edge applications and scalable problem solutions in the areas of agriculture, health, and sustainable cities.

Make AI in India and Make Al work for India Hon ble Union Minister for Education Shri Dharmendra Pradhan to announce 3 AI - Centres of Excellence on Healthcare, Agriculture and Sustainable Cities on 15th October 2024. To realize the vision of Viksit Bharat , these 3 CoE for Artificial Intelligence (AI) will be led by top educational institutions in consortium with industry partners and startups. They will conduct interdisciplinary research and develop cutting-edge applications and scalable problem solutions in these 3 areas. This will galvanize an effective Al ecosystem and nurture quality human resources in these fields.

The AI Centres of Excellence on Healthcare, led by IIT Delhi and AIIMS Delhi, aims to focus on early disease prediction, diagnostics, and pandemic tracking. It will support trials and data collection for healthcare, including AYUSH medicines while addressing challenges related to affordability, quality, and access. The initiative also aims to foster healthcare innovation by developing technical infrastructure and collaborations.

content.text: The AI Centre of Excellence on Sustainable Cities, led by IIT Kanpur, will leverage artificial intelligence for smart city planning, traffic management, and efficient resource distribution. By integrating data from sensors, GIS maps, and satellite feeds, it will predict resource needs and enhance public space design. With shared infrastructure across Agriculture, Health, and Sustainable Cities the CoEs will further optimize costs and resources.

NITK Prof. Hemantha Kumar wins Prof. Satish Dhawan Young Engineer State Award Dr. Hemantha Kumar, Professor, Department of Mechanical Engineering, National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK) has been conferred with Prof. Satish Dhawan Young Engineers State Award in the field of Engineering Sciences for the year 2022. This award, instituted by the Government of Karnataka, recognises outstanding contributions in the field of Engineering Sciences. The Honourable Chief Minister of Karnataka, Shri Siddaramaiah, presented the award in the esteemed presence of Bharat Ratna Shri C.N.R. Rao, Hon ble Minister of Science and Technology, Shri N.S. Boseraju, Prof. Govindan Rangarajan, Director, Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Shri A.S. Kiran Kumar, Former Chairman, Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), Smt. Ekroop Caur, Secretary, Department of Science and Technology, and other distinguished dignitaries at a solemn ceremony held at J N Tata Auditorium, IISc campus, Bengaluru on 26th September 2024. The award instituted by the Karnataka State Council for Science and Technology to encourage engineers and scientists aged under 50 who have made outstanding contributions in engineering and earth sciences carried a purse of 1,00,000, a memento and a citation. In response to the award, Prof. Hemantha Kumar expressed his gratitude to his colleagues, students, and the NITK community for their support. He also acknowledged the role of funding agencies and collaborators in fostering his research endeavours. NITK Director Prof. B. Ravi, functionaries, faculty and staff congratulated Prof. Hemantha kumar for his remarkable achievement.

The Government of India is embarking on an ambitious initiative to harness the power of artificial intelligence (AI) for the country s development through the establishment of AI-COEs led by top educational institutions in consortium with industry partners and startups. This initiative aims to position India as a global leader in AI innovation while ensuring that these advancements are aligned with the nation s unique needs and challenges. The AI-CoE will focus on 3 key sectors that are vital for India s growth: Agriculture, Health, and Sustainable Cities.

content.text: The AI Centre of Excellence in Agriculture, led by IIT Ropar, aims to transform farming practices by leveraging data on crop yields, weather, and local conditions. By integrating traditional knowledge with modern scientific insights, it will provide AI-driven, real-time guidance on sowing, harvesting, and crop health. This initiative will not only enhance crop quality and reduce losses but also promote biodiversity and address challenges in animal husbandry.

content.text: NITK Surathkal s Innovation Research in 5G B5G Technologies Earns C-DOT Fellowship C-DOT STAR fellowship NITK Surathkal s Innovation Research in 5G B5G Technologies Earns C-DOT Fellowship C-DOT STAR fellowship. National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK) Surathkal is proud to announce that Ms. Aathira G Menon, a research scholar from the Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering (ECE), has been awarded the prestigious Centre for Development of Telematics (C-DOT) fellowship through their STAR program. This recognition, unveiled on World Telecommunication Day, acknowledges Aathira s outstanding research potential in the field of telecommunications. NITK Surathkal stands uniquely among top institutions, including IITs, as the only NIT to secure this award. Under the guidance of her mentors, Dr. Prabhu K, Associate Professor, and Dr. Shyam Lal, Associate Professor, Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, NITK Surathkal, Aathira s research focuses on Next-Gen V2V: Deep Learning-Driven Multipath Profiling and Vehicle Fingerprinting for Enhanced V2V Communication in Smart Cities. This innovative project aims to enhance vehicular applications for 5G and beyond 5G (B5G) technologies. The C-DOT STAR program offers a fellowship of INR 6 Lakh per annum for up to four years, along with mentorship from research leaders and access to lab facilities. This support will enable Aathira to make significant contributions to the development of advanced communication systems for connected vehicles. We gratefully acknowledge C-DOT for this opportunity and recognizing young talent nationwide. Special thanks to Dr. Prabhu K, Dr. Shyam Lal, and Prof. Sharnappa Joladarashi for their invaluable guidance and support.

As part of this campaign, NITK Surathkal organized a Swachhata campaign jatha in Surathkal city today, witnessing an overwhelming participation of over 400 individuals. The jatha saw active participation from NITK NCC cadets, NSS volunteers, NITK SEVA DAL, functionaries, staff, faculty, and students. Local NGOs, including Rotary Club Surathkal and Lions Club Surathkal, also joined hands with NITK Surathkal to make this campaign a success.

content.text: NITK Surathkal Commemorates Gandhi Jayanti with Swachhata Hi Seva 2024 Swachhata Pledge and Launches Swachhata Special Campaign 4.0 On the auspicious occasion of Gandhi Jayanti, National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK) Surathkal organized a swachhata pledge-taking ceremony this morning, attended by more than 500 participants, including functionaries, faculty, staff, students, NCC cadets, and NSS volunteers. This remarkable event marked the beginning of NITK Surathkal s participation in the Swachhata Hi Seva 2024 campaign and the launch of Swachhata Special Campaign 4.0, an initiative by the Government of India. The event s massive turnout showcases the institute s commitment to promoting cleanliness, hygiene, and well-being among its community members. Swachhata Special Campaign 4.0, running from October 2 to 31, 2024, aims to institutionalize swachhata and minimize pendency in government offices. NITK Surathkal has planned a series of swachhata programs and events throughout the campaign period. NITK Surathkal s efforts contribute to the nationwide Swachh Bharat Mission initiated by our Honorable PMO India Shri Narendra Modi which commemorates Mahatma Gandhi s birth anniversary. By participating in Swachhata Hi Seva 2024 and Swachhata Special Campaign 4.0, NITK Surathkal reinforces its dedication to creating a cleaner, healthier, and more sustainable environment. Don t forget to your stories with us!!!

content.text: NITK Surathkal Hosts Safaimitra Suraksha Shivris Under Swachhata Hi Seva 2024 NITK A glimpse of Safaimitra Suraksha Shivris held at NITK yesterday, recognizing the invaluable contributions of our Safaimitras (housekeeping staff). The event was part of the ongoing Swachhata Hi Seva 2024 initiative, aligning with the Ministry of Education s directives. Officials from Canara Bank, NITK Surathkal Branch, located within the NITK campus, delivered talks on central government schemes and social welfare linkages, facilitating documentation for the Safaimitras benefit. Over 280 housekeeping staff from various departments, sections, offices, and centers of NITK participated, with Deans, Functionaries, Faculty, and staff gracing the occasion. This initiative empowers Safaimitras with access to social welfare schemes, promoting their financial inclusion and well-being. By acknowledging their tireless efforts, NITK reinforces its commitment to dignity and respect for all employees. NITK continues to prioritize the welfare and empowerment of its entire workforce.

Ten Faculty members of NITK Feature in Stanford s List of Top 2 Scientists NITK delighted to announce that ten of its faculty members have been featured in Stanford University s list of the Top 2 Scientists worldwide. This accolade is based on data from Scopus, a leading database of peer-reviewed scientific publications, curated by Elsevier, one of the largest academic publisher in the world with its headquarter in the Netherlands and Stanford University, USA. The esteemed faculty members from NITK Surathkal have made significant contributions to diverse research domains such as energy and environment, materials and manufacturing, healthcare and medical technologies, communication and information systems, as well as water treatment and membrane technology. The areas of expertise for the honored faculty include Computational Mechanics and Smart Structures by Prof. Subhaschandra Kattimani, Dynamics of Heated Structures and Bio-Composites by Prof. P. Jeyaraj, Next-Generation Communication Technologies by Dr. Prabu K, Thermal Spray Coatings and Surface Engineering by Prof. Ramesh M.R., Biomass Conversion and Sustainable Chemistry by Dr. Saikat Dutta, Speech Processing and Human-Computer Interaction by Prof.Shashidhar G. Koolagudi, Numerical Simulation and Computational Modeling by Dr. Arumuga Perumal D, Materials Science and Energy Applications by Prof. D. Krishna Bhat, Membrane Technology and Water Treatment by Prof. Arun M. Isloor, and Control Systems and Renewable Energy by Prof.Debashisha Jena. The institute has well-established Centres of Excellence dedicated to research and development. Faculty members at NITK have a strong research background and make significant contributions across various research domains, addressing global challenges. The research ecosystem at NITK Surathkal includes interdisciplinary research centres, industry partnerships, funding from governmental and international bodies, research grants, state-of-the-art research facilities, and a Central Research Facility (CRF) that underpins local and national R D projects. Join us in congratulating our esteemed faculty members.

The areas of expertise for the honored faculty include Computational Mechanics and Smart Structures by Prof. Subhaschandra Kattimani, Dynamics of Heated Structures and Bio-Composites by Prof. P. Jeyaraj, Next-Generation Communication Technologies by Dr. Prabu K, Thermal Spray Coatings and Surface Engineering by Prof. Ramesh M.R., Biomass Conversion and Sustainable Chemistry by Dr. Saikat Dutta, Speech Processing and Human-Computer Interaction by Prof.Shashidhar G. Koolagudi, Numerical Simulation and Computational Modeling by Dr. Arumuga Perumal D, Materials Science and Energy Applications by Prof. D. Krishna Bhat, Membrane Technology and Water Treatment by Prof. Arun M. Isloor, and Control Systems and Renewable Energy by Prof.Debashisha Jena.

The institute has well-established Centres of Excellence dedicated to research and development. Faculty members at NITK have a strong research background and make significant contributions across various research domains, addressing global challenges. The research ecosystem at NITK Surathkal includes interdisciplinary research centres, industry partnerships, funding from governmental and international bodies, research grants, state-of-the-art research facilities, and a Central Research Facility (CRF) that underpins local and national R&D projects.

Join us in congratulating our esteemed faculty members. üëèüèº

content.text: SafaiMitra Suraksha Shivris concludes at NITK Surathkal NITK Surathkal successfully organized a two-day Safai Mitra Suraksha Shivir exclusively for its housekeeping staff (Safai Mitras) as part of the Swachhata Hi Seva 2024 initiative by the Government of India. The event, held on September 30 and October 1, 2024, at the NITK campus, aimed to promote cleanliness, hygiene, and overall well-being among Safai Mitras. Executive Certification Program in AI Analytics at NITK NIT Karnataka, Surathkal, is excited to announce an Executive Certification Program in AI Analytics during November 19-22, 2024. It is designed for professionals across industries who are keen to dive deep into AI s real-world applications and its impact on Indian industries. Participants will engage in hands-on sessions, discuss real-world case studies, explore AI Playbooks, and collaborate on team projects while gaining insights from leading industry executives. Held at the picturesque NITK campus, which is nestled between the lush green Western Ghats and the calm blue Lakshadweep Sea, the program offers the perfect environment for learning and reflection. Key takeaways include gaining insights into AI s transformative role in business; networking with industry peers and experts; and building personal AI Playbook. NITK Surathkal Hosts Prime Minister s Plantation Campaign Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam We are proud to share the glimpse of Prime Minister s Plantation Campaign Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam organised at NITK campus today, the initiative aiming to promote environmental sustainability and ecological balance. The event featured Air Marshal B.U. Chengappa (PVSM, AVSM, VSM, NITK Alumnus) as the Chief Guest, and Mr. Niranjana Mahbalappa, President of NITK Alumni Association Bangalore Chapter (MECH-1990), as the Guest of Honor. Prof. B. Ravi, Director, NITK, presided over the program. Addressing the gathering, Air Marshal B.U. Chengappa expressed his gratitude to NITK for organizing the event in alignment with the Prime Minister s vision of the Plantation Campaign, Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam. He emphasized the importance of forest conservation, warning that neglecting this responsibility could lead to catastrophic phenomena like landslides and extreme weather conditions. Mr. Niranjana Mahbalappa shared his personal experience and passion for afforestation and planting, inspiring the audience with his commitment to environmental sustainability. NITK Director, Prof. B. Ravi appreciated Dr. Aparna P., Professor In-charge Horticulture, for her innovative concept of Vrukshavana, which involves creating Miyawaki forest blocks in the name of incoming batches of students. By the time students graduate, these saplings will have grown into forests, fostering a lasting connection between the students and the environment. NITK launched its plantation drive on World Environment Day, June 5th, 2024, planting over 600 tree saplings. The institute has also created Miyawaki forest blocks, known as Vrukshavana, as part of the 2024 B.Tech orientation program, with around 400 saplings planted in the 2024 Miyawaki Vrukshavana Block. Deputy Director Prof. Subhash C Yaragal, Prof. P. Sam Johnson, Associate NCC Officer, Dr. Arun Kumar Shettigar, NSS Officer, Deans, Functionaries, faculty, staff, and students participated in the event.

content.text: NITK SURATHKAL RECRUITMENT - DEPUTATION AND CONTRACTUAL POSITIONS National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK), Surathkal, Mangaluru is seeking competent and experienced professionals with specialized skills for several contractual and deputation posts. NITK is an Institute of National Importance ranking among the top 20 engineering institutes in India (NIRF 2023). It is located in Mangalore, headquarters of Dakshina Kannada district, and well connected by road, rail, air and sea to other parts of the country and world. The city an important centre of education, business, trade and tourism. Spread over nearly 300 acres with verdant greenery and its own beach, NITK campus provides an inspiring and peaceful ambience to its residents. The Institute currently houses over 6500 students and over 270 faculty members hailing from different parts of the country. More than 20 of students as well as faculty are female. The Institute aspires to create a unique model of higher education that combines global excellence with local relevance, by connecting knowledge creation (research), dissemination (teaching) and application (innovation entrepreneurship). In line with its vision and mission, NITK is inviting applications from Indian nationals to join the administration in the following contractual and deputation posts number of posts indicated in brackets at NITK campus in Surathkal, Mangaluru. Contractual Posts: Account Officer 1 , Internal Audit Officer 1 , Legal Officer 1 , Placement Officer 1 , Public Relations Officer 1 , Graphics Web Officer 1 , and Medical Officers 2 . The Contract Period will be one year, extendable annually based on performance and Institute requirements, for a maximum period of 3 years. Initial consolidated monthly emolument for each post will be 70,000 -. Deputation Posts: Deputy Registrar 1 post and Assistant Registrar 2 posts . The scale of Pay will be as per 7th CPC guidelines. Important Dates: Eligible and interested candidates may apply through the NITK website and submit their online application latest by 16th September, 2024. For more details visit NITK webiste: www.nitk.ac.in

content.text: NITK Brainstorms Future Curriculum and Pedagogy on Teachers Day NITK celebrated Teachers Day on 5th September, 2024, with interesting reflections and inspiring panel discussions. Prof. G.S. Dwarakish, Dean (Academic Programs) welcomed all those present and outlined the overall schedule. It commenced with an insightful keynote speech by Prof. G. Rama Mohan Reddy, Senior Professor in the Department of IT, who addressed the intricate relationship between AI and Engineering, posing the question: Best Friends or Worst Enemies? He quoted recent reports to emphasise that future employment as well as education will be disrupted by AI. However, we need AI tools which are explainable, reliable and ethical, which is possible only by adopting engineering approach for product development. On the other hand, core disciplines need to reinvent themselves by adapting AI tools to remain relevant. To achieve both objectives, core branches and circuit branches need to work closely together. This requires a bold curriculum and novel pedagogy. The first panel discussion, moderated by Prof. Reddy, delved into Curriculum - What to teach . The panellists included Dr. Mervin J. Thomas from Mechanical Engineering, Dr. Dastagiri Reddy from Electrical Electronics Engineering, Dr. Sowmya Kamath from Information Technology, and Dr. Suprabha KR from Humanities, Social Sciences Management. They recognized that GenZ students are fast and visual learners, tech savvy, and want experiential learning (less teaching, more doing ). While theory is essential for a strong foundation, it must be made interesting by real-life examples and course projects. The curriculum must provide ample choice and co-curricular activities; it must impart critical thinking, collaboration, communication and caring attitude in students. Inter-disciplinary, multi-disciplinary and trans-disciplinary courses and projects need to be encouraged. Future technologies can be combined with time-tested Indian Knowledge System for holistic development and progress.

NITK celebrated Teachers‚Äô Day on 5th September, 2024, with interesting reflections and inspiring panel discussions. Prof. G.S. Dwarakish, Dean (Academic Programs) welcomed all those present and outlined the overall schedule. It commenced with an insightful keynote speech by Prof. G. The first panel discussion, moderated by Prof. Reddy, delved into "Curriculum - What to teach". The panellists included Dr. Mervin J. Thomas from Mechanical Engineering, Dr. Dastagiri Reddy from Electrical & Electronics Engineering, Dr. Sowmya Kamath from Information Technology, and Dr. Suprabha KR from Humanities, Social Sciences & Management. They recognized that GenZ students are fast and visual learners, tech savvy, and want experiential learning (less teaching, more ‚Äòdoing‚Äô). While theory is essential for a strong foundation, it must be made interesting by real-life examples and course projects. The curriculum must provide ample choice and co-curricular activities; it must impart critical thinking, collaboration, communication and caring attitude in students. Inter-disciplinary, multi-disciplinary and trans-disciplinary courses and projects need to be encouraged. Future technologies can be combined with time-tested Indian Knowledge System for holistic development and progress.

content.text: Swachhata Hi Seva 2024: NITK Surathkal Joins the Nationwide Movement The Government of India has launched the Swachhata Hi Seva campaign with the theme Swabhav Swachhata, Sanskar Swachhata , emphasizing the importance of cleanliness and environmental sustainability. Coinciding with International Coastal Clean-Up Day, NITK Surathkal proudly launches its Beach Cleaning Drive as part of the Swachhata Hi Seva 2024 campaign. This year s Swacchata campaign marks a significant milestone - the tenth anniversary of the Swacch Bharat Mission and the seventh year of the Swacchata Hi Seva campaign. Prime Minister Narendra Modi s vision for a Swachh Bharat has been instrumental in driving this movement forward. As he aptly put it, A clean India would be the best tribute India could pay to Mahatma Gandhi on his 150th birth anniversary . The Prime Minister s mantra, Na gandagi karenge, Na karne denge (Neither litter, nor let others litter), has resonated with the nation. To commemorate this milestone, NITK Surathkal organized a beach cleaning drive on 22nd September 2024 at 7:30 AM at NITK Beach, which saw enthusiastic participation from over 300 individuals, including local NGOs, NITK Sevadal, NITK NCC cadets, NSS volunteers, functionaries, faculty, non-teaching staff, housekeeping staff, and students. The participants collectively took the Swachhata Pledgeb in Hindi, Kannada and English, reaffirming their commitment to maintain cleanliness and honor Mahatma Gandhi s legacy. NITK Surathkal pledges to work collaboratively with the Government of India, local communities, and stakeholders to create a cleaner, greener India. STAY TUNED FOR MORE UPDATES!!!!

content.text: National Space Day: NITK Surathkal Inspires Next Generation of Space Scientists NITK Surathkal, celebrated National Space Day at NITK campus on August 23-24, 2024. The inaugural event was graced by Dr. Venkitakrishnan P.V., former Director of ISRO s Capacity Building Programme, who delivered a keynote address emphasizing India s space achievements and the importance of innovation and collaboration. Prof. B. Ravi, Director of NITK Surathkal, and Prof. Udaya Bhat K, Dean (Research and Consultancy), also addressed the gathering, highlighting the significance of space research and development. The event witnessed participation from over 10 schools, with more than 400 students attending the ceremony. The ceremony was followed by technical sessions, panel discussions, and project showcases, providing a platform for students to interact with space industry experts. Additionally, students had the opportunity to visit NITK s various research facilities, further enhancing their learning experience.

The inaugural event was graced by Dr. Venkitakrishnan P.V., former Director of ISRO's Capacity Building Programme, who delivered a keynote address emphasizing India's space achievements and the importance of innovation and collaboration.

Prof. B. Ravi, Director of NITK Surathkal, and Prof. Udaya Bhat K, Dean (Research and Consultancy), also addressed the gathering, highlighting the significance of space research and development. The event witnessed participation from over 10 schools, with more than 400 students attending the ceremony.

The ceremony was followed by technical sessions, panel discussions, and project showcases, providing a platform for students to interact with space industry experts. Additionally, students had the opportunity to visit NITK's various research facilities, further enhancing their learning experience.

content.text: NITK Celebrates 65 Years of Progress with a Renewed Vision for the Future NITK celebrated its 65th Foundation Day on 6th August by paying homage to its founding father, Shri Ullal Srinivasa Mallya. The Director Prof. B. Ravi hoisted the Institute flag and garlanded the founder s statue at the entrance gate of Surathkal campus. He recalled the vision and perseverance of Shri Mallya that led to the construction of Karnataka Regional Engineering College or KREC (now NITK), as well as the sea port, airport, railway lines, national highway, bridges and many other prominent works in Mangalore that propelled it toward prosperity. More than 300 people gathered to reminisce about the institute s glorious history and celebrate its achievements over the past six decades. Prof. S.S. Murthy, Former Director of NITK (2003 to 2005), was the Chief Guest. He emphasized the importance of excellence coupled with integrity. He said, Faculty, students and governance must be aligned and move in the same direction. Autonomy also implies accountability . He recalled many initiatives during his tenure and suggested several ideas to accelerate Institute s growth and reputation. Shri Raj Nooyi, the CEO of Plan International, a global non-profit organization dedicated to girls rights and a 1976 alumnus of KREC NITK, was the Guest of Honour. Referring to the Foundation Day, he shared the key elements of the solid foundation derived from NITK that enabled him to navigate the challenges in his career. Believe in oneself, always help others, and keep learning, he said. Shri. M. Niranjan, the President of the Bangalore chapter of NITK Alumni Association, emphasised industry-institute collaborations. He said, Faculty must regularly visit and spend time in industry. Alumni will be happy to connect the two sides. About 20 children of the NITK staff who achieved academic excellence in class X and XII were awarded certificates during the event. A merit scholarship instituted by 1981 batch alumni was also conferred. Seven faculty members and ten staff members who completed 25 years of service to NITK were felicitated.

content.text: Prof. Subhash C. Yaragal Assumes Role as Deputy Director at NITK Surathkal. Dr. Subhash C. Yaragal has taken charge as the Deputy Director of the National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK), Surathkal. on 01.08.2024. A renowned academic and experienced administrator, Prof. Yaragal s new role is a notable addition to the institute s leadership. Joining NITK Surathkal in 1996, Prof. Yaragal has played a pivotal role in the institute s growth and development. Over the years, he has held several key administrative positions, including Member of the Board of Governors, Dean (Planning Development), and Head of the Department of Civil Engineering. Prof. Yaragal s educational background is rooted in NITK Surathkal, where he completed his Bachelor s in Civil Engineering in the year 1987. He pursued higher education at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) Bangalore, earning his Master s and Doctoral degrees. The director, functionaries, staff and the entire NITK Family extended a heartfelt congratulations to Prof. Yaragal on his esteemed appointment.

Join NITK s INDIA SPACE 2030 on 23rd and 24th August 2024 NITK is proud to present India in Space 2030 , a two-day event held at the NITK campus to celebrate National Space Day 2024. This year s theme, Empowering India s Space Odyssey: Innovation, Collaboration, and Excellence , showcases the nation s significant achievements in space exploration and its aspirations for the future. NITK is immensely proud to collaborate with the Ministry of Education (MOE), Government of India (GOI) to celebrate this remarkable milestone and commemorate this year s National Space Day. The two-day event will feature Interactive sessions for school and college students Expert talks by renowned space industry professionals and NITK Faculty Competitions and challenges with exciting prize money. We invite you to participate, share this post with your network, and encourage students to be a part of this exciting event. Enroll now and be a part of this cosmic celebration!

content.text: NIT Karnataka, Surathkal Welcomes New Batch of BTech Students with Comprehensive Orientation Programme The National Institute of Technology, Karnataka, Surathkal, inaugurated its Orientation Programme for the newly enrolled BTech students of the 2024-2028 batch on August 19, 2024. The programme will continue until August 31, 2024, and aims to facilitate a seamless transition for new students into the institute s academic and research environment. Prof. B Ravi, Director of NITK Surathkal, congratulated the students and extended a warm welcome to the students and their parents. The Orientation Programme features comprehensive presentations by the Director, Deans, and faculty members, offering insights into the institute and covering various aspects of campus life, including Campus infrastructure and amenities, Educational environment and academic offerings, Research and innovation opportunities, Sports, clubs, and extracurricular activities, Specific departmental information, resources and many more. The programme is designed to equip new students with the knowledge and skills necessary to excel in their academic pursuits and make the most of their time at NITK Surathkal.

Together, We Can Make a Difference: A Call to Action by NITK Director on 78th Independence Day National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal, joined the nation in celebrating the 78th Independence Day of our motherland today, with this year s theme, Viksit Bharat , at its campus in Surathkal. Officer-Commanding Colonel Anilesh Kaushik and Captain Dr. P. Sam Johnson received the Director Prof. B. Ravi, who inspected the contingents of NCC Cadets and unfurled the National Flag. This was followed by a parade by NITK NCC cadets, NITK Kannada Medium School children, and security unit who displayed their patriotism and discipline. The event also featured some poems and speeches related to the nation, recited by NITK students, who expressed their love and respect for the motherland. Prof. Subhash C. Yaragal, Deputy Director, NITK, several institute functionaries, faculty, staff, and students attended the function.

content.text: NITK Surathkal Commemorates Partition Horrors Remembrance Day with Special Lecture Following the directives of the Ministry of Culture, Government of India, New Delhi, the National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal, hosted a guest lecture on its campus today to commemorate Partition Horrors Remembrance Day. The event aimed to raise awareness about the historical significance of the day and its impact on the nation. Dr. Vijayalaxmi, Chief Guest and Head of the History Department at Govinda Dasa College, delivered a special talk, enlightening the audience about the historical background of the partition and its aftermath. Prof. Subhash C. Yaragal, Deputy Director of NITK Surathkal, delivered the presidential remarks. In his address, he highlighted the importance of remembering and learning from the past. In his presidential address he said It is essential to understand the historical context of this event. We must learn from the past to build a more harmonious and inclusive future. As part of the event, students from NITK s DDFC (Dance, Drama, and Fashion Club) performed a thought-provoking skit that highlighted the significance of Partition Horrors Remembrance Day, effectively conveying the importance of the occasion to the audience. The event was attended by over 300 participants, including functionaries, faculty, staff, and students of NITK Surathkal.

Following the directives of the Ministry of Culture, Government of India, New Delhi, the National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal, hosted a guest lecture on its campus today to commemorate Partition Horrors Remembrance Day. The event aimed to raise awareness about the historical significance of the day and its impact on the nation.

Dr. Vijayalaxmi, Chief Guest and Head of the History Department at Govinda Dasa College, delivered a special talk, enlightening the audience about the historical background of the partition and its aftermath.

Prof. Subhash C. Yaragal, Deputy Director of NITK Surathkal, delivered the presidential remarks. In his address, he highlighted the importance of remembering and learning from the past. In his presidential address he said "It is essential to understand the historical context of this event. We must learn from the past to build a more harmonious and inclusive future."

As part of the event, students from NITK's DDFC (Dance, Drama, and Fashion Club) performed a thought-provoking skit that highlighted the significance of Partition Horrors Remembrance Day, effectively conveying the importance of the occasion to the audience. 

The event was attended by over 300 participants, including functionaries, faculty, staff, and students of NITK Surathkal.

content.text: NIT Karnataka, Surathkal Opens the Application Portal for 100 Faculty Positions NITK, Surathkal located in Mangalore has recently advertised 100 vacancies in faculty positions across departments and specializations. NITK is an Institute of National Importance ranking among the top 12 engineering institutes in India (as per NIRF 2023). Mangalore is the headquarters of Dakshina Kannada district, well connected by road, rail, air and sea to other parts of the country and world. It is an important centre of education, business, trade and tourism. Spread over nearly 300 acres with verdant greenery, situated on the shores of the Arabian sea, NITK campus provides an inspiring and peaceful ambience to its residents. The Institute attracts the brightest students from all states of India as well as overseas, and currently houses over 6500 students. Since its inception in 1960 (as Karnataka Regional Engineering College), NITK has produced over 35,000 alumni who have immensely contributed in different fields, including high value business ventures in India, USA and other countries. Nearly 275 well-qualified faculty members hailing from different parts of the country have made NITK their home. The campus has all essential amenities such as schools, healthcare centre, cooperative shops, banks, post office, food court and staff club. The NH-66 passing through the campus provides quick connect to Mangalore city and airport. The unique Central Research facility housing sophisticated instruments enables cutting-edge research. The in-house S T Park provides an exciting opportunity for incubating start-up companies.

content.text: Igniting Innovation: INSPIRE MANAK Workshop Kicks Off at NIT Karnataka, Surathkal Today marked the exciting start of the 2-day INSPIRE MANAK workshop at the Digital Library Centre, NITK Surathkal. (Million Minds Augmenting National Aspirations and Knowledge) is a prestigious initiative by the Government of India, aimed at nurturing innovation and creativity among high school students. The program encourages students in classes 6 to 10 to come up with original ideas rooted in science and societal applications. NITK s esteemed faculty members, experts in various fields of Science, Engineering, Technology and Innovation engaged with students. Faculty provided guidance to help convert their innovative ideas into prototypes. Distinguished Guests: Smt. Vani R K, Assistant Director at DSERT Bangalore, graced the occasion as the chief guest. Dr. Viral, Scientist at the National Innovation Foundation (NIF), was the guest of honor. The inaugural session was presided over by Prof. Uday Bhat, Director (in-charge) and Dean of Research and Consultancy (RC) at NITK Surathkal. The event witnessed active participation from Program Coordinators: Prof. Arun M Isloor from NITK, Dr. Mahima K, Program Coordinator from NIF. Dean Student Welfare, Faculty members, staff, and students of NITK came together to celebrate the spirit of innovation and mentorship. The workshop continues tomorrow, promising more exciting interactions and creative sparks. Stay tuned for more updates.
The Director also revealed the book Once Upon a Time in KREC, a collection of cherished recollections and stories written and edited by Shri Padmanand Warrier.

The Director also revealed the book ‚ÄúOnce Upon a Time in KREC,‚Äù a collection of cherished recollections and stories written and edited by Shri Padmanand Warrier.

content.text: NITK Alumnus Dr. SUHAS L YATHIRAJ becomes the in Para Badminton Dr. Suhas Lalinakere Yathiraj, an esteemed alumnus of the National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal (B.Tech CSE, 2004 Batch), an Arjuna awardee Indian professional Para-Badminton player became the World number one player, displacing French Mazur in the latest Badminton World Federation (BWF) World Ranking. Dr. Suhas is currently serving as an IAS officer in Uttar Pradesh. Since February 2023, he holds the position of Secretary and Director General of Youth Welfare and Prantiya Rakshak Dal, a department of the Government of Uttar Pradesh. He formerly served as the District Magistrate of Gautam Buddh Nagar. Beyond his administrative role, Dr. Suhas is a paralympic athlete who proudly represents our nation on the international stage. Here are some of his notable achievements: World No. 1 in Men s Singles: Dr.Suhas is currently ranked world No. 1 in men s singles in the Para-Badminton category. Tokyo Paralympics 2021: He won a silver medal in the SL-4 category at the Tokyo Paralympics 2021. National Champion: Suhas clinched the gold medal in the Men s Singles category at the second National Para Badminton Championships held in Varanasi in March 2018. First Indian Bureaucrat to Win International Badminton Championship: At the 2016 Asian Para Badminton Championships in Beijing, China, Suhas became the first Indian bureaucrat to win a professional international badminton championship. He secured the gold medal by defeating Hary Susanto of Indonesia in the finals while serving as the District Magistrate of Azamgarh. Yash Bharti Award: In December 2016, Suhas received Uttar Pradesh s highest civilian honour, the Yash Bharti Award, for his outstanding performances in para sports. IAS Officer and Paralympic Medalist: Suhas is the only IAS officer in India to win both a Paralympic medal and an Arjuna Award. The Director, Faculty, staff and the entire NITK family extend heartfelt congratulations to Dr.Suhas.

content.text: Sustainable Infrastructure: Innovations, Opportunities, and Challenges (SIIOC 2024) The Department of Civil Engineering has kicked off the two-day International Conference on Sustainable Infrastructure: Innovations, Opportunities, and Challenges (SIIOC 2024) today! With over 300 participants from around the globe , this conference is a melting pot of policymakers, administrators, practitioners, industrialists, scientists, researchers, academics, and students. We were honored to have Prof. T G Sitharam, Chairman AICTE, New Delhi, as the Chief Guest and Prof Darren Chain Siau Chen, Associate Professor, NUS, as the guest of honor. The event was presided over by Prof. B Ravi, NITK Director, and Dr. Subash C Yaragal, Professor and Head, Dept of Civil Engineering, NITK. The conference is a platform for deliberations on solutions that mitigate the impact of infrastructure on ecology and environment. From seismic resilient infrastructure to low carbon building technologies and affordable housing, the conference covers a wide range of themes. In his address, Prof. T G Sitharam emphasized the significant dependence of a nation s development on the establishment of sustainable infrastructure. He expressed confidence in India achieving the status of Amrit Kaal, Viksit Bharat before 2047 and encouraged all participants to contribute innovative and sustainable solutions. He highlighted the importance of Sustainable Development Goals 2030 and expressed his firm belief that sustainable development is achievable through the adoption of sustainable practices and an increase in research and development projects. Prof. B Ravi, Director of NITK, extended his sincere gratitude to the esteemed guests, conference speakers, and participants. He stressed the need to integrate modern advancements with ancient wisdom in infrastructure development and highlighted the indispensable role of academia and industry in these endeavors. Dr. Raviraj H.M. Dr. Sreevalsa Kolathayar and Dr. Pavan, from the Civil Engineering Department, NITK Surathkal, are the organizing chairs of the international conference.

content.text: Sustainability at its Best: NITK Surathkal s Commitment to a Greener Campus The National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal has proudly signed a bulk domestic Piped Natural Gas (PNG) supply agreement with GAIL Gas Limited (GGL), a 100 owned subsidiary of the Maharatna PSU, GAIL (India) Ltd. This strategic alliance was formalized in a signing ceremony graced by Prof. B Ravi, Director of NITK, and Sh. Sai Sankar B, GM (CGD) Project Head of GAIL Gas, Mangalore. The event was further dignified by the presence of Sh. Sudhir Kumar Dixit, CEO of GAIL Mangalore Petrochemicals Limited, and other distinguished members from both organizations. What This Means for NITK Surathkal: - Smart Fuel at Doorsteps: The agreement ensures the supply of PNG, an economical, user-friendly, and eco-friendly fuel, to all faculty and staff quarters within the NITK campus. - Strengthening Bonds: It reinforces the long-standing relationship between NITK and GAIL, with GAIL being a key campus recruiter, having recruited twenty students in the academic year 2023-24 alone. - Fostering Innovation: The discussions during the ceremony highlighted potential future collaborations on research, particularly focusing on the safety of distribution pipelines and the automation of system monitoring. - Enhancing Opportunities: The partnership opens avenues for increased internships and employment prospects for NITK students. NITK Surathkal is on a mission to revolutionize its campus into a hub of smart, sustainable living with a seamless PNG supply. Let s rejoice in this advance towards innovation and green practices! Embrace this blend of our rich heritage with the prospects of a cleaner, smarter future.

content.text: The National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal, enthusiastically celebrated the 10th International Day of Yoga today. Under the expert guidance of renowned Yoga Guru Shri. Radhesh Mohandas, faculty, staff, and students gathered for a special yoga session and mass demonstration on the NITK campus. The event adhered to the Common Yoga Protocol recommended by the Ministry of AYUSH and the Ministry of Education, Government of India. Participants practiced various yogic postures and pranayama, emphasizing the holistic benefits of yoga beyond physical asanas. As part of the International Yoga Day 2024 celebrations, NITK organized a Yoga camp from May 31 to June 14, 2024, open to all staff and students. Additionally, on June 18, 2024, a 30 Surya Namaskara in 30 Minutes challenge took place at NITK Surathkal, recognizing the importance of sun salutations in maintaining overall well-being. During today s event, Director-in-charge Prof. Laxminidhi, Deans, and the entire NITK community expressed their gratitude to our Hon ble Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his global efforts in promoting yoga. Director-in-charge Prof. Laxminidhi emphasized that yoga transcends mere physical exercises it is a timeless tradition that our ancestors embraced in various aspects of life. He encouraged everyone to integrate yoga into their daily routines for lifelong well-being. Other Deans, Faculty, Staff and students participated in todays .
