content.text: Energize Your Knowledge at IEEE PEDES 2024! Mark your calendars for 18 - 21 December 2024! The IEEE International Conference on Power Electronics, Drives, and Energy Systems (PEDES 2024) is gearing up to electrify the field with its biennial gathering at the scenic campus of , Mangaluru. Hosted by the Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering at , this conference is a powerhouse of innovation, sponsored by the IEEE Industry Applications Society and co-sponsored by the cre me de la cre me of IEEE societies in power electronics and energy systems. This year s conference is pivotal, as it brings together a global community to address the pressing challenges of climate change through innovative energy solutions. PEDES 2024 is your opportunity to engage with groundbreaking research and explore the latest technologies in electrical energy conversion systems and sub-systems. Expect a charged atmosphere with in-depth tutorials, and insightful paper presentations that highlight the technical prowess and breakthroughs in the field. Whether you re looking to network, collaborate, or ignite your passion for power electronics, PEDES 2024 is the place to be! Led by General Chairs R Kalpana, P Parthiban from NITK Surathkal, and Brij N Singh from John Deere, USA, PEDES 2024 promises to be an event that powers innovation and fosters connections that will shape the future of energy systems. Note: Submit your Digest by May 31st,2024. Don t miss out on this electrifying opportunity! Connect with the brightest minds in the industry and be part of a community driving change. For more information and to register, visit PEDES 2024 (

Pledge at NIT Karnataka, Surathkal Today marked a significant stride towards a drug-free India as we observed the International Day Against Drug Abuse and Illicit Trafficking. This day serves as a stark reminder of the global imperative to address the challenges posed by drugs. The theme for this year, The evidence is clear: invest in prevention, highlights the significance of evidence-based approaches in combating drug abuse and trafficking. The ramifications of drug problems are far-reaching, affecting millions around the world, from those struggling with addiction to communities disrupted by drug trafficking and the resultant crime. As directed by the Ministry of Education MyGovIndia In a show of solidarity, students, Deans, Administrative heads, Faculty, and Staff came together to pledge their commitment to this cause. We believe that investment in preventive measures yields significant benefits. Early intervention and community-driven initiatives are crucial in fostering healthier lifestyles. We call upon everyone to take action: join the movement, share this message, raise awareness, and contribute to forging a future where individuals can prosper without the constraints of drug addiction.

Golden Tribute: KREC Batch of 1973 Donates Tennis Court to NITK Surathkal Glimpse of the inaugural ceremony of Prof. A. S. Adke Tennis Academy Court 1. This significant addition to our campus facilities has been generously constructed and donated by the KREC batch of 1973, marking their golden graduation year of 2023. The inaugural ceremony took place on 27th March 2024 at NITK Surathkal. The tennis court, constructed to International Tennis Federation (ITF) standards using synthetic materials. The event was presided over by Prof. B Ravi, the esteemed Director of NITK. We were honoured to have Prof. Udaykumar Yaragatti as the chief guest for the occasion. Prof. Shrikantha S Rao, the Dean of Alumni and Corporate Relations, along with the distinguished alumni of the 1973 batch, faculty, staff, and students, participated in the event, contributing to its grand success. Prof. B Ravi expressed his gratitude, stating This generous contribution from the KREC batch of 1973 not only enriches our sports facilities but also serves as an inspiration for our students. The dedication and commitment shown by the entire batch of 1973 is a shining example of the spirit of giving back to the institution. This state-of-the-art tennis court will not only foster the sporting talents of our students but also instil in them the values of perseverance, teamwork, and dedication. A special mention must be made of Mr. Dayananda Surathkal, an alumnus from the batch of 1973, whose tireless efforts and keen oversight from day one until the project s completion were instrumental in bringing this project to fruition. The NITK community extends its deepest gratitude to the KREC batch of 1973 for their generous contribution. We look forward to nurturing future tennis champions on this state-of-the-art court.

content.text: From Concept to Reality: Advancing Technology at CRF, NITK Surathkal Transforming ideas into reality is at the core of innovation. At the Centre for Research Facilities (CRF) at NIT Karnataka, Surathkal , we are not just conducting tests; we are crafting the future. Join us behind the scenes as we delve into the meticulous world of Friction Stir Welding. This is our 201st Friction Stir Welding sample, a shining example of our dedication to bringing pioneering concepts to life. Interface Design Associates Pvt Ltd,Navi Mumbai are the manufacturers of the machine. Want to know more about CRF? Then why wait! Discover more about our research testings at CRF visit : crfnitk.ac.in Stay tuned for more updates as we continue to push the boundaries of research and development.

To join the journey towards self-reliance in sync with vision of the Hon ble Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi Ji that primarily focuses on not only to become a nation for technology adoption rather using indigenous technological development to multifaceted growth, NITK Surathkal Hosted a Technical talk on Careers in Semiconductor and Panel Discussion on Silicon Dandi March (Make in India for IC design). Technical talk was delivered by Mr. Rathnakar S Bhat from Karmic Design Pvt. Ltd. Emphasis was on how to develop indigenous technology using semiconductors for applications areas such as Medical, Automobile and Defence domains as well as challenges associated with semiconductor industries. During panel discussion, panellists Dr. Kartick Tarafder (Department of Physics, NITK Surathkal), Mr. Aditya Pai, Mr. Jayasheel Shetty and Mr. Nithish D souza deliberated on material aspects such as exploiting Gallium Arsenide and Metal Oxidant Semiconductor as Silicon has already attained saturation limit in terms of deliverables. Further, important aspects of scaling, reliability and wafer mapping are discussed with the inevitable presence of semiconductors in diversified applications ranging from Energy Water Conservation to state-of-the-art Android systems used in iPhone. Interactions concluded with queries towards chip design and manufacturing raised by the students. Participants: Approximately 500 undergraduate and Postgraduate students along with the Director, Deans, Head of the Departments, Faculty members attended the technical talk, panel discussions and witnessed the Laying of foundation stone of two facilities in Gujarat and one facility in Assam.

Ring Presentation Ceremony 2024 : Celebrating a beloved tradition at NITK Surathkal We are proud to share a glimpse of a unique tradition that sets NITK Surathkal apart from other institutions in India - the Ring Presentation Ceremony. This distinctive tradition, initiated over fifty years ago by Prof. A.S. Adke, then-principal of KREC, has been carried forward with great pride and honor. Each year, our graduating students are presented with a silver ring, etched with the NITK emblem and their year of graduation. This ceremony is special as our faculty members personally present the ring to each student, treating them as esteemed guests and wishing them well for their future endeavors. The ring serves a dual purpose - it symbolically unites the student with their cherished Alma Mater and fosters a sense of unity among KRECians NITKians across the globe. This year s ceremony, held on 28th March 2024, was a grand affair. A total of 2107 Silver rings were presented to all the outgoing students from various programmes including B.Tech, MTech, MCA, MBA, MSc, MTech Research, and PhD. Special recognition was given to the best outgoing students of the year in several categories, who received gold silver medals, student prize funds, and certificates. We were honored to have Shri S.S Nayak, a Chartered Accountant and Senior Partner at M s. S. S. Nayak and Associates, as our Chief Guest. The event was presided over by Prof. B. Ravi, the Director of NITK Surathkal, with Prof. A. C Hegde, Dean of Students Welfare, and Prof. Dwarakesh, Dean Academics, among the dignitaries. This tradition fills us with great joy as it not only honors the achievements of our students but also fortifies the connection between NITK Surathkal and its alumni. Looking forward to continuing this wonderful tradition for many more years!

CULTIVATION OF MIND SHOULD BE THE ULTIMATE AIM OF HUMAN EXISTENCE - DR. B. R.AMBEDKAR Celebrating Legacy Fostering Excellence: Dr. B R Ambedkar Jayanti at NIT Karnataka, Surathkal On the auspicious occasion of Dr. B. R Ambedkar Jayanthi on 14th April, NITK Surathkal proudly commemorated the day with a series of enriching events and the launch of visionary initiatives aimed at fostering an inclusive academic environment. The occasion was graced by our esteemed chief guest, Dr. Preethi Lolaksha Nagaveni, Lecturer in Law from the University of Lincoln, UK. The event was presided over by Prof. Dwarakish G S, Dean Academic. The event saw enthusiastic participation from our Heads of various Departments, faculty members, staff, students, and campus residents. The SC ST Cell s Drawing and Essay Writing competitions sparked creativity among faculty, staff, students, and residents, culminating in a joyous prize distribution ceremony. Cultural performances and felicitations marked the day, alongside the prestigious Best Outgoing Student Award for UG and PG SC ST scholars, celebrating academic brilliance and community spirit. Embracing Dr. Ambedkar s vision, we are excited to announce the launch of several new initiatives by the SC ST Cell of NITK Surathkal: Outreach Village: Strengthening ties with marginalized communities through impactful outreach programs. Skill Development: Equipping SC ST students with essential skills for academic and professional success. Research Excellence Awards: Celebrating scholarly achievements in high-impact publications. Faculty Mentorship: Providing personalized guidance to enhance student learning experiences. Information Booklet Website Revamp: Ensuring accessible and relevant information for SC ST students. E-Magazine: Showcasing the diverse talents and accomplishments of our students. Dedicated Counselor: Offering comprehensive support for the holistic well-being of SC ST students.

content.text: Glimpse of our Workshop AWARENESS CREATION ON NEW CRIMINAL LAWS at NIT Karnataka, Surathkal In an era where laws are the bedrock of our society, understanding them becomes a necessity. The Ministry of Education has recognised this and mandated awareness campaigns at Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) regarding the three new criminal laws to be implemented on 1st July 2024 - Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, and the Bharatiya Sakshya Adhiniyam. In line with this directive, a workshop was conducted on 25th March 2024 at NITK Surathkal. We were privileged to have Adv. (Ms.) Jayashree Rattihalli, a practicing lawyer, as our resource person. She guided the audience through the nuances of the new criminal laws, the modifications, and the implications of these modifications on stakeholders such as the common man, institutions, and the executive and judicial system. The workshop was interactive, with participation from Deans, Registrar, ICC Chairperson and PIC women welfare cell, faculty, staff, and students. We believe that understanding the law is not just for lawyers but for everyone. Let s continue to educate, engage, and empower!

FELICITATION OF NCC MANGALORE GROUP ACHIEVER CADETS A felicitation programme for the National Cadet Corps achievers of the Mangalore group was held yesterday at NITK Surathkal. The event was organised and conducted by the 2 Karnataka Engineer Company NCC on behalf of the NCC Group Mangalore. Prof. B Ravi, graced the occasion as the guest of honour, while Col N K Bhagasra, SM, Group Commander of Mangalore NCC Group, presided over the function. The ceremony was attended by Commanding Officers of all units of NCC Group Mangalore, NCC PI staff, ANOs, achiever cadets, their parents. In his address, Col N K Bhagasra, SM, expressed immense pride in the cadets and their achievements. He emphasised the need for cadets to have the courage, determination, and commitment to make a difference in people s lives. He also thanked the parents of all cadets for their continuous support and encouragement. Dr B Ravi, Director NITK, congratulated all the NCC cadets for their achievements. He urged the cadets to set a vision for the country and applauded them for their achievements. He emphasised the need for every student to partake NCC training, as NCC gives a complete package that every young person requires to mould their own personality to become a perfect example of an individual that this country requires. A total of 51 NCC cadets were honoured for their outstanding achievements in various NCC inter-directorate and inter-group competitions during 2023-24. Notably, Cadet Raghuvamshee C S represented Karnataka Goa NCC Directorate in the Best Cadet competition in the RDC 2024 at New Delhi, impressing everyone with his drill and briefing. In the Innovation competition during RDC 2024, three cadets of Mangalore Group bagged the All India first position for Karnataka Goa Directorate. The sustained hard work and dedication of these cadets have contributed significantly to Karnataka Goa NCC Directorate securing the All-India 2nd position in RDC-2024 at New Delhi, as well as getting All India 1st position in IDSSC, AITSC, and AIVSC. The programme was compered by Sergeant Vedansh Vyas, Cadet M Trivendranath, and Cadet Jeeva.

FELICITATION OF NCC MANGALORE GROUP ACHIEVER CADETS 

A felicitation programme for the National Cadet Corps achievers of the Mangalore group was held yesterday at NITK Surathkal. The event was organised and conducted by the 2 Karnataka Engineer Company NCC on behalf of the NCC Group Mangalore.

Prof. B Ravi, graced the occasion as the guest of honour, while Col N K Bhagasra, SM, Group Commander of Mangalore NCC Group, presided over the function. The ceremony was attended by Commanding Officers of all units of NCC Group Mangalore, NCC PI staff, ANOs, achiever cadets, & their parents.

In his address, Col N K Bhagasra, SM, expressed immense pride in the cadets and their achievements. He emphasised the need for cadets to have the courage, determination, and commitment to make a difference in people‚Äôs lives. He also thanked the parents of all cadets for their continuous support and encouragement.

Dr B Ravi, Director NITK, congratulated all the NCC cadets for their achievements. He urged the cadets to set a vision for the country and applauded them for their achievements. He emphasised the need for every student to partake NCC training, as NCC gives a complete package that every young person requires to mould their own personality to become a perfect example of an individual that this country requires.

A total of 51 NCC cadets were honoured for their outstanding achievements in various NCC inter-directorate and inter-group competitions during 2023-24. Notably, Cadet Raghuvamshee C S represented Karnataka & Goa NCC Directorate in the Best Cadet competition in the RDC 2024 at New Delhi, impressing everyone with his drill and briefing. In the Innovation competition during RDC 2024, three cadets of Mangalore Group bagged the All India first position for Karnataka & Goa Directorate.

The sustained hard work and dedication of these cadets have contributed significantly to Karnataka & Goa NCC Directorate securing the All-India 2nd position in RDC-2024 at New Delhi, as well as getting All India 1st position in IDSSC, AITSC, and AIVSC. The programme was compered by Sergeant Vedansh Vyas, Cadet M Trivendranath, and Cadet Jeeva. @eduminofindia @ncc_nitk @mygovindia

content.text: NITK Hosts Awareness Workshop on India s Criminal Justice Reforms NITK Surathkal organized an awareness workshop today at NITK Central Library on the newly implemented criminal justice reforms in India. The event aimed to educate the NITK community about the significant changes in the country s criminal justice system. Mr. Prithviraj Rai, a renowned Advocate, delivered a insightful presentation on the reforms, highlighting the key provisions of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS), Bharatiya Nagrik Suraksha Sanhita (BNSS), and Bharatiya Sakshya Adhiniyam (BSA). Dean of Student Welfare, Professor-in-Charge of Women s Welfare, faculty members, staff, and students took part in the event. This workshop is a step towards empowering our community with knowledge and promoting a safer and more inclusive environment , said Prof. A C Hegde. The reforms aim to strengthen citizen protection, enhance the efficiency of the justice system, and impose stricter penalties on offenders. The workshop provided a platform for the NITK community to understand the implications of these reforms and their role in promoting a safer and just society.

content.text: Yoga Club of NITK Surathkal: A Blissful Beach Yoga Session The Yoga Club of NITK Surathkal hosted a splendid yoga session on the NITK beach on March 10th, 2024, with over 120 participants. The session was led by the eminent Smt. G. Devika Purushothama, an international yoga referee and therapist, and graced by the Dean of Student Welfare, Prof. A.C. Hegde, and the Yoga Club s Faculty Advisor, Dr. V. Murugan. The beach offered a serene and natural setting for the yoga practice, which lasted for an hour and catered to all levels of yoga enthusiasts. It started with basic yoga poses and breathing exercises, and ended with a relaxing meditation. The participants enjoyed the physical and mental benefits of yoga, as well as the sense of community and friendship among them. They thanked the Yoga Club and the instructor for the wonderful event, and shared their feedback and suggestions. The Yoga Club appreciated their participation and support, and vowed to keep organizing such events to promote yoga and wellness in the NITK Surathkal community.

content.text: Celebrate the Wonders of Science with Us! Join us as we commemorate National Science Day on 28th February 2024 at LHC-C, NITK Campus. This special day is hosted by the Department of Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematical and Computational Sciences, NITK SURATHKAL Why is National Science Day so special? It marks the discovery of the Raman effect by Sir C.V. Raman, which revolutionized the field of science and earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1930. This day serves as a tribute to all scientists who have made significant contributions to the field of science. We are honored to have Prof. B Ravi, the Director of NITK, inaugurate the program. Our chief guest, Prof. Anand Narayanan from IIST, Thiruvananthapuram, will be delivering an intriguing lecture titled Mapping the Universe in Three Dimensions . This is a unique opportunity to delve into the mysteries of our universe! But that s not all! We have a science exhibition at the Science Block from 12.30 pm to 2.00 pm. Witness the marvels of science and the latest advancements in technology. Following this, we have an inter-school quiz competition from 2.45 pm to 4.15 pm at the LHC - C SH, NITK Surathkal. Test your knowledge and compete with the brightest minds! is not just a celebration of scientific achievements, but also an opportunity to inspire and motivate young minds to pursue a career in science. So, come and join us in this celebration of science. Let s ignite curiosity, foster a love for science, and inspire the next generation of scientists! See you on the 28th of February at 9.30 am at LHC-C, NITK. Let s celebrate science together!

Sharing the glimpse of today s DST-SERB sponsored workshop on Safety Data Analytics, Applications in Mining and Other Core Industries (SDAAMCI) 2024 inauguration held at the National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal. The chief guest of the workshop was Prof. Uday Bhatt, Dean R C, NITK, and the Guest of Honour was Professor Jhareswar Maiti from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kharagpur. This week-long workshop, from March 6-12, 2024, is an opportunity for professionals across various disciplines to gain expertise in safety data analytics. The workshop will provide comprehensive training on the collection, analysis, and visualization of safety data, and the application of statistical and machine learning techniques to identify patterns, trends, and risks. We are privileged to have Prof. Maiti, a distinguished educator with over 23 years of experience and a consistent listing in the top 2 researchers in the world by Stanford University ranking, as a resource for the workshop. In addition, the workshop serves as a conduit for students and professionals to connect with industry leaders and colleagues, share thoughts, and acquire knowledge of industry standards. In the current data-driven industrial landscape, the ability to analyze and interpret safety data is a vital skill. This workshop aims to equip participants with these skills, thereby opening up new career opportunities and contributing to the safety and efficiency of mining and other core industries. We welcome 25 students from various states including Karnataka, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh to this workshop. We look forward to a week of learning and growth. Stay tuned for more updates from the workshop.

NITK Surathkal Ignites the Spark of Innovation at The Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering at NITK Surathkal has set the stage for a innovative International conference - Advancements in Smart Sustainable Energy Sources Technologies and Systems (ASSETS) 2024 . The inaugural ceremony, graced by the esteemed Prof. K. Gopakumar from IISc Bangalore, and presided over by Prof. B Ravi, Director of NITK Surathkal, marked the beginning of a two-day intellectual journey into the future of energy. Prof. Gopakumar, in his inaugural address, emphasized the power of passion, self-learning, and diligence, urging participants to seize the educational opportunities within India s Higher Education Institutions. Prof. B Ravi, on the other hand, highlighted the importance of networking and maintaining an open mind. He encouraged attendees to blend the philosophies of the western and eastern world to pave the way for a smart and sustainable future. But the journey doesn t stop at presentations. Prof. Ravi stressed the need to transform ideas into tangible products, file patents, and foster industry collaborations - the true path to innovation and progress. The Head of the EEE Department at NITK, Prof. D. N. Gaonkar, along with the organizing secretaries Dr. A Karthikeyan and Dr. Yashwant Kashyap, and other faculty members, were present at the inauguration ceremony. Join us at ASSETS 2024 as we delve into a great mix of ideas promoting smart sustainable energy sources!

Congratulations to our NITK Surathkal Volleyball teams for their outstanding performance in the All India Inter NIT Sports Meet held at NIT Kurukshetra from 1st to 3rd March, 2024. Out of 20 NITs that participated in the tournament, our Girls Team clinched the Bronze Medal (3rd Place) . This was the last edition of the All India Inter NIT Sports Meet of the academic year 2023-24. We are especially delighted to share that Ms Swathi M. of our Institute was crowned as the Player of the Tournament in the Girls category . She displayed remarkable skills and leadership throughout the tournament and led her team to victory . The valedictory function was graced by the presence of Arjuna Awardee and former Indian Volleyball team captain Dr Dalel Singh Chauhan, who congratulated the winners and encouraged the participants to pursue their passion for sports . He also appreciated the efforts of the organizers and the hosts for conducting the tournament successfully . The Director, Dean SW, Registrar, Office of the SAS Officers and entire student fraternity congratulate the triumphant teams upon their grand success and wish them all the best for their future endeavours . We are NITK Surathkal and we are proud of our Volleyball stars!

content.text: NITK s Medal-Winning Streak Continues at All India Inter NIT Sports Meet 2024 We are extremely proud to announce our victory in the All India Inter NIT Sports Meet held at NIT Warangal from February 16th to 18th, 2024. The NITK Surathkal Athletics team showcased an outstanding performance, bagging a total of 11 medals including 5 Gold, 5 Silver, and 1 Bronze . Banoth Akhil was awarded the title of Best Athlete Men, winning 2 Gold medals in the 200m and 400m events. Jyotsana Achal was named Best Athlete Women, securing 2 Gold medals in the 100m and 200m events. Other notable performances include Yad Ram Meena who won Gold in Javelin Throw, Krutharth who secured a Bronze in the same event, and Hridya who won Silver in the 400m event. In the team events, the 4x400 relay men s team comprising Nishchay R, Prince PM, Lakshitha Sheshan, and Banoth Akhil won Silver. The 4 100 and 4 400 mts relay women s team consisting of Hridya, Prathyanga, Jeeva, and Jyotsana Achal also secured 2 Silver medals. In Kho-Kho, the men s team emerged as the Runners-up, winning a Silver medal. The women s team qualified to the quarter-finals. On behalf of the Director, Deans, SAS Officers and entire NITK family, we congratulate our victorious athletes. We look forward to celebrating many more of your victories in the future.

content.text: Mining Towards a Sustainable Future: Unveiling Technological Innovations and Best Practices The Department of Mining Engineering at NITK Surathkal cordially invites you to partake in the International Conference on Mining for a Greener Future: Technological Developments and Sustainable Practices (ICMFGP - 2024). The event will take place on February 16th 17th, 2024 at the LHC-C, NIT Karnataka, Surathkal This conference is designed to serve as a vibrant a platform for knowledge exchange and discussion on the latest advancements, innovative strategies and sustainable practices in the mining industry. Our focus is on fostering a future where sustainability and environmental protection are at the forefront of mining operations. Here s what you can look forward to at the conference: -The inaugural ceremony will be graced by Shri. Manoj Kumar, CMD, Central Mine Planning Design Institute Limited, as the Chief Guest. - Our Guests of Honour include Shri. R. Girish, IAS, Director, Department of Mines and Geology, GOK, Shri. Jayavibhava Swamy, IAS, Managing Director, Karnataka State Minerals Corporation Limited, and Shri. Deo Kumar, Deputy Director General of Mines Safety, South Zone, Bengaluru. - The conference is under the patronage of our Chief patron, Prof. Ravi, Director, NITK Surathkal. - We have lined up 8 expert lectures by esteemed officials, academicians, professionals, and industry experts from various central and state government sectors. - The conference offers ample networking opportunities with peers and experts from diverse domains and backgrounds. - A special session on February 17th, 2024 with Shri. P. M. Prasad, Chairman - Coal India Limited (CIL), a Maharatna Company, World s Largest Coal Producer. This session will explore prospective R D collaborations, reflecting CIL s commitment to innovation and sustainability. We envision this engagement as a catalyst for significant advancements in the mining industry. Don t miss this golden opportunity to learn, share, and network with the brightest minds in the field of mining engineering.

content.text: Mining for a : NIT Karnataka, Surathkal Inaugurates the Presenting some highlights of the successful inauguration of the International Conference on Mining for a Greener Future: Technological Developments and Sustainable Practices (ICMFGP-2024), organized by the Department of Mining Engineering at NITK. The conference aims to provide a platform for sharing knowledge, insights, and experiences on various aspects of mining engineering, such as exploration, extraction, processing, beneficiation, environmental management, safety, and social responsibility. The conference was graced by esteemed dignitaries including Shri. Manoj Kumar, CMD, Central Mine Planning Design Institute Limited, Shri. Jayavibhava Swamy, IAS, Managing Director, Karnataka State Minerals Corporation Limited, and Shri. Deo Kumar, Deputy Director General of Mines Safety, South Zone, Bengaluru. The conference was under the patronage of Prof. Ravi, Director, NITK, who urged the participants to use this platform to ideate and envision the future of mining. Other dignitaries present were Prof. Harsha Vardhan, Chairman of the Conference and HOD of Mining Dept, NITK, Conference conveners Prof. M Aruna, and Prof. M Govinda Raj. In their speeches, the dignitaries emphasized the importance of sustainable practices in mining and expressed their willingness to collaborate with NITK and innovate for a greener future. They highlighted the need for practices that minimize environmental impact, promote biodiversity conservation, and uphold the rights and well-being of local communities. The conference souvenir was unveiled by the dignitaries, and two noteworthy personalities, Dr. G R Adhikari and Mr. Prakash, were felicitated for their significant contributions to the field of mining engineering. We extend our heartfelt thanks to all the dignitaries, sponsors, event organisers, NITK faculty, staff, Alumni, students and participants.

content.text: Unleashing Innovations at NITK Surathkal Sharing the highlights of our recent workshop, Unleashing Innovations - for and from the Grassroots , held on 24th Feb 2024 at the NITK Surathkal, organized by the Institution Innovation Council (IIC) of NITK, the event was a vibrant platform for sharing best practices and fostering collaborative excellence through inter-institutional innovations. The workshop was graced by the presence of Prof. Anil Kumar Gupta, a Padma Shri awardee and a stalwart of grassroots innovations, and Prof. Anamika Dey, Director of GIAN. Their insightful talks inspired over 400 delegates from 60 engineering institutions across Karnataka. The event was a melting pot of ideas, with start-ups, entrepreneurs, and industry professionals participating in engaging discussions. The focus was on co-creation, collaboration, and addressing societal needs. Prof. Gupta urged NITK to mentor other institutions, emphasizing the power of collaborative excellence over competition. Prof. B. Ravi, Director, NITK, called for a coalition to solve local problems, especially in health and environment. Prof. Sreevalsa Kolathayar, Professor In-charge, IIC, stressed the need for a sustainable innovation ecosystem centered around community needs. Prof. Nakul Parameswar, Head Dept of Entrepreneurship and Management IIT Hyderabad, Mr . Amarendra Sahu Founder Nestaway, Prof Udaya Bhat Dean R C and other experts also participated in the discussions. Participants were encouraged to unfreeze their imagination, challenge conventional thinking, and embrace risk-taking. The success story of Pharmeasy was shared as an example of how innovative technology can revolutionize healthcare delivery. The workshop also included a visit to the NITK Science Technology Entrepreneurs Park and a Start-up Expo, where local start-ups showcased their inventions. The event concluded with a taste of local Mangaluru cuisine and a visit to the picturesque Surathkal beach.
content.original_text:
Unleashing Innovations at NITK Surathkal

Sharing the highlights of our recent workshop, 'Unleashing Innovations - for and from the Grassroots', held on 24th Feb 2024 at the NITK Surathkal, organized by the Institution Innovation Council (IIC) of NITK, the event was a vibrant platform for sharing best practices and fostering collaborative excellence through inter-institutional innovations.

The workshop was graced by the presence of Prof. Anil Kumar Gupta, a Padma Shri awardee and a stalwart of grassroots innovations, and Prof. Anamika Dey, Director of GIAN. Their insightful talks inspired over 400 delegates from 60+ engineering institutions across Karnataka.

The event was a melting pot of ideas, with start-ups, entrepreneurs, and industry professionals participating in engaging discussions. The focus was on co-creation, collaboration, and addressing societal needs. Prof. Gupta urged NITK to mentor other institutions, emphasizing the power of collaborative excellence over competition.

Prof. B. Ravi, Director, NITK, called for a coalition to solve local problems, especially in health and environment. Prof. Sreevalsa Kolathayar, Professor In-charge, IIC, stressed the need for a sustainable innovation ecosystem centered around community needs.

Prof. Nakul Parameswar, Head Dept of Entrepreneurship and Management IIT Hyderabad, Mr . Amarendra Sahu Founder Nestaway, Prof Udaya Bhat Dean R&C and other experts also participated in the discussions. 

Participants were encouraged to unfreeze their imagination, challenge conventional thinking, and embrace risk-taking. The success story of "Pharmeasy" was shared as an example of how innovative technology can revolutionize healthcare delivery.

The workshop also included a visit to the NITK Science & Technology Entrepreneurs‚Äô Park and a Start-up Expo, where local start-ups showcased their inventions. The event concluded with a taste of local Mangaluru cuisine and a visit to the picturesque Surathkal beach.üåä

content.text: Shri Narendra Modi, the Hon ble Prime Minister of India will unveil three student hostels, namely Brahmagiri, Shiwalik and Godavari at the National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal via video conference. NIT Karnataka, Surathkal Renowned for the robust infrastructure has recently enhanced the campus facility with the addition of three new hostels, namely Brahmagiri and Shiwalik (for boys), and Godavari (for girls), will be officially dedicated to the nation by the Hon ble Prime Minister of India, Shri Narendra Modi through a video conference at NITK Campus. The dedication ceremony is scheduled for Tuesday, February 20, 2024 at 11:00 am at NITK Surathkal campus. The event will be honoured by the virtual presence of Shri Dharmendra Pradhan, the Hon ble Union Minister of Education and Skill Development Entrepreneurship; Shri Thawar Chand Gehlot, the Hon ble Governor of Karnataka; and Shri Siddaramaiah, the Hon ble Chief Minister of Karnataka. The ceremony will also be graced by the esteemed presence of Shri Nalin Kumar Kateel, the Hon ble Member of Parliament from Mangaluru, Dr. Bharath Shetty Y, the Hon ble Member of Legislative Assembly from Mangaluru City North, and Prof. B. Ravi, the Hon ble Director of NITK Surathkal. Following the virtual dedication by the Prime Minister, Shri Nalin Kumar Kateel, the Hon ble Member of Parliament will address the gathering during a formal stage program at NITK Surathkal campus. The establishment of these state-of-the-art hostels is indicative of NITK s continuous effort to offer premier accommodation facilities to its students. The inclusion of these new hostels is expected to improve significantly the residential and academic atmosphere on campus, and to meet students satisfaction at NITK. content.text: Shri Narendra Modi, Hon ble Prime Minister of India, dedicated three hostels named as: Brahmagiri (boys hostel for 600 students), Shiwalik (boys hostel for 500 students), and Godavari (girls hostel for 430 students) at NITK Surathkal via Video Conference to the nation. The said project was constructed with a budget of over 130 crores. This event was a part of a larger program wherein the Hon ble PM, dedicated to the nation infrastructure projects worth Rs. 13,300 crores in the education skill sector. The dedication ceremony took place today at 11.00 am at the NITK campus. The event was graced by the virtual presence of Shri Dharmendra Pradhan, Hon ble Union Minister of Education and Skill Development Entrepreneurship; Shri Thawar Chand Gehlot, Hon ble Governor of Karnataka; Shri Siddaramaiah, Hon ble Chief Minister of Karnataka. The event was also graced by the esteemed presence of Shri Nalin Kumar Kateel, Hon ble Member of Parliament, Dhakshina Kannada, Capt. Ganesh Karnik, Veteran Indian Army and Former MLC, Karnataka, Prof. B. Ravi, Hon ble Director of NITK Surathkal, Corporators Ms. Shobha Ms. Shalini. During his speech, Shri Nalin Kumar Kateel acknowledged the developmental initiatives spearheaded by the Hon ble PM, Shri Narendra Modi. He expressed gratitude for the infrastructure development in Dhakshina Kannada, particularly at NITK. Additionally, he highlighted the active involvement of the current NITK Director, Prof. B. Ravi, in various nation-building endeavors. Prof. B Ravi, the Director expressed his gratitude to the Hon ble PM Shri Narendra Modi and the Hon ble Union Minister of Education, Skill Development Entrepreneurship Shri Dharmendra Pradhan for their relentless dedication to the nation. Prof. Ravi while addressing the gathering emphasised the significance of health in its various aspects, such as physical health, plant health with a focus on agritech, and planet health with a focus on sustainability. He also congratulated the other 33 academic and skill development institutions across the Nation.

content.text: Bank of Baroda Awards 2023 : NITK Students Rise to the Top. We are immensely proud to announce that three of our distinguished students have been conferred with the esteemed Bank of Baroda Awards 2023. Mr. Amit Kumar, from the Department of Mechanical Engineering, has been bestowed with the Best All Rounder Student Award. His commendable contributions span across various domains, including the Re-Vive project recognized by the Central Pollution Control Board, participation in the United Nations Millennium Fellowship with Campus Care Crew, and securing victory in the Vishleshan Social Analytics Competition at TAP MI Manipal. Madhav Kumar, from the Department of Computer Science, has been honored with the Best in Academic Award. His academic prowess, coupled with his active participation in college club events and his role as the co-chair of the Artificial Intelligence SIG of Web Enthusiasts Club, truly sets him apart. Sameer Prajapati, from the Department of Chemical Engineering, has been awarded the Best in Sports Award. His journey in Handball, marked by dedication, passion, and leadership, is an inspiration. NITK Director, Dean Academic, Dean Student Welfare , Faculty and Staff extended a hearty congratulations to these outstanding students on their well-deserved recognition!

Road safety is a vital issue that affects the lives of millions of people every year. Road accidents result in death or injury for many individuals, causing enormous grief and loss to their families and society. Road safety is not only a duty of the government, but also of every citizen of the country. Road Safety Month is observed from January 15 to February 14, 2024, to increase awareness and educate people about the significance of adhering to the rules and regulations of the road, and to avoid the unnecessary tragedies that happen every day. We request you to join us in this noble endeavour and take part in the Road Safety Month activities. You can also share your opinions, recommendations, and experiences on road safety with us through our social media platforms. Together, we can make our roads safer and save lives.

NITK Surathkal Sweeps All India Inter NIT Sports Meet 2024, Clinches Third Consecutive Victory. We are proud to announce that our NITK Sports contingent has won big at the All India Inter NIT Sports Meet 2024, held at NIT Jamshedpur from February 2 to 4, 2024. Our Table Tennis Men s team clinched the Overall Championship (Gold Medal) and our captain Mr Yash Potnis was crowned as the Player of the Tournament. Our Chess Men s and Women s teams both secured the 2nd Runners Up (Bronze Medal) positions and displayed excellent skills and strategy in their matches. The Director, Dean Student Welfare, Registrar, Office of the SAS Officers, Faculty and Staff congratulated the triumphant teams and praised their hard work and dedication. We are proud of our Sports contingent for bringing laurels to the institute and the state by their stellar performance. Our students have proved that is not only a hub of academic excellence, but also a powerhouse of sports talent. Join us in congratulating our winners and wishing them all the best for their future endeavours.

content.text: The Chairperson of the Board of Governors (NITK), Padma Shri Dr. Vijay Sankeshwar inaugurates the at NIT Karnataka, Surathkal Sharing snaps of the inauguration of our state-of-the-art Kindle Library, technologically advanced Digital Lab, and the newly established Akshara Cafeteria at the Central Library, NITK on 29th January 2024. This significant event was presided over by our esteemed Chairperson of the Board of Governors (NITK), Padma Shri Dr. Vijay Sankeshwar, and graced by the presence of our respected Director, Prof. B Ravi. The Kindle Library, a generous gift from the NITK 1996 alumni batch, is a significant addition to our Central Library. With 15 Kindle devices to kickstart this initiative, our patrons now have access to a vast collection of e-books and digital resources, enabling them to read and learn on-the-go. The Digital Lab, inaugurated by Padma Shri Dr. Vijay Sankeshwar, is designed for students and workshops, and is expected to increase the usage of e-resources. The Akshara Cafeteria, also located at the Central Library, offers a comfortable space for our students and staff. We are also grateful to the Centre for System Design (CSD) NITK for donating an electric two-wheeler to the Central Library, further enhancing our facilities. Our Librarian, Dr. Mallikarjun Angadi said We express our profound gratitude to the alumni of the 1996 batch, whose significant financial contribution has been instrumental in the project s fruition. Their constant and unconditional support has been a major factor in the library s advancement . The establishment of a Kindle Library is a major step forward in providing our patrons with the latest technology and resources to support their learning and growth. This initiative not only keeps our library at the forefront of technology and innovation but also offers a more environmentally friendly alternative to printed materials. Deans, Registrar, Prof. S S Kamath, PIC Learning Resources, Librarian Dr. Mallikarjun Angadi and team, Staff and students graced the occasion.

content.text: Strengthening NITK Surathkal s Healthcare Services: BEL s CSR Impact Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL), a Navratna PSU under the Ministry of Defence, Govt. of India, has donated medical and physiotherapy equipment to the Health Care Centre (HCC) at the National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK), Surathkal, as part of their Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) activities. The equipment, valued at approximately Rs. 9.54 Lakh, includes an ECG machine, a Thyroid Function Test Analyser, and a range of physiotherapy equipment. This donation is expected to significantly enhance the quality of medical treatment provided to the NITK community, benefiting around 8000 people on campus and beyond. The handing over ceremony took place on January 11, 2024, at NITK. The esteemed chief guest for the event was Shri. Shrikant Walgad, IAS, Chief Vigilance Officer, BEL, who is an alumnus of KREC NITK1986 batch. The event was presided over by the NITK Director, Prof. B. Ravi. Prof. B. Ravi, Director of NITK Surathkal, thanked Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) for their generous donation, which will improve medical treatment at NITK. He expressed hope for further collaborations under BEL s CSR scheme, benefiting academics, research, infrastructure, and student welfare. He also expressed eagerness to explore more opportunities under the BEL-CSR scheme, contributing to student and national development. The event was graced by the esteemed representatives from Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL), Bengaluru, including Shri. Shashibhushana H S, DGM of Environmental and Corporate Responsibility, and Shri Ravikant Nayak, Senior Engineer of CSR. The ceremony also witnessed the active participation of representatives from the NITK, including Prof. Srikantha S Rao, Dean of Alumni and Corporate Relations, Prof. G C. Mohan Kumar, Dean of Faculty Welfare, and Prof. K. V Gangadharan, Dean of Planning and Development, Dr. Saumya Hegde, the Professor in charge of HCC, Dr. Balabaskar, the Resident Medical Officer of NITK, and other Doctors, PICs, faculty, staff, and students.

content.text: Diplomat Deepak Vohra Ignites NITK with Vision of Viksit Bharat 2047 National Institute of Technology, Karnataka (NITK) was honored to host a talk by Diplomat Deepak Vohra (IFS) titled Viksit Bharat 2047 On to Amritkal . The event was a collaborative effort by Indian Knowledge System NITK and student clubs (Smile Club NITK, Utkrishta Bharat NITK, and NSS NITK). We were privileged to have Capt. Ganesh Karnik (Retd), former Member of the Karnataka Legislative Council, Col. Anilesh Kaushik, Officer Commanding, 2 KAR ENG COY, NCC NITK, and his wife Mrs. Anuraddha Kaushik as our distinguished guests. The function was presided over by Prof. Dr. B Ravi, Director of NITK. Mr. Vohra s talk, beginning with the phrase Yatho Dharma Tato Jaya , was a deep dive into India s rising stature in the world. He enlightened us on India s progress in infrastructure, ease of living, healthcare, citizen services, military capabilities, and more. He also highlighted India s efforts in aiding neighboring and other countries during times of crisis. His emphasis on patriotism and the importance of remembering our roots resonated with all of us. He urged us to look within for our cultural identity rather than following the Western nations, concluding with the powerful phrase Satyameva Jayate. The talk was followed by an engaging discussion between Mr. Vohra and the audience. The session concluded with the distinguished guests felicitating Mr. Deepak Vohra, with a memento as a token of thanks and appreciation. A big thank you to all the students and faculty members who attended the function and participated in the QA-discussions.
content.original_text:
Diplomat Deepak Vohra Ignites NITK with Vision of Viksit Bharat @ 2047

National Institute of Technology, Karnataka (NITK) was honored to host a talk by Diplomat Deepak Vohra (IFS) titled ‚ÄúViksit Bharat @ 2047 ‚Äì On to Amritkal‚Äù. The event was a collaborative effort by Indian Knowledge System ‚Äì NITK and student clubs (Smile Club ‚Äì NITK, Utkrishta Bharat ‚Äì NITK, and NSS ‚Äì NITK).

We were privileged to have Capt. Ganesh Karnik (Retd), former Member of the Karnataka Legislative Council, Col. Anilesh Kaushik, Officer Commanding, 2 KAR ENG COY, NCC ‚Äì NITK, and his wife Mrs. Anuraddha Kaushik as our distinguished guests. The function was presided over by Prof. Dr. B Ravi, Director of NITK.

Mr. Vohra's talk, beginning with the phrase ‚ÄúYatho Dharma Tato Jaya‚Äù, was a deep dive into India‚Äôs rising stature in the world. He enlightened us on India's progress in infrastructure, ease of living, healthcare, citizen services, military capabilities, and more. He also highlighted India's efforts in aiding neighboring and other countries during times of crisis.

His emphasis on patriotism and the importance of remembering our roots resonated with all of us. He urged us to look within for our cultural identity rather than following the Western nations, concluding with the powerful phrase ‚ÄúSatyameva Jayate.‚Äù

The talk was followed by an engaging discussion between Mr. Vohra and the audience. The session concluded with the distinguished guests felicitating Mr. Deepak Vohra, with a memento as a token of thanks and appreciation.

content.text: NITK Athletes Bring Home 16 Medals from Inter NIT Sports Meet! The NITK sports stars have once again proven their mettle at the All India Inter NIT Sports meet 2023-24 held at NIT Rourkela, Odisha. Their persistent chase for excellence has resulted in a remarkable haul of 16 Medals (5 Gold, 7 Silver, and 4 Bronze) . is more than just a competition; it s a lifestyle that promotes physical fitness and mental agility.Our students s victory is a shining example of how regular involvement can lead to remarkable accomplishments. It sends out a powerful message - that sports is not just a pastime, but a way of life that instills discipline, resilience, and teamwork. The ALL INDIA INTER NIT SPORTS MEET 2023-24 in SWIMMING AND TENNIS was held from 26th to 28th January, 2024, was a grand spectacle organized by NIT Rourkela, Odisha. Our men s swimming team made waves by securing the 1st Runners Up position! Here s a snapshot of our medalists stellar performances: Suhas PM - The Butterfly Effect! With two golds in 100m Butterfly and 400m Freestyle, Suhas made a splash! Siddh Shetty - Backstroke Bonanza! Siddh bagged two golds in 100m and 50m Backstroke events! Soham Jain - Freestyle Finesse! Soham clinched two bronze medals in 800m and 200m Freestyle! Sanjith R - Freestyle Fanfare! Sanjith secured a bronze in 100m Freestyle! Nityapriya - Freestyle Flair! Nityapriya won a gold in 200m Freestyle and a bronze in 50m Butterfly! Akriti Singh - Breaststroke Brilliance! Akriti bagged three silvers in 50m and 100m Breaststroke and 100m Freestyle! Director, Prof B Ravi, Dean Student Welfare, SAS officers, entire NITK community extends their heartiest congratulations to all our students and the team for this remarkable achievement. This achievement is not just a personal victory for our students, but also a proud moment for our institute. It highlights NITK s commitment to holistic education that encourages students to excel in academics and sports alike.

content.text: Embracing the spirit of change and learning, has taken a significant step towards sustainable transportation, alumni from the National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK) have played a pivotal role in advancing the growth of e-mobility on campus. The Mumbai Chapter of NITK Alumni Association has made a noteworthy financial contribution to support the development and expansion of an in-house designed electric two-wheeler under the Vidhyug series. Our in-house designed electric two-wheeler, part of the series, showcases our dedication to innovation and sustainability. This initiative is conceived and developed at the Centre for System Design (CSD), fosters eco-friendly transportation solutions within the campus. The vehicle was recently handed over by our BOG Chairperson, Padma Shri Dr. Vijay Sankeshwar, Chairperson, BoG NITK, and Prof. B Ravi, Director NITK, marking a momentous occasion symbolizing a step forward in the adoption of green technology on our campus. As the electric vehicle gains visibility on campus, it is expected to inspire further initiatives and innovations in sustainable technology at NITK. Our alumni s support highlights the value of community engagement and sets a benchmark for institutions aiming for sustainability and technological advancement. The Vidhyug series, conceptualized by Dr. Pruthviraj U (PIC : Transdisciplinary R D), has originated from the Center for System Design (CSD), led by Prof. K V Gangadharan, who serves as the Dean of Planning and Development. The NITK community looks forward to more such collaborative efforts, as the institute continues to be at the forefront of research and development in emerging technologies, contributing to a cleaner and greener future. Design fabrication team : Poudhan team , JRF CSD NITK Surathkal.

content.text: Are you ready to unleash your innovation potential? Do you want to learn from the best in the field of grassroots innovation and entrepreneurship? Do you want to be a part of the global network of innovation hubs and co-incubate your startup ideas? If yes, then don t miss this amazing opportunity to attend the half-day workshop on Unleashing Innovations for and from the Grassroots organized by the NITK Surathkal - Institution Innovation Council (IIC) on 24 Feb 2024 Saturday at LHC-C Seminar Hall, NITK Surathkal, Mangaluru. This workshop will feature eminent speakers like Padma Shri Prof. Anil Kumar Gupta, Former Executive Vice-Chair of the National Innovation Foundation and Founder of Honey Bee Network. Prof. Gupta was awarded the Padma Shri, one of the highest civilian awards in India , for his distinguished service in the field of grassroots innovation. Prof. Gupta will share his insights and experiences on how to foster a culture of innovation and entrepreneurship among students and faculty. You will also get to interact with Prof. Anamika Dey, Director of GIAN, who will discuss possibilities for the co-incubation of start-ups at GIAN - a global initiative that aims to create a network of innovation hubs across India and abroad, where innovators can collaborate, learn, and scale up their ideas. The program will be presided over by Prof. B. Ravi, Director of NITK Surathkal, who has always been a strong advocate for innovation, entrepreneurship and creativity. The workshop is open to faculty, students, start-ups, industry professionals, and any individual interested in innovation and entrepreneurship. There is no registration fee. Confirmation on a first come, first serve basis. Register now at So, what are you waiting for? Join this workshop and be a part of the change-makers who are transforming the world with their innovative ideas solutions. Register now and secure your seat. Let s come together to innovate for a better tomorrow.

content.text: Unveiling Pariksha Pe Charcha 2024 The day we ve all been eagerly waiting for is finally here. The 7th edition of Pariksha Pe Charcha, our beloved annual event, is ready to kick off today at 11 am. Hosted at the prestigious Bharat Mandapam, ITPO, New Delhi12, this event is a remarkable initiative by our Prime Minister Narendra Modi to engage in meaningful dialogue with students, teachers, and parents from every corner of our nation. This year, we re expecting a record-breaking attendance with nearly 205 lakh students, 14 lakh teachers, and 5.6 lakh parents having registered for the session. This is a golden opportunity to address your queries about exam stress and time management. You can catch the event live on Doordarshan, including channels like DD National, DD News, and DD India. For those who prefer online streaming, the event will be broadcasted live on the PMO, Ministry of Education, Doordarshan, MyGov.in, and the YouTube channel of the Ministry of Education. Let s come together for this enlightening session and equip ourselves with valuable insights to stay calm and composed during the exam season. Remember, our journey is not just about acing exams, it s about continuous learning and personal growth.

content.text: NITK Surathkal showcases , a revolutionary command hub for disaster response, at We are proud to announce that is a part of the , the 2nd Edition of R D Innovation Fair, held at IIT Hyderabad. Sharing the snaps of the Hon ble Minister for Education, Skill Development and Entrepreneurship, Shri Dharmendra Pradhan interacting with our team, led by Dr. Pruthviraj, showcased the trailblazing project: The System for Emergency Assistance, Response and Communication Hub (SEARCH). is a one-of-a-kind innovation that functions as a dynamic command hub with operational flexibility in diverse environments. It can be deployed in remote areas, disaster zones, or conflict regions, where conventional communication systems are unreliable or unavailable. SEARCH enables real-time data collection, analysis, and dissemination, using the technologies such as IoT, cloud computing, and AI. It also facilitates coordination and collaboration among various stakeholders, such as government agencies, NGOs, and local communities, for effective disaster responses and environment monitoring. has the potential to revolutionize the way we deal with emergencies and crises, and to save lives and livelihoods. We are grateful to IIT Hyderabad for giving us this opportunity to showcase our innovation, and to receive valuable feedback and recognition from the esteemed judges and peers. Please join us in congratulating our team, and stay tuned for more updates on .

NITK Surathkal showcases #SEARCH, a revolutionary command hub for disaster response, at #IInvenTiv2024‚ú®

We are proud to announce that #NITKSurathkal is a part of the #IInvenTiv2024, the 2nd Edition of R&D Innovation Fair, held at IIT Hyderabad. 

Sharing the snaps of the Hon'ble Minister for Education, Skill Development and Entrepreneurship, Shri Dharmendra Pradhan interacting with our team, led by Dr. Pruthviraj, showcased the trailblazing project: The System for Emergency Assistance, Response and Communication Hub (SEARCH).

#SEARCH is a one-of-a-kind innovation that functions as a dynamic command hub with operational flexibility in diverse environments. It can be deployed in remote areas, disaster zones, or conflict regions, where conventional communication systems are unreliable or unavailable. SEARCH enables real-time data collection, analysis, and dissemination, using the technologies such as IoT, cloud computing, and AI. It also facilitates coordination and collaboration among various stakeholders, such as government agencies, NGOs, and local communities, for effective disaster responses and environment monitoring.

#SEARCH has the potential to revolutionize the way we deal with emergencies and crises, and to save lives and livelihoods. We are grateful to IIT Hyderabad for giving us this opportunity to showcase our innovation, and to receive valuable feedback and recognition from the esteemed judges and peers. 

Please join us in congratulating our team, and stay tuned for more updates on #NITKSurathkal @ #Inventiv2024.üíÅüèª

@mygovindia @eduminofindia @dpradhanbjp @studentscouncil_nitk @nitk.alumni @csd_nitk @dr.pruthviraj.u

content.text: Today, we celebrate Parakram Diwas, the birth anniversary of one of India s greatest freedom fighters, Subhash Chandra Bose. His words of wisdom continue to inspire us, especially the youth. He once said, One individual may die for an idea, but that idea will, after his death, incarnate itself in a thousand lives. and It is our duty to pay for our liberty with our own blood. The freedom that we shall win through our sacrifice and exertions, we shall be able to preserve with our own strength. These powerful words remind us of the sacrifices made for our freedom and inspire us to work hard for our dreams. The wisdom and contributions of Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose are timeless and should be remembered every day. His dedication to the cause of freedom and his inspiring words continue to motivate us, especially the youth, to strive for excellence and uphold the values he fought for. Let s carry his legacy forward, not just today, but every day.

content.text: Research Highlight Tthe research conducted by Dr. Darshak R Trivedi and his team at the Department of Chemistry, NITK Surathkal, has been prominently featured on the inside cover page of the esteemed RSC- Sensors Diagnostics journal. The team has developed a colorimetric sensor that can detect and differentiate between toxic inorganic anions - arsenite and arsenate - each identified by a unique color. It is important to note that arsenic, even in minute quantities, can lead to severe health complications including cancer, DNA damage, and skin diseases. Alarmingly, over 20 of Indian land is contaminated with arsenic, affecting a population of more than 25 million. The significance of this research lies in its practical application. The team has devised a cost-effective method to detect arsenic anions in various water samples, eliminating the need for expensive instruments. This progress is a substantial step in securing water safety. We extend our heartfelt congratulations to the team members - Nagaraj K, Prof. A Nityananda Shetty, and Dr. Darshak R Trivedi - for this commendable accomplishment. Let s unite, colloborate and work towards creating a pollution-free environment through dedicated research.

content.text: The Future of Electric Vehicle Charging is Here: NITK Surathkal Showcases SUIT-EV: Smart Universal Infrastructure for Efficient Electric Vehicle Charging Electric vehicles (EVs) are the future of transportation, but they face many challenges and barriers in India. One of the most critical issues is the lack of a reliable and efficient charging infrastructure that can support the growing demand for EVs. That s why we at NITK Surathkal have developed a SUIT-EV: Smart Universal Infrastructure for Efficient Electric Charging. One of the highlights of our participation at is SUIT-EV: Smart Universal Infrastructure for Efficient Electric Vehicle Charging developed by a team led by Dr. B. Dastagiri Reddy. This research introduces a groundbreaking solution for electric vehicle (EV) charging, offering both AC and DC charging capabilities, enhanced power quality, and V2X features. This innovative approach addresses key industry needs, such as dual grid charging, adaptability to existing EVs, and retrofitting capability. The has the potential to revolutionize the charging infrastructure and promote a , -energy future. We are proud to share that our team had the privilege of interacting with Hon ble Minister for Education, Skill Development and Entrepreneurship, Shri Dharmendra Pradhan, at the . Dr B. Dastagiri explained the salient features and benefits of the to the minister, who appreciated the team s efforts and encouraged them to pursue further research and innovation. Join us at , the biggest R D fair at IIT Hyderabad where we are showcasing our amazing innovations. We will keep you posted on the latest happenings at . Stay connected and follow us on our social media for more updates.

National Institute of Technology, Karnataka, Surathkal Take a look at NITK Surathkal showcasing non-acrid aroid cubes at , India s largest R D Innovation Fair from Higher Education Institutions at IIT Hyderabad. Our team, led by Prof. Prasanna, had the honour of interacting with the Hon ble Minister for Education, Skill Development and Entrepreneurship, Shri Dharmendra Pradhan, showcasing the novel technology of Ready to cook, non-acrid Aroid tubers . Prof. Prasanna and team presented their innovative technology of producing ready to cook, non-acrid aroid cubes from root vegetables such as elephant foot yam, taro, tannia and giant taro. These cubes are safe, convenient, nutritious and affordable, and can be stored for 3 months at room temperature. They also benefit the farmers by increasing their income and reducing wastage. The team hopes to inspire many young minds to pursue research and entrepreneurship in the field of food technology. The team thanked the organizers and the Hon ble Minister for Education, Skill Development and Entrepreneurship, NITK Director Prof. B. Ravi for their support and encouragement. Want to know more, our social media pages for more updates and photos from the the first-of-its-kind, largest R D fair showcasing the Technological Innovations from Premiere Indian Higher Education Institutions.

NITK and BMVNTFSA Sign Skill Development Center MOU to Foster Master Trainers On the 23rd of January, 2024, a formal Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) was signed between the National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK) and The Society for Bharat Ratna Sir M. Visvesvaraya National Training Facility for Skills for All (BMVNTFSA), which is located in Angatta village, in close proximity to Muddenahalli, Chikkaballapur. The MOU signifies the commitment of both parties to work jointly towards a structured and effective training program aimed at developing Master Trainers in various fields of engineering and technology. The BMVNTFSA Society has expressed its desire to collaborate with NITK for the promotion and conduction of Masters technical training courses to eligible trainees, with the goal of enhancing their engineering skill set and workplace performance. Both parties are keen to promote the concept of Skills Training, with the aim of creating Master Trainers for organizations. This initiative is intended to up-skill existing employees in a structured and effective manner through a cooperative and collaborative model. Dean Alumni and Corporate Relations, Prof. Shrikantha S Rao, Srinivas Rao Kulkarni, Director, BMVNTFSA, and former, Rtd. Prof. Vijay Desai were present during the MoU exchange.

National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal, Celebrates National Youth Day On this auspicious day, we commemorate the birth anniversary of the Great Swami Vivekananda, who inspired millions of young minds with his vision and wisdom. We wish the youth of the Nation a Happy National Youth Day, and hope that they follow footsteps in serving the society and the Nation. We cordially invite you to join us in today s National Youth Day celebration at NITK Surathkal. We are privileged to have Swami Sarwasthanandhaji, the esteemed Head of the Ramakrishna Vedhantha Center, London, gracing the event as our chief guest. Our respected Director, Prof. B Ravi, will be presiding over the event. We extend a warm invitation to all as we assemble to pay homage and appreciate the wisdom of Swami Vivekananda, the guiding light for our nation s youth. Let s come together in a spirit of mutual inspiration and learning. Let s live by his words of wisdom: ARISE, AWAKE AND STOP NOT TILL THE GOAL IS REACHED - The mantra for the young generation, to chaee the dreams with courage and persistence.

NITK Students Shine in All India Inter-NIT Tournament We are proud to announce that our students have won the Gold and Bronze medals in Hockey and Cricket, respectively, in the All India Inter-NIT Tournament held at NIT Trichy from January 5th to 8th, 2024. This is a remarkable achievement that showcases the talent and dedication of our students and the SAS officers who trained them. We are immensely proud of their performance and we congratulate them on their success. Please join us in celebrating this momentous occasion by liking and sharing this post. We hope to see more such victories in the future. !

content.text: NITK Surathkal celebrated the 75th Republic Day and the Institute witnessed the Ceremonial Parade by NCC cadets, NITK Kannada and English medium school students and security staff. The Director of NITK, Prof. B. Ravi highlighted the importance of self sustainability. Parade was attended by Col Anilesh Kaushik, ANOs and PI staff of 2 Kar Engr Coy NCC. Students from various clubs participated in several cultural events.

National Youth Day at NITK Surathkal : A Confluence of Tradition, Knowledge, and Inspiration NITK Surathkal celebrated the National Youth Day on 12.1.24 to commemorate the birth anniversary of Swami Vivekananda. The event was jointly organized by the and the Indian Knowledge System,NITK. The chief guest of the event was Swami Sarvasthanandaji, the head of Ramakrishna Vedanta Centre, London, the guest of honor were Swami Jitakamanandaji, Adhyaksha, Ramakrishna Math Mangalore Centre and Capt. Ganesh Karnik, a veteran of the Indian Army. The event was presided by our Director, Prof. B. Ravi. The event featured various cultural events, quiz programs, panel discussions on topics related to Swami Vivekananda s philosophy and vision for India. In his initial remarks,Director, Prof. B Ravi, thanked the distinguished guests for their gracious presence to enlighten and inspire the students. He expressed his hope that the students would imbibe the values principles of Swami Vivekananda and strive to make a positive difference in the world. He emphasized that the Golden milk or turmeric latte from the Indian Knowledge System has evolved in the western world. This is from our traditional Haldi-milk. Similarly, intermittent fasting, which is part of Indian Knowledge System, is getting popular all over the globe. Hence, he urged students to understand and research our ancient past the Indian Knowledge System. Chief guest, Swami Sarvasthanandaji, emphasized compassion and urged youth to contribute to the welfare of the underprivileged. He encouraged the youth to disseminate the learning acquired at NITK. Swami Jitakamananda inspired the youth to build the nation through holistic education, emphasizing character development and physical health. He advocated for the concentration of the mind using Indian yogic knowledge. Capt. Ganesh Karnik, urged students to follow Swami Vivekananda s teachings for a prosperous India. He said: Be rooted to take wings, to be rooted, follow s path .

content.text: Unleashing Innovations at NITK Surathkal Sharing the highlights of our recent workshop, Unleashing Innovations - for and from the Grassroots , held on 24th Feb 2024 at the NITK Surathkal, organized by the Institution Innovation Council (IIC) of NITK, the event was a vibrant platform for sharing best practices and fostering collaborative excellence through inter-institutional innovations. The workshop was graced by the presence of Prof. Anil Kumar Gupta, a Padma Shri awardee and a stalwart of grassroots innovations, and Prof. Anamika Dey, Director of GIAN. Their insightful talks inspired over 400 delegates from 60 engineering institutions across Karnataka. The event was a melting pot of ideas, with start-ups, entrepreneurs, and industry professionals participating in engaging discussions. The focus was on co-creation, collaboration, and addressing societal needs. Prof. Gupta urged NITK to mentor other institutions, emphasizing the power of collaborative excellence over competition. Prof. B. Ravi, Director, NITK, called for a coalition to solve local problems, especially in health and environment. Prof. Sreevalsa Kolathayar, Professor In-charge, IIC, stressed the need for a sustainable innovation ecosystem centered around community needs. Prof. Nakul Parameswar, Head Dept of Entrepreneurship and Management IIT Hyderabad, Mr . Amarendra Sahu Founder Nestaway, Prof Udaya Bhat Dean R C and other experts also participated in the discussions. Participants were encouraged to unfreeze their imagination, challenge conventional thinking, and embrace risk-taking. The success story of Pharmeasy was shared as an example of how innovative technology can revolutionize healthcare delivery. The workshop also included a visit to the NITK Science Technology Entrepreneurs Park and a Start-up Expo, where local start-ups showcased their inventions. The event concluded with a taste of local Mangaluru cuisine and a visit to the picturesque Surathkal beach.

content.text: Presenting the highlights from the successful inauguration of the 2nd International Conference on Data, Decision, and Systems (ICDDS 2023) at the National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK), Surathkal. This conference, a collaboration with the IEEE Bangalore Computer Society Chapter, IEEE NITK SB, Bosch, Ericsson, and Boeing. The conference was inaugurated by Ms. Nita Patel, the esteemed President of the IEEE Computer Society for the year 2023. We were also privileged to have Dr. Prasant Misra, Chairperson of the IEEE Computer Society Bangalore Chapter, grace the occasion as our guest of honour. The inaugural function was presided over by Prof. Dwarakish G S, Dean Academic, NITK Surathkal. We extend our heartfelt gratitude to our distinguished guests and dignitaries: Dr. Mohit P Tahiliani, Chair, IEEE Mangalore sub-section; Mr. Dilip K Dalai, Scientist F DRDO; Prof. Simhan, Southern Georgia University, USA, General Chair; Prof. Annappa B, General Chair; Prof. Pushparaj Shetty D, Organising Chair; and Dr. Sourav Kanti Addya, Organising Chair. The conference, scheduled for the 1st and 2nd of December 2023, promises to be a platform for stimulating discussions and exchange of innovative ideas. We look forward to your participation and engagement.

content.text: We are proud to announce that the images of our new state of the art Centre of Interdisciplinary Studies and Central Research Facility, built with all sustainability measures into consideration in compliance with GRIHA 3 star rating, i.e., green building system, at NITK Surathkal, has been featured on the cover page of the Indian Concrete Journal s December 2023 issue which is one of the oldest and most reputed journals on Civil Engineering in India. The Central Research Facility (CRF), a regional hub for innovation and is equipped with more than 60 high-end equipment, which are dedicated to fostering interdisciplinary research and innovation in various domains. We invite you to visit the CRF website at to learn more about the CRF and its advanced equipment, which are available for researchers from academia and industry. The CRF offers state-of-the-art facilities for material characterization, structural testing, computational modelling, and data analysis, etc. We look forward to welcoming you to our facility and our vibrant research community at the CRF, NITK Surathkal.

content.text: Attention all data enthusiasts! We are delighted to announce the 2023 2nd International Conference on Data, Decision and Systems (ICDDS 23), happening on December 1-2, 2023. This event is a flagship conference of the IEEE Computer Society Bangalore Chapter and aims to foster innovation in data-based technologies across various disciplines. We are inviting researchers, engineers, and experts from academia, industry, and start-ups to enhance their knowledge on the latest innovations in Data Decision Systems (DDS) and their applications. The conference will cover all aspects of data and decision science, applications, solution design, and system challenges, ranging from theory to applied research. Don t miss this opportunity to connect and learn from experts, and contribute to the ever-evolving field of data and decision science. Mark your calendars and stay tuned for more updates!
