content.text: National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal: Alumni Reunion 2023 - Celebrating Lifelong Connections and a Unified Vision We were honored to host a reunion for our distinguished alumni from the classes of 1998, 2001, and 2003. This event marked their 25th, 22nd, and 20th graduation anniversaries, and was a time of celebration, reconnection, and reminiscence. Our alumni, who have soared to great heights in diverse fields have made significant contributions to our nation s progress. They truly embody the spirit of NITK, and we are privileged to count them as members of our extended family. A total of 245 alumni joined the celebration, including 90 from the 1998 batch, 120 from 2001, and 35 from 2003. We had alumni who joined the reunion from all over the globe - the US, Brazil, and Singapore! We welcomed back 40 MCA graduates from the 1995-2000 batches on December 16th 2023. Our Director, Prof. B. Ravi, shared his vision for NITK - Global Excellence with Local Relevance. He spoke about NITK, our pledge to make India a global leader in innovation and technology by its 100th year of independence. The alumni appreciated the call for Mission NITK: Good to Great . During their stay, our alumni had the opportunity to tour the Central Research Facility (CRF), a regional hub for innovation and entrepreneurship equipped with more than 60 high-end equipment. A notable element of the reunion was the nostalgic sojourn to the NITK beach. The beach visit brought back cherished memories and was a wonderful addition to their reunion. We extend our sincere thanks to our alumni for their generous contributions to the NITK Alumni Endowment Fund. These donations reflect their deep-rooted affection for their alma mater and their commitment to fostering future generations of KREC NITK graduates. Special thanks to the Director, Office of the Dean ACR, other Deans, PICs, Faculty and Staff of NITK involved in this KREC NITK alumni reunion event 2023. We invite all alumni to visit NITK and witness the growth and development of your alma mater.
content.original_text:
‚ú®National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal: Alumni Reunion 2023 - Celebrating Lifelong Connections and a Unified Vision‚ú®

We were honored to host a reunion for our distinguished alumni from the classes of 1998, 2001, and 2003. This event marked their 25th, 22nd, and 20th graduation anniversaries, and was a time of celebration, reconnection, and reminiscence.

Our alumni, who have soared to great heights in diverse fields have made significant contributions to our nation's progress. They truly embody the spirit of NITK, and we are privileged to count them as members of our extended family.

A total of 245 alumni joined the celebration, including 90 from the 1998 batch, 120 from 2001, and 35 from 2003. We had alumni who joined the reunion from all over the globe - the US, Brazil, and Singapore! We welcomed back 40 MCA graduates from the 1995-2000 batches on December 16th 2023.

Our Director, Prof. B. Ravi, shared his vision for NITK - Global Excellence with Local Relevance. He spoke about NITK@2047, our pledge to make India a global leader in innovation and technology by its 100th year of independence. The alumni appreciated the call for 'Mission NITK: Good to Great'. 

During their stay, our alumni had the opportunity to tour the Central Research Facility (CRF), a regional hub for innovation and entrepreneurship equipped with more than 60 high-end equipment. A notable element of the reunion was the nostalgic sojourn to the NITK beach. The beach visit brought back cherished memories and was a wonderful addition to their reunion.

We extend our sincere thanks to our alumni for their generous contributions to the NITK Alumni Endowment Fund. These donations reflect their deep-rooted affection for their alma mater and their commitment to fostering future generations of KREC/NITK graduates.

Special thanks to the Director, Office of the Dean ACR, other Deans, PICs, Faculty and Staff of NITK involved in this KREC/NITK alumni reunion event 2023.üôè

We invite all alumni to visit NITK and witness the growth and development of your alma mater. @eduminofindia @nitk.alumni @studentscouncil_nitk #goodtogreat #missionNITK #alumni #reuni

content.text: Introducing VidhYug 2.2.1, the innovative e-scooter at NITK Surathkal NITK Surathkal is at the forefront of a transformative shift in campus transportation by integrating Artificial Intelligence (AI) to optimise the usage of electric vehicles (EVs). This pioneering initiative is headed by Dr. Pruthviraj U, Project Head of the E-Mobility Team at the Centre for System Design (CSD), Professor In Charge Transdisciplinary R D, and Prof. K V Gangadharan, Coordinator of CSD and Dean of Planning and Development at NITK Surathkal. The E-Mobility project at CSD NITK is a remarkable display of dedication to sustainable transportation. The team has developed a diverse fleet of electric vehicles, including 15 E-cycles, 5 e-scooters, 2 e-bikes, an e-trike for organic waste collection, and a specially designed quad bike for the physically challenged with additional innovations in the pipeline. AI algorithms are employed to predict demand patterns and optimise the deployment and routing of these vehicles across the campus. The system s predictive maintenance feature enhances vehicle reliability and extends the lifespan of the EV fleet, exemplified by the current e-scooter model, VidhYug 2.2.1. This model, specifically designed for the hostel office at NITK and financially supported by the Mumbai chapter of the NITK Surathkal Alumni Association, represented by Shri. S R Bala, NITK Surathkal Alumni Association Global Secretary, symbolises user-friendly mobility solutions developed by the team.The innovative minds behind this vehicle include Poudhan Kumar, Dixith K, Manish E S, Vikas, Maclin, Niranjan, Prakash, and Shradha Shetty. Today, at NITK SURATHKAL campus, the Director, Prof. B Ravi handed over the keys to the Chief Warden Prof. Pushparaj Shetty and team. The event was graced by the presence of Prof. Srikanth S Rao, the Dean of Alumni and Corporate Relations, Prof. K V Gangadharan, the Dean of Planning and Development, Hostel Wardens, faculty members, Hostel staff, and students.

Jai Hind!

content.text: Are you interested in learning about the latest developments in ocean wave energy conversion technology and modelling techniques? Do you want to explore the potential of wave energy as a renewable and sustainable source of power? If yes, then join us for an exciting short-term course on Ocean Wave Energy Conversion Technology and Modelling Techniques from 27th November to 1st December, 2023. This course is organized by the Department of Water Resources and Ocean Engineering at the National Institute of Technology Karnataka, under the GIAN program, MoE, Govt. of India. We are honoured to have Prof. Matt Folley, a renowned expert and researcher in offshore renewable energy, as the main instructor of this course. He will share his insights and experience on various aspects of wave energy conversion, such as design principles, novel concepts, maintenance challenges, and safety implications. This course will help you to understand the fundamentals of wave energy conversion, assess different techniques and technologies, and apply modelling tools to evaluate their performance and feasibility. You will also learn about the current state of the art and the future prospects of wave energy development. This course will be beneficial for researchers, scientists, engineers, students, and anyone who is interested in the field of ocean wave energy. Don t miss this opportunity to learn from one of the best in the field and interact with other participants who share your passion and curiosity.

content.text: NITK Surathkal Stands with Viksit Bharat : Pledging Support for a Developed India Our Hon ble Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, has inaugurated the Viksit Bharat : Voice of Youth initiative today through a virtual event. This initiative aligns with his aspiration to actively engage our nation s youth in shaping our national plans, priorities, and objectives. At the National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal, we are deeply motivated by this powerful initiative. NITK Director, Prof. B. Ravi delivered a special message on The faculty, students, staff and residents of National Institute of Technology Karnataka at Surathkal are greatly inspired by the clarion call of our Honourable PM for Viksit Bharat 2047. In line with this vision, we are creating our our Institute mission and collective action plan for a holistic and life-long learning environment to create valuable professionals, change makers and thought leaders for the nation . said Prof. B. Ravi. The Government of India envisions Viksit Bharat as a roadmap to transform India into a developed nation by 2047, marking the centenary of our independence. We, at NITK Surathkal, pledge our commitment to contribute to this national vision. Let s unite to make the dream of a developed India by 2047 a reality. Together, we can shape a brighter future!

We are delighted to share the outstanding achievements of our teams at the All India Inter NIT Sports Meet in Basketball and Badminton 2023-24, held at MNIT Jaipur from 14th to 16th October, 2023. Keep shining, NITK!

content.text: NITK NSS Unit Embarks on Amrit Kalaash Yathra : Honouring Our Land, Honouring Our Heroes NITK NSS Unit successfully conducted the Amrit Kalaash Yathra under the inspiring motto - Meri Maati, Meri Desh . This initiative is a part of the nationwide campaign Meri Maati Mera Desh , launched as a culminating event of Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav . It is a tribute to the bravehearts who have made the supreme sacrifice for our country. The event was inaugurated by our esteemed NITK Director, Prof. B Ravi. We were also honored by the presence of Dean Student Welfare Prof. A C Hedge, Dean R C Prof. S. M. Kulkarni, Joint Registrar Shri Ram Mohan Y, NSS Coordinator Prof. Veershetty Gumptapure, NSS Officers Dr. Shwetha. H. R and Dr. Ravi Raushan, along with our enthusiastic students and staff members, who actively participated in the event, making it a grand success. The event was marked by several significant activities including pledge taking, tree plantation, and an inspiring Amrit Kalaash Yathra procession. Meri Maati Mera Desh envisions a unified celebration of India s soil and valour, commemorating the nation s journey of freedom and progress. By connecting with the land and honoring our heroes, this program instills a sense of national pride and inspires future generations to protect India s cherished heritage. We extend our heartfelt thanks to everyone who joined us in this journey of celebrating our land and our nation.

content.text: National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal Celebrates National Unity Day On October 31, 2023, National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK), Surathkal, celebrated the National Unity Day, also known as Rashtriya Ekta Diwas, in honor of the birth anniversary of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel. As part of the Unity Week held from October 25th to October 31st, 2023, NITK organized a series of events including a Unity Run and a Unity Pledge. The week-long celebration culminated today with the commemoration of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel s birth anniversary. The Unity Run saw enthusiastic participation from Director Prof. B Ravi, Dean Student Welfare Prof. A C Hegde, other Deans, Administrative heads, NITK Teaching and non-teaching staff along with students. The participants took a pledge to uphold the unity, integrity and security of the nation and to support its cause. NITK Surathkal is proud to have been part of this nationwide initiative that promotes unity in diversity and the spirit of harmonious co-existence and brotherhood.

content.text: Champions aren t made in gyms, they are made from something deep inside them- a desire, a dream, a vision. Presenting our champions in the All India Inter NIT Sports Meet 2023-24!! Held at NIT Durgapur from 3rd to 5th November 2023, our athletes showcased their mettle and brought home numerous accolades. In the realm of Power Sports, we emerged as the Overall Champions in Bodybuilding, bagging 3 gold, 2 silver, and 1 bronze medals. The spotlight was on Mr. Junaid Jameel from NITK, who was crowned the Best Bodybuilder. Our prowess extended to Weightlifting, where we clinched the 2nd runner-up position with 1 gold, 1 silver, and 1 bronze medals. In Powerlifting, our team demonstrated their strength by securing 2 silver and 1 bronze medals. On the football field, our team battled their way to the Quarter Final level, displaying exceptional teamwork and skill. We are incredibly proud of our athletes for their dedication, hard work, and sportsmanship. Join us in congratulating all the participants and winners!

content.text: NITK Surathkal has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Marelli (India) Pvt. Ltd. This collaboration aims to enable student upskilling activities as part of the Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) initiatives of Marelli. The MoU was signed by Prof. B. Ravi, Director, NITK Surathkal, and Mr. Ravi Tallapragada, President, Marelli, on 4th October 2023. The focus of this collaboration is to offer opportunities for skill development, upgradation, and reskilling in the high-tech automotive sector for our UG, PG, and Ph.D. students. As part of this collaboration, the NITK-Marelli CSR Project Kick-off and Product Showcase event was organised on 13th October 2023 at the Digital Library Complex, e-Library Complex, NITK Surathkal. The event was graced by Mr. Muralidhar M. K., Senior Director and Head, Technical R D, Marelli as the chief guest. Ms. Anju Bhadoria (Director of Human Resources), Ms. Anjali Diwaker (Country Head for CSR Sustainability), and Ms. Saranya Tibrewal (Senior Manager) were our esteemed Guests of Honour. The event was presided over by Prof. S.M. Kulkarni, Dean (Research Consultancy), NITK Surathkal, and Prof. Shrikant Rao (Dean, Alumni Corporate Relations) was also present. We extend our gratitude to Dr. Sowmya Kamath S., Associate Professor, Dept. of Information Technology, who is the faculty-in-charge of the collaboration activities, along with team members Prof. Ananthanarayana V.S., Professor, Dept. of IT and Dr. Geetha V., Associate Professor, Dept. of IT. The event was attended by several team members from Marelli and our UG, PG and Ph.D. students of NITK. A wide variety of automotive technology products and software systems offered by Marelli were showcased and demonstrated by the Technical Team for the benefit of students and tech enthusiasts attending the event. We look forward to a fruitful collaboration with Marelli and are excited about the opportunities this partnership will bring to our students.
content.original_text:
NITK Surathkal has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Marelli (India) Pvt. Ltd. This collaboration aims to enable student upskilling activities as part of the Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) initiatives of Marelli.

The MoU was signed by Prof. B. Ravi, Director, NITK Surathkal, and Mr. Ravi Tallapragada, President, Marelli, on 4th October 2023. The focus of this collaboration is to offer opportunities for skill development, upgradation, and reskilling in the high-tech automotive sector for our UG, PG, and Ph.D. students.

As part of this collaboration, the NITK-Marelli CSR Project Kick-off and Product Showcase event was organised on 13th October 2023 at the Digital Library Complex, e-Library Complex, NITK Surathkal. The event was graced by Mr. Muralidhar M. K., Senior Director and Head, Technical R&D, Marelli as the chief guest. Ms. Anju Bhadoria (Director of Human Resources), Ms. Anjali Diwaker (Country Head for CSR & Sustainability), and Ms. Saranya Tibrewal (Senior Manager) were our esteemed Guests of Honour.

The event was presided over by Prof. S.M. Kulkarni, Dean (Research & Consultancy), NITK Surathkal, and Prof. Shrikant Rao (Dean, Alumni & Corporate Relations) was also present. We extend our gratitude to Dr. Sowmya Kamath S., Associate Professor, Dept. of Information Technology, who is the faculty-in-charge of the collaboration activities, along with team members Prof. Ananthanarayana V.S., Professor, Dept. of IT and Dr. Geetha V., Associate Professor, Dept. of IT. The event was attended by several team members from Marelli and our UG, PG and Ph.D. students of NITK.

A wide variety of automotive technology products and software systems offered by Marelli were showcased and demonstrated by the Technical Team for the benefit of students and tech enthusiasts attending the event.

We look forward to a fruitful collaboration with Marelli and are excited about the opportunities this partnership will bring to our students.

content.text: Celebrating the 121st Birth Anniversary of Sri U. Srinivas Mallya: The Visionary Founder of NITK and the Father of Modern Dakshina Kannada District On this auspicious occasion, we paid our respects to his statue at NITK campus, which was garlanded by the Director-in-charge Dean R C Prof. S. M Kulkarni, Registrar, Dean Faculty Welfare, Dean Student Welfare, Dean Academic, Dean Planning Development, NITK Alumni, Staff and students at 09:00 AM today. Mallya was a philanthropist who donated generously to various causes such as education, health, social welfare, and religious activities. He also supported the promotion of Gandhiji s programmes like Khadi and Village Industries, entry of Dalits to temples, implementation of Hindi as a national language, eradication of untouchability. His vision led to the construction of the New Mangalore Port, Bajpe airport, National Highway 66, and most importantly, the Karnataka Regional Engineering College (now National Institute of Technology, Karnataka). In the light of this significant occasion, our esteemed Director, Prof. B Ravi, extends his deepest respects and heartfelt sentiments. He shares, As we stand on the threshold of the 121st birth anniversary of Sri U. Srinivas Mallya, we are reminded of the indomitable spirit and visionary foresight of a man whose legacy continues to illuminate the path for all of us at NITK Surathkal. Today, we not only remember and honor his extraordinary contributions but also reaffirm our unwavering commitment to uphold and further the values and vision he instilled in us. His enduring legacy serves as a guiding light, leading us towards a future filled with promise and potential. His life teaches us that one person can indeed make a significant difference in society. His legacy continues to inspire and will do so for generations to come. Let s stirve to follow in his footsteps, contributing to our society and nation in our own unique ways.

content.text: A Successful Drug-Free Awareness Campaign in Mangaluru The Mangaluru City Police successfully organized the Drug-Free Awareness Campaign (Walkathon) , which took place yesterday from 4-7 pm. More than 4000 students joined this public event, demonstrating their commitment to a drug-free society. Among them were students from NITK NSS team, NITK NCC team - 2 KAR ENGR COY who showed immense enthusiasm and spirit. Sincere thanks to Dean Student Welfare Prof. A C Hegde, Dr Kiran Manjappa (Nodle officer of the mission from NITK), NSS Coordinator Dr Veer Shetty, and NCC Officer Dr Sam Johnson for their exceptional coordination and support that motivated the students to actively participate in this event. A special mention to our students who participated in the event. Your efforts and public concern have made a significant impact on our mission towards a drug-free society. Let s continue to work together for a healthier and safer society. Remember, every step counts!

content.text: We are thrilled to share that another esteemed faculty member of the National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal, has achieved a significant milestone. Dr. P. Jeyaraj, a Professor in the Department of Mechanical Engineering, has been recognized as one of the world s top 2 scientists by Stanford University! Dr. Jeyaraj s pioneering work in the fields of Dynamics of Heated Structures, Bio-composites, and Acoustics is making a profound impact. One of his notable contributions is addressing the issue of noise pollution - an often overlooked problem that can disrupt the tranquility of auditoriums and meeting halls. Traditional sound absorption materials can be toxic and pose health risks. In response to this challenge, Dr. Jeyaraj and his team have ingeniously developed sound absorption panels made from bio-degradable materials like natural fiber (Areca-husk) and bio-composites. These eco-friendly alternatives not only effectively absorb sound but also ensure safety for human health and the environment. We extend our heartiest congratulations to Dr. Jeyaraj for this well-deserved recognition and look forward to his continued contributions to science and engineering.

content.text: The International Conference on Gender Studies at NITK was a resounding success! Over 300 experts gathered to discuss the multifaceted aspects of gender, sexuality, and societal constructs. The event was a testament to the importance of gender studies in today s evolving world. Swipe left to see some highlights from the conference!

We re absolutely ecstatic to announce that Prof. Shashidhar G Koolagudi, an esteemed faculty member from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at NITK, has earned a place among the top 2 of scientists globally! This prestigious recognition comes from none other than Stanford University for his outstanding contributions in the year 2023. At the helm of a dynamic team of around twenty individuals at the Speech and Audio Processing Lab at NITK, Prof. Koolagudi is leading the charge in exploring the fascinating world of speech and audio signals. Speech, being the natural mode of human communication, has several practical applications. As Prof. Koolagudi says, We can effectively use speech of a person during nativity identification, polygraph test (Lie detection), forensic applications and so on . He also highlights how audio processing capability of a personal digital assistant can make it smarter to behave accordingly in different situations. The team s collaborations span across research, academic and industrial organisations like Father Muller Hospital Mangaluru, MAHE Manipal, AIISH Mysuru and others. They have successfully implemented three funded research projects with one more in progress. Prof. Koolagudi holds two granted and four published Indian patents. He has also published more than 50 journal articles and 100 conference papers on reputed national and international platforms. We are incredibly proud of Prof. Koolagudi s achievements and his contributions to our institute. Join us in congratulating Prof. Koolagudi on this remarkable achievement! NITK Students Council NITK Surathkal Alumni Association

content.text: NITK Surathkal, let s make a difference together! On October 1, 2023, at 10:00 am, we re hosting a campus-wide cleanliness drive as part of the Swachhata Hi Seva and Ek Tareekh- Ek Ghanta campaigns. This is more than just a clean-up event. It s a chance for us to come together as a community, to take pride in our campus, and to make a positive impact on our environment. Remember, the change we want to see in the world begins with us. So let s roll up our sleeves, inspire others with our actions, and show that we care about our campus and our planet. Tag your friends, challenge them to join, and let s turn this event into a movement! See you there!

Today, we at NITK took a giant leap towards a cleaner, greener future! We proudly pledged our commitment to Swachhata and enthusiastically participated in the Ek Tareekh Ek Ghanta Ek Saath initiative. This was a national call to action for 1 hour of citizen-led Shramdaan for Swachhata. At 10 am sharp on this beautiful day, 1st October 2023, our esteemed Director, Prof. B Ravi, the Registrar, Join Registrar, Dean ACR, our dedicated teaching and non-teaching staff, vibrant students, and the local Corporator, Ms. Shobha Rajesh united under one cause. We rolled up our sleeves and embarked on a cleanliness drive that extended beyond the boundaries of our beloved NITK campus to the surrounding areas of Surathkal city. We believe actions speak louder than words, and today we let our actions do the talking! Our collective effort today stands as a testament to our steadfast dedication to cleanliness and sustainability. A big round of applause for everyone who participated in this event! Let s continue to strive for a cleaner and healthier environment. Remember, every small step counts! Together, we can make a difference!

Are you ready to be a part of history? Tomorrow, we will take action for a cleaner and greener India. We will join the initiative, a nationwide cleanliness drive that is part of the campaign. This campaign is a Government of India initiative that invites all citizens to contribute to a clean and green India. content.text: Seven Faculty Members from NITK Among Top 2 of Scientists Worldwide. Congratulations to Dr. Prabhu for being recognized as among the top 2 of scientists worldwide by Stanford University! Dr. Prabhu K, Associate Professor, Department of ECE, and his team are leading the way with new ideas in their field: Wireless Optical Communication: They re making big steps in improving how we communicate wirelessly, which will be super important for future technology like 6G. Nano-Photonics: They re using nano technology to make big improvements in how we use light in devices and systems. 5G Technology: They re exploring new ways to make our internet even faster and more reliable. Their work could lead to: Better Communication: Faster and more secure ways to send and receive data. Sustainable Solutions: Using this technology to make our cities, transportation, and ocean monitoring more efficient and eco-friendly. Benefits for Everyone: Their research could lead to new applications that improve our daily lives. Dr. Prabhu K s hard work has paid off with a successful project and being recognized as a top scientist for four years in a row from 2019 to 2022. Check out the photos of Dr. Prabhu K and his students working hard in the lab! We will be sharing more about the other six NITK faculty members and their achievements, which contributed to their recognition as top 2 world scientists shortly. Stay tuned for more updates!

content.text: Today, we paid tribute to the father of our Nation Mahatma Gandhi by conducting a Swachhta awareness jatha in Surathkal City, along with Rotary Club, Lions Club, Surathkal Nagarikra Salaha Samiti and Hermitech Pvt.Ltd. We walked through the city, handing out pamphlets, holding placards and banners, and urging everyone to join us in the mission of making India clean and green. We also thanked the NITK staff, faculty, NCC, NSS and housekeeping staff for their commitment and zeal in this noble cause. We are proud to be a part of Swachh Bharat Abhiyan special campaign 3.0, a Government of India initiative to promote cleanliness and hygiene across the country, inspired by the vision of Mahatma Gandhi. Swipe left to see some awesome photos of the event.

Glimpse of yesterday s live streaming of the Jan Bhagidhari: G20 University Connect Programm event Surathkal The event, held at Bharat Madapam, Pragati Maidan, New Delhi, featured an inspiring address by our Hon ble Prime Minister. Swipe left to see our Dean SW, Associate DSW, SAS Officers, and students fully immersed in the live stream. Stay connected for more updates from our campus!

We are pleased to announce that Prof. Debashisha Jena, a distinguished faculty member, of our Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering NITK, has been recognized as one of the top 2 scientists worldwide by Stanford University. Prof.Jena s work mainly focuses on system identification and control using data-driven machine learning algorithms, and its application to renewable energy systems. Some of his works are based on analysing the uncertainties that arise from integration of different renewables such as wind and solar generation to large power networks. One of his main areas of research interest is the probabilistic load flow (PLF) of large power networks in the presence of renewable generations. PLF helps to plan and expand the power networks, making them stronger against unexpected events. It also helps to optimize the operation of smart grids, which are an important part of our future energy systems. This recognition is not an individual accomplishment but reflects the dedication and hard work of our entire faculty. Prof. Jena is one among seven faculty members from NITK who have been honored with this prestigious recognition. We will be sharing more about the other five esteemed faculty members in subsequent posts. We extend our heartfelt congratulations to Dr. Jena on this remarkable achievement.

Meet Sudeepthi Nalla, a civil engineering student from NITK, Surathkal, who joined the National Cadet Corps (NCC) in 2018 and transformed her life. Through teamwork, leadership training, and self-discovery, she developed valuable skills and achieved her goals. Click the below link to read her inspiring story and learn how the NCC can change your life too!

Join us for a three-day lecture series on waste recycling and circular economy from 13th-15th September 2023, organized by the Department of Mechanical Engineering, NITK Surathkal In collaboration with Tecnimont Private Limited, Mumbai, Fondazione Maire and Maire Tecnimont Centre for Research in Waste Recycling and Circular Economy, NITK Surathkal. Day 2 features a talk on Circular Hydrogen Production from Plastic and Dry Waste by Ms. Alessia Borgogna from NextChem, Maire, Italy. Join us offline at Seminar Hall 118, DME, NITK or online here (Meeting ID: 380 004 410 708; Passcode: sZHHfR). Don t miss this opportunity to learn about energy transition and waste recycling. All are welcome!

Attention all engineers and scientists! The prestigious National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal (NITK Surathkal) in association with The Indian Academy of Sciences is proud to present the SADHANA SYMPOSIUM Advances in Engineering Sciences on 2nd September 2023. This symposium aims to promote progress and uphold the cause of science in both pure and applied branches. Don t miss this opportunity to learn about the latest advances in engineering sciences and network with fellow innovators and visionaries. Register now at this link to secure your spot. We look forward to welcoming you at NITK Surathkal! Click the below link for more details

content.text: National Institute of Technology Karnataka Surathkal has secured a grant of 6.2 crores from the National Technical Textile Mission, Ministry of Textiles, Government of India. Dr. Sreevalsa Kolathayar, Department of Civil Engineering, will be coordinating the establishment of a state-of-the-art Geotechnical Textile Testing Laboratory as a national facility at NITK. The project aims to promote the use of geotextiles for various applications and train students and faculty in technical textiles. NITK has plans to introduce new courses on technical textiles and conduct advanced research on geotextiles. The center at NITK will host all basic equipment for element tests on soil and geotextile fabric, as well as advanced equipment for model testing on reinforced earth under dynamic loading and field tests. Dr. Sreevalsa said they wish to make the facility accessible to all researchers in need, especially for the south Indian region, as per institute norms. Congratulations to NITK and Dr. Sreevalsa Kolathayar on this achievement!

We are pleased to announce that Dr. T. Palanisamy, Assistant Professor, Department of Civil Engineering at NITK, Mrs. Shruthi B S, Research Scholar, have been awarded an Indian Patent for their design, the Ultrasonic Velocity Monitoring Device for Concrete Structures . This patented device represents a significant advancement in the field of civil engineering, offering a novel approach to monitoring the health and integrity of concrete structures. We extend our heartfelt congratulations to Dr. T. Palanisamy and Ms. Shruthi B.S for their commendable achievement. Their dedication to innovation and research continues to contribute to the growth and prestige of our institute.

Snaps of the ongoing Orientation Programme 2023! We are delighted to welcome the first year U.G and P.G students of the batch of 2023 to our prestigious institute. The orientation programme for the new entrants started on 21st August and will continue till 26th August 2023. The programme aims to introduce the students to the academic and administrative aspects of NITK, as well as the campus culture and facilities. The inaugural ceremony was graced by the presence of our Director, Prof. B Ravi, Student Welfare Prof. A.C.Hegde, Dean Faculty Welfare Prof. G.C Mohan Kumar along with other Deans, Administrative officers, Faculty staff, Students and their parents. The Director addressed the students and congratulated them on their achievements. He also highlighted the important aspects of the institute, and urged the students to pursue excellence in their chosen fields. The Student Welfare Prof. A.C.Hegde briefed the students about the vision, mission, various clubs, societies, and activities that they can participate in to enhance their skills and personality. The orientation programme also includes sessions on academic curriculum, extra and co-curricular activities, examination system, library resources, hostel facilities, health and wellness, sports and cultural activities, anti-ragging measures, and student grievance redressal mechanism. The students will also get an opportunity to interact with their seniors, mentors, and faculty members. We hope that the orientation programme will help the students to get acquainted with NITK and its vibrant community. We wish them all the best for their academic journey ahead. Stay tuned for more updates on the orientation programme.

content.text: No Excuses Now, No Regrets Later NITK Director on Independence Day. Prof. B. Ravi, shared four aspects of the 77th Independence Day of India in a speech that inspired the audience to think about the Nation s future. The first aspect was the tribute to the millions of ordinary citizens who sacrificed their lives in the freedom struggle, how their spirit courage should inspire us to fight for our own goals dreams. Prof. Ravi said Many of them young old, men women, wealthy poor, across the country gave up their studies, careers and families, to fight the British in their own ways, but with a single goal to make India an independent country that decides its own destiny. The second aspect was the need to free ourselves from the chains of poverty, ignorance, disease and disharmony, which are still plaguing many parts of our country. The importance of economic development, education, health and harmony as the means to overcome these challenges was emphasized by Prof. Ravi. He said, Like the struggle for political freedom, these battles also require concerted efforts of all stakeholders. The third aspect was the recognition of India s ancient heritage and legacy as a world leader in terms of knowledge and wealth, how we need to revive that glory by creating a holistic cycle that utilizes knowledge to generate wealth utilizes wealth to create new knowledge. He said, We have been led to believe that knowledge wealth, that is Saraswati and Lakshmi, cannot co-exist. It is time to free ourselves from this wrong mindset. We need to create a holistic cycle that utilizes knowledge to generate wealth utilizes wealth to create new knowledge. In other words, the pursuit of scientific research and practical application are both equally important, especially for technical institutes of national importance, like NIT-K. The fourth aspect was the vision for India s future by 2047, the centenary year of independence, and how each one of us can contribute to making it a happy, healthy prosperous country. Everyone was asked by Prof. Ravi to take a moment to create their own vision of India, to visualise their contribution in making it happen.

Prof. B. Ravi, shared four aspects of the 77th Independence Day of India in a speech that inspired the audience to think about the Nation's future.

The first aspect was the tribute to the millions of ordinary citizens who sacrificed their lives in the freedom struggle, & how their spirit & courage should inspire us to fight for our own goals & dreams. Prof. Ravi said‚ÄúMany of them ‚Äì young & old, men & women, wealthy & poor, across the country gave up their studies, careers and families, to fight the British in their own ways, but with a single goal ‚Äì to make India an independent country that decides its own destiny.‚Äù

The second aspect was the need to free ourselves from the chains of poverty, ignorance, disease and disharmony, which are still plaguing many parts of our country. The importance of economic development, education, health and harmony as the means to overcome these challenges was emphasized by Prof. Ravi. He said, ‚ÄúLike the struggle for political freedom, these battles also require concerted efforts of all stakeholders.‚Äù

The third aspect was the recognition of India‚Äôs ancient heritage and legacy as a world leader in terms of knowledge and wealth, & how we need to revive that glory by creating a holistic cycle that utilizes knowledge to generate wealth & utilizes wealth to create new knowledge. content.text: Meet Ms.Sarita Dange, the first woman Mines Manager in India! Ms. Sarita Dange is a trailblazer in the mining industry. She is the first woman to pass the FCC-Restricted Exam and become a Mines Manager of various open cast mines in India. She graduated from NITK Surathkal in 2006 with a degree in Mining Engineering. She chose to pursue a career in mining despite the opportunities in IT. She was inspired by the mining operations at KIOCL, where she received her initial training, and the subjects she learned at NITK. She obtained her Second Class and First Class Mines Managers Certificates from DGMS and worked with different mining companies. She joined KSMCL as AGM-Production in 2014 and achieved the highest production target of 3.0 MMT in 5 months. She also managed the Bagalkot Sector Mines and the Head office sections. Currently, she is on deputation to KMERC as AGM-P, where she reviews and approves DPRs for mining affected villages. She says that mining is not a tough job for women if they have the passion and determination to succeed. She is grateful to all her supporters, superiors, teachers and critics who helped her achieve this milestone of becoming the first woman Mines Manager. She is happy to see that many girls are inspired by her and want to grow in the mining industry. She thanks the recent amendments in MMR-1961 and the DGMS officials for their support. She also thanks NITK for providing a platform for budding talent like her. Please join us in congratulating Sarita Dange for her remarkable achievements and inspiring story!
content.original_text:
Meet Ms.Sarita Dange, the first woman Mines Manager in India!

Ms. Sarita Dange is a trailblazer in the mining industry. She is the first woman to pass the FCC-Restricted Exam and become a Mines Manager of various open cast mines in India. She graduated from NITK Surathkal in 2006 with a degree in Mining Engineering. She chose to pursue a career in mining despite the opportunities in IT.

She was inspired by the mining operations at KIOCL, where she received her initial training, and the subjects she learned at NITK. She obtained her Second Class and First Class Mines Managers Certificates from DGMS and worked with different mining companies. She joined KSMCL as AGM-Production in 2014 and achieved the highest production target of 3.0 MMT in 5 months. She also managed the Bagalkot Sector Mines and the Head office sections. Currently, she is on deputation to KMERC as AGM-P, where she reviews and approves DPRs for mining affected villages.

She says that mining is not a tough job for women if they have the passion and determination to succeed. She is grateful to all her supporters, superiors, teachers and critics who helped her achieve this milestone of becoming the first woman Mines Manager. She is happy to see that many girls are inspired by her and want to grow in the mining industry. She thanks the recent amendments in MMR-1961 and the DGMS officials for their support. She also thanks NITK for providing a platform for budding talent like her.

Please join us in congratulating Sarita Dange for her remarkable achievements and inspiring story! üëèüëèüëè

@studentscouncil_nitk

content.text: Other distinguished alumni who attended the 64th Foundation Day NITK Surathkal included the founder president of NITK Alumni Association (NITKAA) Shri. Yagnanarayana Kammaje, Managing Director of Sona Group of Industries, Bangalore and Shri. A.S. Karanth, Wind energy advocate, Shri. M. Niranjan, President of Bangalore chapter and others. They released the souvenir of the Global Convention of NITK. We would like to thank all the dignitaries, guests, speakers, sponsors, partners, organizers, volunteers, and participants who made this event a grand success. We would also like to thank you all for your support and encouragement. We hope you enjoyed the event as much as we did. We look forward to celebrating more milestones and achievements with you in the future. NITK - A Legacy of Excellence!

77th INDEPENDENCE DAY CELEBRATION AT NITK SURATHKAL National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal celebrated the 77th Independence Day with great fervor in its Surathkal campus in Mangalore. Officer-Commanding Colonel Anilesh Kaushik and Captain Dr. P. Sam Johnson received the Director Prof. B. Ravi, who inspected the contingents of NCC Cadets and unfurled the National Flag. This was followed by a parade by NITK NCC cadets and NITK Kannada Medium School children, who displayed their patriotism and discipline. The event also featured some poems and speeches related to the nation, recited by NITK students, who expressed their love and respect for the motherland. The Director of NITK, Prof. B Ravi felicitated the best NCC cadets of NITK Surathkal as a part of the Independence Day celebration at NITK Surathkal.

IEEE WORKSHOP AT NITK SURATHKAL Central Library, NITK Surathkal has organized an author workshop on Unveiling the IEEE Open Access Publishing: NITK Initiative for the faculty and research scholars in collaboration with the office of the Dean (R C) on Friday 18th August, 2023. The workshop was conducted at Digital Learning Centre, e-Library Complex in hybrid mode (Online Offline) with more than 90 Ph.D students and faculty members participation. NITK Surathkal is the first institute among all NITs to sign an agreement with one of the top publisher IEEE to publish open access articles. All the articles published under this new agreement will be kept open for the whole world to access freely. The idea is to leverage the open access publishing movement and reach out wider academic and research community to increase the impact of NITK research publications. Dr. Dhanukumar Pattanashetti and Mr. Manjunath Rudrappa from IEEE were the resources persons. During the session, they explained the author process workflow and the benefits of publishing in IEEE Open Access publications. The workshop included a fun-filled interactive quiz contest for the participants on the learnings and the winners received exciting IEEE merchandise. Prof. S M Kulkarni, Dean (R C) Professor, Department of Mechanical Engineering addressed the participants while briefing about the new MoU signed with the publisher. Dr. Mallikarjun Angadi, Librarian and his library team coordinated the workshop.

content.text: In his address, the Director spoke about the rich legacy and good track record of NITK as an Institute of National Importance. The Institute should now embark on the journey from good to great by involving all stakeholders. It can become a model institute by focusing on global excellence coupled with local relevance, leading to economic prosperity as well as social impact in a sustainable and equitable manner.

NITK Surathkal Gets a New Director. In a simple ceremony today, Prof Prasad Krishna, Director NIT Calicut, who was also the additional charge Director at NITK Surathkal, handed over the charge of Director NITK to Prof. (Dr.) Bhallamudi Ravi, the new NITK Director appointed by the Ministry of Education, Government of India, Delhi. Prior to this appointment, Prof. B. Ravi was at IIT Bombay as an Institute Chair Professor of Mechanical Engineering. He is a distinguished alumni of another NIT (Rourkela) and had completed his Masters and PhD at IISc Bangalore. He is well known for his contributions in the fields of metal casting and medical devices, and headed the Desai Sethi School of Entrepreneurship. Prof Prasad Krishna welcomed the new Director Prof. B Ravi, and said NITK is a role model for the entire NIT system, including NIT Calicut, as an alumnus of NITK, am always proud of my alma mater. I am sure that under the able leadership of Prof. B Ravi, NITK Surathkal will give a tough competition to the top IITs in the NIRF India Rankings. I am confident that Prof Ravi will further the vision of this great institute . Prof. Ravi thanked Prof. Prasad Krishna as well as all other stakeholders including faculty, staff, students and alumni for their dedicated efforts in making NITK a widely admired institute. He sought their ideas and support for taking the institute to greater excellence and impact.

Prior to this appointment, Prof. B. Ravi was at IIT Bombay as an Institute Chair Professor of Mechanical Engineering. He is well known for his contributions in the fields of metal casting and medical devices, and headed the Desai Sethi School of Entrepreneurship. 

Prof Prasad Krishna welcomed the new Director Prof. B Ravi, and said "NITK is a role model for the entire NIT system, including NIT Calicut, as an alumnus of NITK, am always proud of my alma mater. Let us promise to donate blood and plasma as often as we can, to share life and share often with those who rely on it. We encourage you to do the same and join us in this act of compassion and generosity. By donating blood or plasma, you can help improve the supply and quality of human plasma and plasma protein therapies, which are crucial for many patients with rare and chronic diseases. Donating blood can make a difference Think!!

Air Marshall Chengappa urges NITK to uphold values and contribute to nation s progress. Air Marshall Chengappa, the chief guest of the 64th foundation day of the National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK), addressed the NITK community on Sunday, August 6, 2023. He urged the students, faculty, and staff to embrace the values of honesty, integrity, loyalty, punctuality, and discipline. He said that these are the foundations of a civil society and the guiding principles for national development. He also quoted the slogan Nation first, mission always, self last and said that it should inspire every Indian to contribute to the country s progress. He emphasized the crucial role of the youth and engineers in nation building. He said that they have to think beyond their own interests and consider the national interests as paramount. He also highlighted the importance of innovation and creativity in the modern world. He said that the citizens have to work hard, learn constantly, read widely, interact with others, and engage in intellectual and adventurous activities. He said that a good sportsman can be a good professional as well. Sports can instill discipline, teamwork, and resilience in the individuals. He praised the leadership of Prof Ravi, the director of NITK, and said that he has a vision to improve NITK s position and reputation in the national and international arena. He requested the NITK community to support his initiatives and cooperate with him in achieving his vision. He also congratulated NITK for its achievements and wished it success in its future endeavors.

content.text: National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK) celebrated its 64th Foundation Day on 6th August at its Surathkal campus by paying homage to its founding father Shri Srinivasa Mallya. The new Director Prof. B. Ravi hoisted the Institute flag and garlanded the founder s statue at the entrance gate. He recalled the remarkable life of Shri Mallya as a freedom fighter and later as the architect of modern Dakshina Kannada. This included the construction of Karnataka Regional Engineering College or KREC (now NITK), New Mangalore Port, Bajpe Airport, Mangalore Hassan Bangalore Railway Line, Mumbai-Kochi and Mangalore-Bangalore highways, Ullal Bridge on Nethravathi and many other prominent works that propelled the district toward prosperity. Faculty, staff and students of NITK gathered to reminisce institute s glorious history and celebrated its achievements over the decades. Air Marshal B. U. Chengappa (retired), recipient of Param Vishist Seva Medal (PVSM), Ati Vishist Seva Medal (AVSM), Vishist Seva Medal (VSM) and a distinguished alumnus of NITK (1969 graduate) was the chief guest. He unveiled a climbing wall called Aarohan at the NCC unit in NITK campus to train cadets by officers led by Col. Anilesh Kaushik. Mr. Chengappa exhorted the students to explore defence adventure and leadership for an exciting and fulfilling life. During the celebration of 64th NITK Foundation Day, about 27 campus children who achieved academic excellence were given certificates and scholarships. The Chief Guest and Director congratulated the children and their parents. They thanked the alumni for instituting the scholarships. During the event, 6 faculty and 11 staff members who completed 25 years of service to NITK were felicitated with an uttariya, certificate and memento.

Karnataka, Surathkal NITK Develops Technology Supports World Ocean Day s Beach Cleaning Drive. In a remarkable display of commitment, approximately forty students and staff members from NITK Surathkal actively participated in a beach cleaning drive near the Surathkal - NITK Beach. The event, jointly organized by the Ocean Society of India, the National Centre for Coastal Research (NCCR), Ministry of Earth Sciences, GoI, and locally coordinated by the Centre for System Design (CSD) at NITK Surathkal, garnered national attention. Known for their expertise in engineering and innovation, the Centre for System Design at NITK Surathkal once again demonstrated their dedication to foster an eco-friendly atmosphere. Led by student Mr. Rajath C. Kotekar and his team, under the guidance of Dr. KV Gangadharan and Dr. Pruthviraj Umesh, a prototype for beach grooming was developed to effectively collect plastic trash. It s an four wheeled all terrain vehicle(ATV) being its first prototype, which is electrically powered by a 24 volt battery, and can tow around 70kg of debris in the beach which is collected in its basket. In a single charge it will run around 2hrs. This entire setup can be dismantled and carried in a compact city car. Because of its small size and lightweight property,rather than using heavy machinery vehicles which will affect biodiversity this compact vehicle can be used as a cost effective alternative. The event was inaugurated by Leo Lion Kavan Kubevoor, an alumnus of NITK Surathkal, who serves as the District Leo President. Lion Kavan emphasized the urgent need for technological solutions to combat the pervasive issue of ocean pollution. Throughout the beach cleaning drive, the team successfully collected approximately half a ton of waste from the shoreline. The cleanup efforts involved a combination of manual picking by volunteers and the use of automated machines. The waste collected included plastic bottles, wrappers, home appliance covers, glass bottles, and various other non-biodegradable materials.

content.text: NITK celebrates International Day of Yoga 2023 The National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal celebrated the International Day of Yoga today, June 21, 2023. The office of the Dean Student welfare organised a special session for yoga practice and mass demonstration at the NITK campus today. Yoga Guru Shri. Radhesh Mohandas demonstrated various yogic postures as per the Common Yoga Protocol suggested by Ministry of Aayush and Ministry of Education, Govt. of India. The Director, Registrar, Dean Student Welfare, Dean R C, Dean ACR, teaching and non-teaching staff and students of NITK performed various yoga asanas and pranayama under the guidance of the yoga guru. As a part of the International Day of Yoga 2023, a competition of performing Surya Namaskar Sixty times in 60 minutes was held on 20th June 2023 at NITK Surathkal. The winners of this competition were felicitated during the event by the Director, NITK Surathkal. While addressing the gathering, Prof. Ravi, the Director of NITK, spoke about the importance of yoga for enhancing the quality of life and academic performance. He also expressed his gratitude to the Prime Minister Narendra Modi for initiating the International Day of Yoga and promoting it worldwide. Yoga Guru Shri. Radhesh Mohandas demonstrated various yogic postures as per the Common Yoga Protocol suggested by Ministry of Aayush and Ministry of Education GoI. He also explained the benefits of those asanas and pranayamas. He demonstrated all types of Asanas (Standing, Sitting, Supine position and prone position asanas along with Suryanamaskar in the beginning) and few techniques of Pranayamas to the participants. He also explained about the holistic approach of Yoga and its benefits for different hypo kinetic diseases of modern society. Prior to IDY 2023, NITK organized a Yoga practice camp under the guidance of Guru Raghavendra Rao from 12th to 20th June 2023.
content.original_text:
NITK celebrates International Day of Yoga 2023 

The National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal celebrated the International Day of Yoga today, June 21, 2023. The office of the Dean Student welfare organised a special session for yoga practice and mass demonstration at the NITK campus today. Yoga Guru Shri. Radhesh Mohandas demonstrated various yogic postures as per the Common Yoga Protocol suggested by Ministry of Aayush and Ministry of Education, Govt. of India. The Director, Registrar, Dean Student Welfare, Dean R&C, Dean ACR, teaching and non-teaching staff and students of NITK performed various yoga asanas and pranayama under the guidance of the yoga guru. As a part of the International Day of Yoga 2023, a competition of performing ‚ÄúSurya Namaskar‚Äù Sixty times in 60 minutes was held on 20th June 2023 at NITK Surathkal. The winners of this competition were felicitated during the event by the Director, NITK Surathkal.

While addressing the gathering, Prof. Ravi, the Director of NITK, spoke about the importance of yoga for enhancing the quality of life and academic performance. He also expressed his gratitude to the Prime Minister Narendra Modi for initiating the International Day of Yoga and promoting it worldwide.

Yoga Guru Shri. Radhesh Mohandas demonstrated various yogic postures as per the Common Yoga Protocol suggested by Ministry of Aayush and Ministry of Education GoI. He also explained the benefits of those asanas and pranayamas. He demonstrated all types of Asanas (Standing, Sitting, Supine position and prone position asanas along with Suryanamaskar in the beginning) and few techniques of Pranayamas to the participants. He also explained about the holistic approach of Yoga and its benefits for different hypo kinetic diseases of modern society.

Prior to IDY 2023, NITK organized a Yoga practice camp under the guidance of Guru Raghavendra Rao from 12th to 20th June 2023.

25th ANNIVERSARY CELEBRATION OF POKHRAN II SCIENCE EXHIBITION BY NCC AT NIT-K SURATHKAL In order to commemorate the 25th anniversary of India s successful nuclear tests at Pokhran (Pokhran-II) in May 1998, 2 KAR ENGR COY NCC on behalf of NCC Group HQ Mangalore, is organizing a Science Exhibition at NIT-K, Surathkal on 6th and 7th May 2023. The exhibition has showcased the history of India s nuclear programme, its main architects, and achievements through charts, models and audio-visual presentations. Models of Indian missiles, aircraft, tank, naval vessel and other Defence equipment was also on display. A Weapons display was also organised by the NCC unit at NIT-K in collaboration with ITBP. NCC Cadets from various schools and colleges around Surathkal, Mangalore and Udupi have actively participated in the exhibition as well as the science quiz held exclusively for them.

The project is sponsored solely by NITKSAA (NITK Surathkal Alumni Association). The foundation stone was inaugurated by the Director NITK (Additional charge), Prof. PRASAD KRISHNA and Commanding Officer 2 Kar Engr Coy NCC, Col. Anilesh Kaushik, on 11th May 2023. The other dignitaries present on the occasion were Dr. S Shrikantha Rao, Dean (Alumni Association), Lt. Dr. H Shivananda Nayaka, ANO and all Instructor Staff of the NCC Unit, and NCC cadets of NITK, along with a few staff and faculty of NITK, Surathkal. Director Prof. Prasad Krishna and Prof. Srikanth S Rao ( Dean Alumni Affairs and Institutional Relations) spoke about the benefits of the obstacle course for the institute and thanked the support and services of NCC and NITKSAA. He also acknowledged NITKSAA for sponsoring the project.
content.original_text:
Inauguration of foundation stone for OBSTACLE COURSE at NITK, Surathkal

2 KAR ENGR COY NCC at NITK, along with NITK Surathkal and NITK Surathkal Alumni Association, is involved in the construction of obstacle course at NITK. The project is sponsored solely by NITKSAA (NITK Surathkal Alumni Association). The foundation stone was inaugurated by the Director NITK (Additional charge), Prof. PRASAD KRISHNA and Commanding Officer 2 Kar Engr Coy NCC, Col. Anilesh Kaushik, on 11th May 2023. The other dignitaries present on the occasion were Dr. S Shrikantha Rao, Dean (Alumni Association), Lt. Dr. H Shivananda Nayaka, ANO and all Instructor Staff of the NCC Unit, and NCC cadets of NITK, along with a few staff and faculty of NITK, Surathkal. 

Director Prof. Prasad Krishna and Prof. Srikanth S Rao ( Dean Alumni Affairs and Institutional Relations) spoke about the benefits of the obstacle course for the institute and thanked the support and  services of NCC and NITKSAA. He also acknowledged NITKSAA for sponsoring the project. 

@eduminofindia @dpradhanbjp @ncc_nitk @studentscouncil_nitk @nitk.alumni

content.text: Glimpse of today s expert lecture on Waste to Fuels generation held at National Institute of Technology Karnataka Surathkal, witnessing over 150 participants. A preview of today s expert talk on gasification techniques for waste-to-fuel generation addressed some significant insights. Starting with an overview of Gasification, a process that turns RDFs (Refused Derived Fuels) into a gas mixture known as syngas by heating the waste material at high temperatures in an oxygen-depleted atmosphere. The session also discussed Syngas features, which include the composition, calorific value, and impurities of syngas. The speaker, Dr. Borgagna spoke on the environmental impacts of gasification, such as air pollutants, solid waste, and water consumption, as well as the gasification process and its efficacy as a sustainable and cost-effective waste management solution.
content.original_text:
Glimpse of today's expert lecture on "Waste to Fuels generation" held at National Institute of Technology Karnataka Surathkal, witnessing over 150 participants.

A preview of today's expert talk on gasification techniques for waste-to-fuel generation addressed some significant insights. Starting with an overview of Gasification, a process that turns RDFs (Refused Derived Fuels) into a gas mixture known as syngas by heating the waste material at high temperatures in an oxygen-depleted atmosphere. The session also discussed Syngas features, which include the composition, calorific value, and impurities of syngas. 
The speaker, Dr. Borgagna spoke on the environmental impacts of gasification, such as air pollutants, solid waste, and water consumption, as well as the gasification process and its efficacy as a sustainable and cost-effective waste management solution.

content.text: Image of students visit to NITK STEP to learn about the processes of innovation and entrepreneurship. The Centre is primarily focused to support startups in the technology sector, by offering them mentoring, resources, and networking opportunities. 65 electronics engineering students and five faculty members from Canara College of Engineering, Mangalore, visited NITK Science Technology Entrepreneurs Park (STEP) today, as part of their curriculum. The students were then taken on a tour to see the facilities available at NITK STEP, which featured co-working areas, private offices, conference rooms, and prototype laboratories. The crew at the Centre highlighted how entrepreneurs were able to utilise the amenities to develop their products and services, test them, and obtain feedback from potential consumers and investors. The startups based at NITK STEP shared about their ideas, journey, experiences they gained at the Centre, also expressed their views about how NITK helped them in expanding their businesses. During the interactive discussion, Prof. Arun Isloor, Professor In-charge, NITK STEP, covered topics such as how to register for a company, about the Indian startup ecosystem, fundraising, intellectual property, market research, and team formation.
content.original_text:
Image of students visit to NITK STEP to learn about the processes of innovation and entrepreneurship. The Centre is primarily focused to support startups in the technology sector, by offering them mentoring, resources, and networking opportunities.

65 electronics engineering students and five faculty members from Canara College of Engineering, Mangalore, visited NITK Science & Technology Entrepreneurs Park (STEP) today, as part of their curriculum. 

The students were then taken on a tour to see the facilities available at NITK STEP, which featured co-working areas, private offices, conference rooms, and prototype laboratories. The crew at the Centre highlighted how entrepreneurs were able to utilise the amenities to develop their products and services, test them, and obtain feedback from potential consumers and investors.

The startups based at NITK STEP shared about their ideas, journey, experiences they gained at the Centre, also expressed their views about how NITK helped them in expanding their businesses.

During the interactive discussion, Prof. Arun Isloor, Professor In-charge, NITK STEP, covered topics such as how to register for a company, about the Indian startup ecosystem, fundraising, intellectual property, market research, and team formation.

content.text: NITK Surathkal celebrates Ambedkar Jayanthi. To celebrate the 132nd birthday of Dr. B R Ambedkar, the SC ST Cell of NITK Surathkal hosted a number of cultural and academic events today at NITK campus. As a part of the event, a dedicated website for SC ST Cell (NITK) was launched today, which will be a single gateway that provides all the information on numerous scholarships exclusively granted to SC ST students. The chief guest for today s function was Dr Kumar Naik G, Joint Commissioner (Enforcement), West Zone, Department of Commercial Tax, Mangalore, Prof. G C Mohan Kumar, Director In-charge NITK Surathkal, presided over the function. Dr. Nagendrappa, Liaison Officer NITK, Dean Students Welfare, Prof. Narendranath S, Teaching, non-teaching and students took part in the programme. During the occasion, a number of NITK faculty members who have excelled in the fields of academia and R D were honoured.
content.original_text:
NITK Surathkal celebrates Ambedkar Jayanthi.

To celebrate the 132nd birthday of Dr. B R Ambedkar, the SC/ST Cell of NITK Surathkal hosted a number of cultural and academic events today at NITK campus. As a part of the event, a dedicated website for SC/ST Cell (NITK) was launched today, which will be a single gateway that provides all the information on numerous scholarships exclusively granted to SC/ST students. The chief guest for today's function was Dr Kumar Naik G, Joint Commissioner (Enforcement), West Zone, Department of Commercial Tax, Mangalore, Prof. G C Mohan Kumar, Director In-charge NITK Surathkal, presided over the function. Dr. Nagendrappa, Liaison Officer NITK, Dean Students Welfare, Prof. Narendranath S, Teaching, non-teaching and students took part in the programme. During the occasion, a number of NITK faculty members who have excelled in the fields of academia and R&D were honoured.

content.text: The Department of Civil Engineering at the National Institute of Technology Karnataka Surathkal is hosting a two-day International Conference on SUSTAINABLE INFRASTRUCTURE: INNOVATIONS, OPPORTUNITIES, AND CHALLENGES (SIIOC 2023) as a part of G20 C20 today tomorrow, April 20th and 21st, 2023. The inauguration ceremony of the international conference SIIOC 2023 was held today at NITK Surathkal. The chief guest for today s inaugural ceremony was Prof. N. Vinod Chandra Menon, International Coordinator G20 C20 WG on Sustainable Resilient Communities, and, Prof. Darren Chian Siau Chen, Associate Professor, National University of Singapore was the Guest of Honour. Prof. Prasad Krishna, Director (Additional-charge) NITK Surathkal was the Chief Patron, Prof. B. R. Jayalekshmi, HOD Civil Department, NITK was the Patron for today s international conference. The dignitaries felicitated Prof. A.U. Ravi Shankar and Prof. K. Swaminathan from the Civil Engineering Department, NITK Surathkal for their enormous contributions in the field of civil engineering. Director (Additional Charge) NITK Surathkal and Cheif Patron of SIIOC 2023 addressed the gathering said It s a great moment while India is chairing G20, several meetings, awareness programmes, seminars, workshops, and events are held nation and globally, but we must understand that sustainability is everyone s commitment to contribute to a sustainable ecosystem.Humans must cultivate compassion, impart humanity, and learn to live and let live. Although Indian culture and traditions have always taught us to protect the environment and coexist peacefully with all living things, we are finding it more harder to uphold these values. In order to live together with the natural world, humans need to raise their consciousness quotient . Dr. Raviraj H.M. and Dr. Pavan, assistant professors from the Civil Engineering Department, NITK Surathkal, are the organising chairs of the international conference SIIOC-2023.
content.original_text:
The Department of Civil Engineering at the National Institute of Technology Karnataka Surathkal is hosting a two-day International Conference on "SUSTAINABLE INFRASTRUCTURE: INNOVATIONS, OPPORTUNITIES, AND CHALLENGES (SIIOC 2023)" as a part of G20 & C20 today & tomorrow, April 20th and 21st, 2023.

The inauguration ceremony of the international conference SIIOC 2023 was held today at NITK Surathkal. 

The chief guest for today's inaugural ceremony was Prof. N. Vinod Chandra Menon, International Coordinator G20 C20 WG on Sustainable & Resilient Communities, and, Prof. Darren Chian Siau Chen, Associate Professor, National University of Singapore was the Guest of Honour. Prof. Prasad Krishna, Director (Additional-charge) NITK Surathkal was the Chief Patron, Prof. B. R. Jayalekshmi, HOD Civil Department, NITK was the Patron for today‚Äôs international conference. 

The dignitaries felicitated Prof. A.U. Ravi Shankar and Prof. K. Swaminathan from the Civil Engineering Department, NITK Surathkal for their enormous contributions in the field of civil engineering.

Director (Additional Charge) NITK Surathkal and Cheif Patron of SIIOC 2023 addressed the gathering said "It's a great moment while India is chairing G20, several meetings, awareness programmes, seminars, workshops, and events are held nation and globally, but we must understand that sustainability is everyone's commitment to contribute to a sustainable ecosystem.Humans must cultivate compassion, impart humanity, and learn to live and let live. Although Indian culture and traditions have always taught us to protect the environment and coexist peacefully with all living things, we are finding it more & harder to uphold these values. In order to live together with the natural world, humans need to raise their consciousness quotient". 

Dr. Raviraj H.M. and Dr. Pavan, assistant professors from the Civil Engineering Department, NITK Surathkal, are the organising chairs of the international conference SIIOC-2023.

content.text: The two-day national workshop on the design was organised by the Ministry of MSME in association with the Centre for System Design, NITK Surathkal. The primary goal of the workshop is to component is to bring the Indian manufacturing sector and Design expertise Design fraternity onto a common platform. It aims to provide expert advice and cost-effective solution for real-time design problems for new product development, its continuous improvement and value addition in existing new products. The workshop was inaugurated by Prof. Mohan Kumar, Director in charge of NITK, Surathkal, S.M Kulkarni Dean R amp;D was the guest of honour. The workshop was coordinated by Sundar Sherigara, Assistant Director, Br.-MSME, DFO Mangalore, Dr.Bijuna C Mohan, Assistant Professor, School of Humanities, Social Sciences and Management and Dr. Pruthviraj U, Assistant Professor, Det. Of Water Resources and Ocean Engineering. In his key address Prof. Mohan Kumar said Design is an important aspect of any product; the product should be appealing and attractive for the consumers to buy. The first and foremost part that a consumer will be looking into is the aesthetic look of the product. Prof S M Kulkarni mentioned the important role played by NITK and CSD in supporting MSME units.

What we are doing to the forests of the world is but a mirror reflection of what we are doing to ourselves and to one another - Mahatma Gandhi Forests are essential to the health of our planet. They provide a home for countless species of plants and animals, and they play a crucial role in regulating the Earth s climate. Unfortunately, many forests around the world are under threat from deforestation, climate change, and other human activities. To protect our forests, we must take action to reduce our impact on the environment. This can include reducing our use of paper products, supporting sustainable forestry practices, and advocating for policies that protect forests and the wildlife that depend on them. The goal of World Forestry Day 2023 is to promote sustainable forest management practices that balance economic, social, and environmental needs. Let s all do our part to protect and preserve our forests for generations to come.
content.original_text:
"What we are doing to the forests of the world is but a mirror reflection of what we are doing to ourselves and to one another"

- Mahatma Gandhi 

Forests are essential to the health of our planet. They provide a home for countless species of plants and animals, and they play a crucial role in regulating the Earth's climate. Unfortunately, many forests around the world are under threat from deforestation, climate change, and other human activities.

To protect our forests, we must take action to reduce our impact on the environment. This can include reducing our use of paper products, supporting sustainable forestry practices, and advocating for policies that protect forests and the wildlife that depend on them.

The goal of World Forestry Day 2023 is to promote sustainable forest management practices that balance economic, social, and environmental needs. 

Let's all do our part to protect and preserve our forests for generations to come.

#savetrees
#saveforests
#savelives #savetheplanet #savetheenvironment #internationaldayofforests

content.text: The Day 2 of the workshop started with session on Introduction to design thinking for MSMEs by Mr Mani Teja Lingala, Co-founder Studio-Carbon, National Institute of Design, Ahmedabad. He briefed about the Industrial, Communication, UI-UX design for the industries and how design aspect in Indian industries evolved. He also shared his insights on why design matters to MSMEs by solving problems, creating value and enhancing user experience. In addition to that he spoke about how MSMEs can differentiate themselves from competitors, improve quality and efficiency and reduce cost leading to customer satisfaction. Second session was taken up by Mr. Lakshmi Manikanta Polisetti from Studio-Carbon, alumni of National institute of Design, Ahmedabad. The session was about designing for Growth: How MSMEs can leverage Design to boost innovation and competitiveness. The session discussed how design helps the organisation to sustain in the industry by utilising the resources to the optimum level by addressing the environmental challenges. He also discussed about various projects they implemented for different companies. In the afternoon session all the participating MSMEs visited a farm named Praakriti Fruit Orchid at Inna village in Padubidri and had a fruitful discussion with the farm owner who is the alumni of NITK Mr. Chandrakanth Rao. The two-day national workshop was conducted by Ministry of MSME in association with CSD, NITK and was coordinated by Dr.Bijuna C Mohan, Assistant Professor, School of Humanities, Social Sciences and Management and Dr. Pruthviraj U, Assistant Professor, Dept. of Water Resources and Ocean Engineering, NITK.

content.text: One person can make a difference, and everyone should try. NITK s efforts towards educating, empowering the needy. More than 30 NITK Kannada medium school students received school bags, foldable study tables, and stationary kits from Incident 23 I-care (the social wing of the cultural fest Incident ) yesterday at NITK Surtahkal. Prof. Narendranath S, dean of student welfare, Dr. Allwyn Roshan Pais, associate dean student welfare, Dr. Nagendrappa, Assistant Professor, Dept of EEE, and Dr. Manoj, SAS officer, were present, along with parents and students.I-Care is the social initiative arm of Incident: NITK Surathkal s annual Culture Fest. I-Care student volunteers actively participate in a variety of academic and social activities, such as Beach Schooling, Paper and Plastic Recycling, visiting nearby orphanages and old age homes, organizing several awareness programmes, Cloth-donation Drives, and so on, in order to help the local community and make a difference in society. We think education can alter children s lives, and via our projects, we hope to be a part of the answer to removing many societal problems, said Team I-Care. In addition to this, the student volunteers are engaged in Beach Schooling, a social project run by I-care, where the team is dedicated in tutoring and training the underprivileged students at government schools every day at the NITK beach.

One person can make a difference, and everyone should try.üòä NITK's efforts towards educating, empowering the needy.

More than 30 NITK Kannada medium school students received school bags, foldable study tables, and stationary kits from Incident'23 I-care (the social wing of the cultural fest ' Incident') yesterday at NITK Surtahkal. Prof. Narendranath S, dean of student welfare, Dr. Allwyn Roshan Pais, associate dean student welfare, Dr. Nagendrappa, Assistant Professor, Dept of EEE, and Dr. Manoj, SAS officer, were present, along with parents and students.I-Care is the social initiative arm of Incident: NITK Surathkal's annual Culture Fest. I-Care student volunteers actively participate in a variety of academic and social activities, such as "Beach Schooling," "Paper and Plastic Recycling," visiting nearby orphanages and old age homes, organizing several awareness programmes, Cloth-donation Drives, and so on, in order to help the local community and make a difference in society.
