content.text: Live, learn and explore! Contribute to the beautiful world of Science. The theme of National Science Day 2023 is Global Science for Global Wellbeing .

INCIDENT INAGURATION AT NITK. The inaugural ceremony of INCIDENT 2023 at National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal campus, from 16.03.2023 to 18.03.2023. Incident witnesses over 45,000 footfalls for the 4 days cultural fest. Actor Director Shri Prakash Belawadi, National awardee for best film in the English language in 2003, who was conferred Pratibha Bhushan by the Govt of Karnataka in 2003 for his contribution to culture, recipient of Helpmann Award, Australia (2019) for Best Actor, Male in the play Counting and Cracking , was the Chief Guest for the Incident 2023 inaugural ceremony. Padma Shree Awardee Environmentalist, Smt. Tulasi Gowda, Karnataka State Pollution Control Board Chairman, NITK alumnus Shri Shanth Thimaiah, was the event s Guests of honor. Director (In-charge), Prof. G.C.Mohan Kumar, Dean Students Welfare, Prof. Narendranath. S, Registrar, Shri K Ravindranath, team Incident felicitated the Chief guest Guests of honor. Dean Student welfare, and Incident presented a cheque of worth 50,000 as a token of respect to Smt. Tulasi Gowda during the felicitation. During the inaugural ceremony, Shri Prakash Belwadi said the future will be replaced by the AI Technology, the biggest human desire would not be to erect compound walls, but to break the compound walls to be together. Technology is not the only solution to all problems; human values, Indian culture, and social institutions will serve as a guiding force in addressing key issues. Shree Shantha Thimmaiah addressed the crowd, saying, Saving the mother earth is each of our responsibility; young generation should support the effective implementation of government initiatives such as banning single-use plastic by adopting new methods technologies to make the country free of environmental pollution. Smt. Tulasi Gowda said: Clean air and green environment is extremely vital for every living creature, thus, young generation should nurture the habit of planting samplings wherever feasible to preserve environment

On the 21st and 22nd of March 2023, the Ministry of MSME will host a two-day National Workshop on Design Components in partnership with the Centre for System Design, NITK Surathkal, and MSME DFO Mangalore at NITK. The workshop s primary goal is to bring together the Indian manufacturing sector and the Design expertise Design fraternity to give expert advise and cost-effective solutions on real-time design challenges for new product creation, continuous improvement, and value addition in existing new goods. This Design Scheme will assist MSMEs in obtaining advise on all elements of design and achieving their design-related objectives with the assistance of professional designers.Wipro 3D, Lucid engineering, graduates of NID, Ahmedabad, and NITK, as well as successful MSMEs, will provide lectures and demonstrations. The session is completely free to attend. You can register both online and on the spot.

The International Conference on Climate Resilient Construction and Building Materials 2023 had its inaugural ceremony today at NITK Surathkal. Dr. Venkatesh Kodur, Distinguished Professor (Michigan State University, Lansing, USA), Chief Guest, Dr. Vasant Matsagar, Dogra Chair Professor (IIT Delhi), Guest of Honor, Dr. Biswajit Bhattacharjee, Emeritus Professor (IIT Delhi), Chief Patron, Prof. S. M. Kulkarni, NITK Director (I C), Dr. .R Jeyalakshmi,HOD Civil Engineering Department, NITK, Prof. Babunarayan, Dean Planning and Development, NITK and others attended the opening ceremony. During the inaugural function, Dr. Biswajit Bhattacharjee was honored for his enormous contributions to the area of civil engineering by the dignitaries. Organising chair: Dr. Bibhuti Bhusan Das Organizing Chair (www.iccrcbm.com) Associate Professor Civil Engineering Department, NITK and Team.

WEAPON EXPO AT NITK As part of Incident 2023, the 2 KAR ENGR COY, NCC, NITK Surathkal hosted a WEAPON EXPO today at NITK in collaboration with the 56 ITBP (Indo Tibetan Border Police) unit. The exhibition intended to raise knowledge of the many types of armaments used in the army, as well as to inspire young people to pursue careers in the defense armed forces. Students were taught about line display ammunitions, how to handle hand grenades and rocket launchers in an actual combat scenario. Students were also given the opportunity to obtain hands-on experience with the weaponry used in the armed forces.

content.text: NITK 62nd Swachhta program under Swachh Bharath Abhiyan was held today. Plastic free campus campaign Pick up litter drive was carried out by NITK Sevadal. Team lead by Shri Rammohan Y(JR) Prof Mohan Kumar G C(Dean FW), Team NCC, NSS and other students of NITK Surathkal.

The YOGA club of NITK SURATHKAL organised Coastal Calming a yoga session at NITK beach today (19.02.2023) from 7.00 AM-8.30 AM. NITK Director (additional charge), Prof. Prasad Krishna presided over the session. More than 200 participants including the staff and students of NITK participated in the yoga session. Ms. Venilla Manikandan, a Hatha Yoga Trainer, pursuing MTech at Civil Engineering department, NITK Surathkal was the instructor for the session. Prof. Prasad Krishna: Yoga is an excellent way for students to improve their physical and mental wellbeing. Not only does it help to reduce stress and anxiety, but it also increases flexibility, strength, and balance. Practicing yoga can also help an individua to become more mindful and focused, allowing him her to better manage the time and energy. The beauty of yoga is that, it is suitable for all ages. By following the Eightfold Path: Yama (ethical standards), Niyama (self-discipline and spiritual observances), Asana (postures), Pranayama (breath control), Pratyahara (sense withdrawal), Dharana (concentration), Dhyana (meditation) and Samadhi (enlightenment) one can cultivate a greater sense of self-awareness, inner peace, and spiritual connection. With dedication and practice, the Eightfold Path can lead to a life of greater joy, fulfilment, and purpose. Yoga and meditation must be practised in order to overcome the myriad lifestyle illnesses and rising suicide rates that plague today . The director expressed his sincere thanks to Ms. Venilla, the yoga instructor, Registrar: Shri Ravindranath.K, Joint Registrar: Rammohan Y, Dean Student Welfare: Prof. Narendranath, Faculty Welfare: Prof. G. C. Mohan Kumar, Yoga Club faculty advisor: Dr. V. Murugan, the organisers, and all the participants.

content.text: The ninth edition of TEDxNITKSurathkal. TEDxNITKSurathkal staged its ninth annual main event on February 17, 2023, at the National Institute of Technology Karnataka Surathkal. The theme for this year was Mosaic, which brought together all facets of people s lives to create a mosaic that was a beautiful portrayal of their true selves. The event attracted more than 600 attendees. The event s invited speakers included Captain Naveen Nagappa, a veteran of the Kargil War, Mr. Gangadhar Patil, a journalist and entrepreneur, Ms. Arshi Yasin, a sports media entrepreneur, Ms. Archana Singh, a travel content creator, Mrs. Nandini Shankar, a violinist, Ms. Asha Thadani, a photographer, and actress Ms. Sapthami Gowda.

content.text: Dr. Sreevalsa Kolathayar s research group from the National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK) Surathkal has developed a tool termed Disaster Preparedness Index (DPI) to assess the preparedness level of every individual and household to face an impending disaster. It is a survey-based tool to analyze the preparedness indices of the respondents over psychological and various social factors. The Disaster Preparedness Index (DPI) is a valid and reliable tool that assesses individuals on a three-level scale with index values ranging between 0 14.

content.text: The School of Humanities, Social Science and Management, NIT Karnataka, Surathkal, hosted a guest lecture today on the topic The Importance of Economic Diplomacy with a focus on India-Japan relations . The program is a part of the India Videsh NITI distinguished lecture series an initiative by the Ministry of External Affairs, GOI. Ms. Deepa Gopalan Wadhwa, former Indian Ambassador to Japan, was the invited guest speaker for today s program. Prof. KS Babu Narayan, Director In-Charge for the day and Dean of Planning and Development, Dr. Sheena HOD of the School Of Humanities, Social Science and Management, Dr. Rashmi Uchil, Co-ordinator of lecture series. Over 150 students from the Institute s B-Tech, MBA, and Ph.D. programmes attended the event. The speaker enlightened the students about the functionalities of Ministry of External Affairs, GOI, predominantly pertaining to the India-Japan relations, and shared the insights she gained as a former ambassador to Japan.

content.text: Glimpse of today s All India Inter NIT Sports Meet 2k22-23 held at NITK Surathkal. Commonwealth games gold medalist Shri Pushparaj Hegde P was the Chief Guest of the day. Director In-charge Prof G C Mohan Kumar presided over the function. NITK Surathkal has always been in the forefront of sports with its rich legacy and alumni accomplishments of National and International fame. This spectacular event will bring together the best of NITs (National Institutes of Technology) from all over India for a shared love for sports and physical fitness. The event provides a platform for students from all National Institute of Technology (NITs) across India the opportunity to participate, compete and demonstrate their physical ability. The event will be held at the newly established NITK Surathkal Sports Complex. Mr. Kuldeep Singh, is the Neutral observer of the AIINSM. Prof. Narendranath.S, Dean Students Welfare, Physical Director (I c), SAS Officers, other Deans, Teaching and non-teaching staff of NITK were a part of the inaugural ceremony. Director In-charge, Prof. G. C. Mohan Kumar, gave the presidential remarks: This national level meet will provide an excellent opportunity to young athletes to exhibit their skills and competency in Athletics and also to share and learn from the experience of others. We are thankful to the other NITs for sending their talented athletes and are confident that this event will be a great success. The Chief Guest Mr. Pushparaj Hegde. P congratulated the participants and encouraged the youth to engage in sports for not only being physically fit, but also for the emotional well being.
content.original_text:
Glimpse of today's All India Inter NIT Sports Meet 2k22-23 held at NITK Surathkal.
Commonwealth games gold medalist Shri Pushparaj Hegde P was the Chief Guest of the day. Director In-charge Prof G C Mohan Kumar presided over the function.

NITK Surathkal has always been in the forefront of sports with its rich legacy and alumni accomplishments of National and International fame. This spectacular event will bring together the best of NITs (National Institutes of Technology) from all over India for a shared love for sports and physical fitness. The event provides a platform for students from all National Institute of Technology (NITs) across India the opportunity to participate, compete and demonstrate their physical ability. The event will be held at the newly established NITK Surathkal Sports Complex. Mr. Kuldeep Singh, is the Neutral observer of the AIINSM. Prof. Narendranath.S, Dean Students Welfare, Physical Director (I/c), SAS Officers, other Deans, Teaching and non-teaching staff of NITK were a part of the inaugural ceremony.

Mohan Kumar, gave the presidential remarks: ‚ÄúThis national level meet will provide an excellent opportunity to young athletes to exhibit their skills and competency in Athletics and also to share and learn from the experience of others. We are thankful to the other NITs for sending their talented athletes and are confident that this event will be a great success.
The Chief Guest Mr. Pushparaj Hegde. P congratulated the participants and encouraged the youth to engage in sports for not only being physically fit, but also for the emotional well ‚Äì being.

content.text: celebration at NITK Surathkal organised by NSS Unit, National Institute of Technology Karnataka Surathkal. Commemorating the 160th Birth Anniversary of who is considered as one of India s most influential leader, served as an inspiration to a generation of young Indians. His speeches Nationally and Internationally has been widely appreciated and is still relevant in the modern world even after decades. To pay tribute to this great personality, NITK organised National Youth Day, today, at NITK Surathkal. The day to honour the potential of youth and their contributions to society. Professor Vadiraja Bhatta G.R., Associate Professor at MIT Manipal, was the featured speaker at the event. The occasion was presided over by the director-in-charge and dean of Faculty Welfare, Professor G. C. Mohan Kumar. Also, a variety of cultural activities, speeches in three languages( Kannada, Hindi and English) and the prize distribution of competitions were a part of the programme. 26th National Youth Festival 2023 ( Viksit Yuva - Viksit Bharat) will be launched today by our honourable Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi at Hubli- Dharwad on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Swami Vivekananda, in this view, NITK E-Library will livestream the National Youth Festival at 4 p.m. today at the E-Library complex. Dr. Veershetty Gumtapure (NSS Program Coordinator), NSS Program Officers, the Joint Registrar, Associate Dean SW, Associate Dean AAIR, Teaching and Non-Teaching Staff, and more than one hundred students were present for today s celebration.

Every year, the Artist s Forum NITK hosts UDAAN on the sands of NITK beach as its signature event. The UDAAN beach event features stunning backgrounds on the exceptionally magnificent Arabian Sea. Locals and students from NITK approximately more than 1000 attendees are witnessed at this event each year. This beach fiesta, which has been a significant part of life in NITK for about 15 years, has food, cool drinks, photographs, music, games, stalls, kites, and much more. There are competitions like kite flying and sand art in which neighboring colleges participate. Apart from this, there are NITK staff and students taking part in various games like limbo, tug of war, sack race, twister etc, accompanied with stalls for mehndi, temporary tattoo and hair spray, hair braids and polaroid photographs.

content.text: NITK signs MOU with EM Electronix Private Limited, Bengaluru, India to foster efforts towards building equipments for nation building. Glimpse of MoU handing over between Registrar, NITK and Mr.Tukaye, MD- EM Electronix, Bengaluru, In presence of Director In-charge, Dean AAIR and NITK Alumni 1972 batch.

The Accelerate Vigyan-Karyasahala Scheme of DST-SERB, Govt. of India, sponsors the NITK Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering s workshop. The Science and Engineering Research Board (SERB),Govt. of India, offers Karyashala to improve research and development in the nation by enabling and grooming talented PG-level students by building devoted research capabilities in specified areas and disciplines via high-end workshops. This programme covers topics like DSP microcontrollers for renewable energy power electronics converters. Since power electronic converters have a huge influence on current home and commercial applications from low power to high power, this is the developing study topic in electric power engineering, leading to a new industrial revolution. Power electronic converters are used in energy storage and conservation, which is a crucial part of electric vehicle charging stations, smart grids, and renewable energy systems. Modern power electronics systems with digital control platforms will help solve climate change and environmental challenges, according to recent developments. This session introduces the newest DSP microcontroller and teaches how to set up and programme one to build power electronic converter-based algorithms. The workshop accepted 25 of more than 40 applicants. Central, state, government-funded, and private graduate and doctorate students were prioritised. Technical sessions will include experts from corporate, Academicians from Tier-1 Institutes sharing insights.

National Mathematics Day is observed annually on December 22, the birthday of Srinivasa Ramanujan, one of India s most renowned mathematicians. In commemoration, the Department of Mathematical and Computational Sciences, National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK) Surathkal, organised a one-day national conference for the benefit of postgraduate students, PhD research researchers, college instructors, and professors. Renowned academics from ISI, IITs, and NITs gave invited speeches on Functional Analysis, Real Analysis, Spectral Graph and Number Theory. The total participaants were 90.
content.original_text:
National Mathematics Day is observed annually on December 22, the birthday of Srinivasa Ramanujan, one of India's most renowned mathematicians. In commemoration, the Department of Mathematical and Computational Sciences, National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK) Surathkal, organised a one-day national conference for the benefit of postgraduate students, PhD research researchers, college instructors, and professors. Renowned academics from ISI, IITs, and NITs gave invited speeches on Functional Analysis, Real Analysis, Spectral Graph and Number Theory. The total participaants were 90.

content.text: Prof. Bopaya Bidanda, University of Pittsburgh (Alumnus ) delivered a talk on Lifelong Learning : Choosing the right university and right program for advanced study today. The session was organised by The Office of Dean Alumni Affairs and Institutional Relations (AAIR), NITK. Bopaya Bidanda is the Ernest Roth Professor of Industrial Engineering at the University of Pittsburgh and an alum of NIT - Karnataka. He returned to the faculty last year after serving 21 years as department chair. He is also the immediate Past President of the Institute of Industrial Systems Engineers (IISE) and a Fellow of the Society. He has published well over 100 papers in archival journals and conference proceedings. This includes 12 books in areas ranging from Automated Factories to Project Management to Rapid Prototyping and Additive Manufacturing. As Editor in Chief of the Maynard s Industrial Systems Engineering Handbook, the definitive book on Industrial Engineering, he coordinated 130 chapters with authors from 30 countries. He has previously served as a Fulbright Senior Specialist in South America and also initiated the engineering program on Semester At Sea voyages. He has keynoted conferences across the globe from Indonesia to Israel and from Brazil to Colombia. He also founded of the Manufacturing Assistance Center program with locations in Titusville (Pennsylvania), Lagos (Nigeria), and Sisvilla (Gujarat).
content.original_text:
Prof. Bopaya Bidanda, University of Pittsburgh (Alumnus @surathkal_nitk) delivered a talk on "Lifelong Learning :
Choosing the right university and right program for advanced study" today. The session was organised by The Office of Dean Alumni Affairs and Institutional Relations (AAIR), NITK. 

Bopaya Bidanda is the Ernest Roth Professor of Industrial Engineering at the University of Pittsburgh and an alum of NIT - Karnataka. He returned to the faculty last year after serving 21 years as department chair.  He is also the immediate Past President of the Institute of Industrial & Systems Engineers (IISE) and a Fellow of the Society. He has published well over 100 papers in archival journals and conference proceedings.  This includes 12 books in areas ranging from Automated Factories to Project Management to Rapid Prototyping and Additive Manufacturing.  As Editor in Chief of the Maynard‚Äôs Industrial & Systems Engineering Handbook, the definitive book on Industrial Engineering, he coordinated 130+ chapters with authors from 30+ countries. He has previously served as a Fulbright Senior Specialist in South America and also initiated the engineering program on Semester At Sea voyages. He has keynoted conferences across the globe from Indonesia to Israel and from Brazil to Colombia.  He also founded of the Manufacturing Assistance Center program with locations in Titusville (Pennsylvania), Lagos (Nigeria), and Sisvilla (Gujarat).

NITK s ChargeSwap takes home multiple awards at Asia s Largest Ethereum Hackathon. Ashish Bharath, Asim Jawahir, Abhiraj Mengade, Parth Mittal from NITK and Rahul Pujara IIIT-D, were selected as 2000 of the 20K hackers from 69 countries to attend ETHIndia 22 in Bangalore from December 2-4, 2022. The biggest Ethereum hackathon in Asia, ETHIndia ( includes speakers and sponsors from across the world who support and promote the blockchain ecosystem. The group created ChargeSwap, a groundbreaking IoT and blockchain-based EV battery switching solution. In order to provide immutability of data, make money transfers programmable, and eliminate the potential of misrepresentation to drive up prices or drive down use costs, ChargeSwap seeks to decentralise the battery-swapping ecosystem. Following a 36-hour construction period and competition with 459 teams, the students finished in the top 12 places. They also took home the prize for the Best New Module, which made use of the Biconomy SDK and a top-tier Polygon public product. They would get a 6500 grand prize in total. In addition, several organisations contacted them about advancing their proposal. Sandeep Nailwal, co-founder of Polygon, Vitalik Buterin, inventor of Ethereum, Kartik Talwar, co-founder of ETHGlobal, and many more were among the important visitors.
content.original_text:
NITK's ChargeSwap takes home multiple awards at Asia's Largest Ethereum Hackathon.üèÜüèÖü•áüôå

Ashish Bharath, Asim Jawahir, Abhiraj Mengade, Parth Mittal from NITK and Rahul Pujara  IIIT-D, were selected as 2000 of the 20K+ hackers from 69 countries to attend ETHIndia'22 in Bangalore from December 2-4, 2022.
 
The biggest Ethereum hackathon in Asia, ETHIndia (https://ethindia.co/index), includes speakers and sponsors from across the world who support and promote the blockchain ecosystem.

The group created ChargeSwap, a groundbreaking IoT and blockchain-based EV battery switching solution. In order to provide immutability of data, make money transfers programmable, and eliminate the potential of misrepresentation to drive up prices or drive down use costs, ChargeSwap seeks to decentralise the battery-swapping ecosystem.

Following a 36-hour construction period and competition with 459 teams, the students finished in the top 12 places.

 They also took home the prize for the "Best New Module," which made use of the Biconomy SDK and a top-tier Polygon public product. 

They would get a $6500 grand prize in total. In addition, several organisations contacted them about advancing their proposal. 

Sandeep Nailwal, co-founder of Polygon, Vitalik Buterin, inventor of Ethereum, Kartik Talwar, co-founder of ETHGlobal, and many more were among the important visitors.

content.text: In view of National Institute of Technology Karnataka Surathkal organised a talk session on the tittle Constitution of India today Surathkal. Guest speaker was Dr. P. Anantha Krishna Bhat, Retd. Professor, Author and Philanthropist . Dr. Anantha Krishna Bhat enlightened the history of Indian Constitution, briefed about the constituent assembly, and the rights given in the Indian Constitution. He also explained the importance of Fundamental Duties enshrined in the Indian Constitution. He educated the listeners about the articles of Indian Constitution and the procedures about reforms and recent amendments of the constitution. Prof. Prasad Krishna, Director (Additional Charge), Shri Ravindranath (Registrar), Prof. Mohan Kumar G C (Dean FW), Prof. Narendranath S (Dean SW), Prof Vijay Desai, (Dean AAIR), Prof. S M Kulkarni,(Dean R D), Prof Nagendrappa H, (Liaison Officer), other Teaching and Non Teaching Staff along with Students participated in the talk.

content.text: NITK School students VISIT TO BIO-WASTE RECYCLING PILOT PLANT PROJECT (BWRP 500 kg day capacity) The Students of classes 7th, 8th,9th 10th (220 students along with teachers) visited the BIO-WASTE RECYCLING PILOT PLANT (BWRP of 500 kg day capacity) facility donated by Tecnimont Private Limited, Mumbai, on November 7, 2022, to gain insights about the generation of Bio-gas from Food Waste. The following Faculty Research Scholars discussed interacted with the students on the undermentioned topics; 1. Dr Vasudeva. M, Assistant Professor, and Project Coordinator, Maire Tecnimont Centre for Research in Waste Recycling and Circular Economy, gave a brief introduction about the BWRP Plant and also explained the importance of Waste Management at Educational Institutes such as the conversion of Food Waste to Biogas which promotes the utilization of the waste-to-energy system by solving three issues at once; waste -management, energy demand, and environmental concern. 2. Mr Sudeep N. S, Project Associate and Research Scholar, Maire Tecnimont Centre for Research in Waste Recycling and Circular Economy in the Department of Mechanical Engineering, explained the working principle of the BWRP and gas generation process. 3. Dr Poulami Datta, Post-Doctoral Candidate, and Ms. Sangeeta Bej, Project Associate, Maire Tecnimont Centre for Research in Waste Recycling and Circular Economy in the Department of Chemical Engineering, explained the upgradation of Biogas to Bio CNG and subsequent utilization of CO2 using Micro algal culture.
content.original_text:
NITK School students VISIT TO BIO-WASTE RECYCLING PILOT PLANT PROJECT (BWRP 500 kg/day capacity)

The Students of classes 7th, 8th,9th & 10th (220 students along with teachers) visited the BIO-WASTE RECYCLING PILOT PLANT (BWRP of  500 kg/day capacity) facility donated by Tecnimont Private Limited, Mumbai, on November 7, 2022, to gain insights about the generation of  Bio-gas from Food Waste.

The following Faculty/Research Scholars discussed/interacted with the students on the undermentioned topics;

1. Dr Vasudeva. M, Assistant Professor, and Project Coordinator, Maire Tecnimont Centre for Research in Waste Recycling and Circular Economy, gave a brief introduction about the BWRP Plant and also explained the importance of Waste Management at Educational Institutes such as the conversion of Food Waste to Biogas which promotes the utilization of the ‚Äúwaste-to-energy‚Äù system by solving three issues at once; waste -management, energy demand, and environmental concern.

2. Mr Sudeep N. S, Project Associate and Research Scholar, Maire Tecnimont Centre for Research in Waste Recycling and Circular Economy in the Department of Mechanical Engineering, explained the working principle of the BWRP and gas generation process. 

3. Dr Poulami Datta, Post-Doctoral Candidate, and Ms. Sangeeta Bej, Project Associate, Maire Tecnimont Centre for Research in Waste Recycling and Circular Economy in the Department of Chemical Engineering, explained the upgradation of Biogas to Bio CNG and subsequent utilization of CO2 using Micro algal culture.

@eduminofindia @dpradhanbjp @mygovindia @drashwathcn @mairetecnimont @skill_india_official @nsdcindiaofficial @ugcindia @NEP2020 #foodwaste #biogas #sustainability #nep2020 #NITKSurathkal

content.text: NITK 20th Annual Convocation Shri Dharmendra Pradhan, Honourable Minister of Education, Skill Development and Entrepreneurship delivered the 20th Annual Convocation of NITK Surathkal on 15.10.2022. Shri Dharmendra Pradhan, was the Chief Guest, Sri.Yajnanarayana, Alumnus of NITK Surathkal 1973 batch, Managing Director, Sona Group of Industries, Bangalore, and Sri. Milind Baride, Alumnus of NITK Surathkal 1981 batch, Vice President, India Region, Maire Tecnimont, Italy, were the Guests of Honor. This Convocation awarded degrees to a total of 1787 applicants, including 126 Ph.D., 817 PG, and 844 B.Tech candidates. 249 B.Tech students additionally received a Minor in other areas in addition to their B.Tech degrees. NITK awarded B.Tech (Honors) degrees for the very first time. In this convocation, nine B.Tech students and thirty PG students earned the Institute Gold medals and medals sponsored by other entities for achieving the best CGPA. Shri Dharmendra Pradhan presented the medals to the NITK graduands. Members of the Board of Governors, Faculty, Staff, Alumni, Students, and the whole NITK family are pleased to announce that NITK Surathkal has been ranked 10th in the Engineering category and 27th overall in the National Institute Ranking Framework (NIRF) 2022.
content.original_text:
NITK 20th Annual Convocation"
Shri Dharmendra Pradhan, Honourable Minister of Education, Skill Development and Entrepreneurship delivered the 20th Annual Convocation of NITK Surathkal on 15.10.2022.
 
Shri Dharmendra Pradhan, was the Chief Guest, Sri.Yajnanarayana, Alumnus of NITK Surathkal 1973 batch, Managing Director, Sona Group of Industries, Bangalore, and Sri. Milind Baride, Alumnus of NITK Surathkal 1981 batch, Vice President, India Region, Maire Tecnimont, Italy, were the Guests of Honor.

This Convocation awarded degrees to a total of 1787 applicants, including 126 Ph.D., 817 PG, and 844 B.Tech candidates. 249 B.Tech students additionally received a Minor in other areas in addition to their B.Tech degrees. NITK awarded B.Tech (Honors) degrees for the very first time. In this convocation, nine B.Tech students and thirty PG students earned the Institute Gold medals and medals sponsored by other entities for achieving the best CGPA. Shri Dharmendra Pradhan presented the medals to the NITK graduands. 


Members of the Board of Governors, Faculty, Staff, Alumni, Students, and the whole NITK family are pleased to announce that NITK Surathkal has been ranked 10th in the Engineering category and 27th overall in the National Institute Ranking Framework (NIRF) 2022.

content.text: Shri Dharmendra Pradhan encourages NIT Surathkal to create a full-fledged Sustainable Energy Department to make the technology institute a leading lighthouse in energy transition . Shri Dharmendra Pradhan encouraged NIT Surathkal to create a full-fledged Sustainable Energy Department in order to make the technology institute a leading lighthouse in energy transition of the country within a decade. Shri Pradhan spoke about the key areas like Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, data analytics, electronics, genome editing, 3 D Printing that are the way forward for Industry 4.0. He said that India will play a key role in future development of humanity and restore its glory as a Vishwa-Guru.

content.text: Congratulations to the NITK faculty members!!

During this visit, the Honorable Minister inaugurated the newly constructed Central Research Facility (CRF) and School of Interdisciplinary Studies CoEs building with a total area of 10,394 square meters and a cost of 48 crores and laid the foundation stone for Construction of Lecture Hall Complex Block -D with the built-up area of 11,246 square meters and a cost of 54.76 crores in the presence of Shri Nalin Kumar Kateel, MP, Dakshina Kannada, Dr. Y. Bharath Shetty, MLA, Mangalore North, Prof. Prasad Krishna, Chairperson- BOG Director(A C) NITK.. The Central Research Facility (CRF) is already established with a loan of 80 Crore rupees from the Higher Education Finance Agency (HEFA) of the Indian government.

content.text: CRF, NITK Surathkal inaugurated the 5-Day National Workshop on Advanced Materials Characterization Techniques 2022 today at NITK. The Chief Guest for the inaugural is Prof. GC Mohan Kumar, Director i c of NITK and the Guest of Honour is Dr. Bhaskar Paul, Scientist F, BARC Mumbai. The 5-day workshop is being jointly sponsored by Malvern Panalytical, Sigma Lab, Perkin-Elmer and NITK Surathkal. There are over 50 registrants who are participating in this workshop to gain hand-on experience in advanced characterization techniques.

content.text: NITK Inaugurates SWACHH SPECIAL CAMPAIGN 2.0 (Under Swach Bharat Abhiyan, GOI). After the successfull completion of SWACHHTA PAKHWADA in the month of September, now NITK is launching the Swachh Bharath Special Campaign 2.0 from 2.10.2022 to 30.10.2022 to commemorate Gandhi Jayanti. The Administrative staff, Teaching and Non-teaching Staff of NITK Surathkal joined the inaugural function. During this occasion, the prize distribution of Swachhta Pakhwada clean department contest was held today, Mechanical Engineering dept bagged the first place, Chemical Engineering Department and Main Building bagged the second place, Computer Science Department and the Central Library bagged the third place.

content.text: NITK Surathkal is organised a 5-day National Workshop from 10th October onwards. The inaugural of Advanced Materials Characterization Techniques 2022. The inauguration will be held in the Main Seminar Hall of the institute at 9:00am on October 10, 2022 (Monday). The Chief Guest for the inaugural is Prof. GC Mohan Kumar, Director i c of NITK and the Guest of Honour is Dr. Bhaskar Paul, Scientist F, BARC Mumbai. The 5-day workshop is being jointly sponsored by Malvern Panalytical, Sigma Lab, Perkin-Elmer and NITK Surathkal. There are over 50 registrants who are participating in this workshop to gain hand-on experience in advanced characterization techniques.

Highlights of the ongoing project titled Impact of Soil health card on crop productivity and farmers income funded by Asian Development Bank Institute (ADBI) Japan has been running effectively in the Koraput district of Southern Odisha. The main aim of this project is to enhance the sustainable agricultural system in the region. Since this is a tribal belt, the project has significant contributions for the farmers of this region. We are using an experimental technique to administer the project goals. Recently we undertook several training sessions with approximately 1000 farmers. Principal investigator of the project - Dr. Pradyot Ranjan Jena, Associate Professor, NITK Surathkal.

Robosoft and NITK Surathkal to develop a Web 3.0 driven platform for students and organisations Mangalore Udupi: College students - be it undergraduate, post-graduate or pursuing doctoral studies, constantly share their profiles with various organisations in order to find career opportunities. Student profiles across skill-sets and academic credentials are also sought by a diverse set of organisations. In a bid to meet the needs of both, Robosoft Technologies and NITK Surathkal have partnered to develop a collaborative platform where students and such organisation can connect and interact directly for multiple opportunities (projects, internships or jobs). The proposed platform will be different from current solutions, as it is built on Web 3.0 technologies and hence personal data is owned entirely by the students and organisations they engage with. Students can share their profiles and can even showcase their work in and outside their field such as white-papers, projects, studies or research. In turn, organisations offering jobs or internships will be able to view relevant student profiles. Students can get recommendations for jobs, projects or internships based on their qualifications and interests through Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning tools. The discussions between the student and the company are private and offers peace-of-mind. Prof. Udaykumar R Yaragatti Former, Director (In-charge), NITK Surathkal, said, We believe both the student community and the corporate world will benefit from this platform. It is a secure and de-centralised platform which uses blockchain in use-cases such as validating a student profile. The platform will be built by NITK, Dr. Sourav Kanti Addya, PI, and, Dr. Mohit P. Tahiliani, Co-PI. Check the article in The Hindu, Business line
SWACHHATA PAKHWADA, Swachhta campaign held NITK Sevadal in association with Students council and Staff members, took part in the 51st week of Shrama dhana.

NITK s efforts to make the campus a neat, clean and zero waste Plastic zone. As a part of SWACHHATA PAKHWADA(An initiative of Ministry of Education Govt of India), Innovation challenges for Effective Management of Plastic and other Watse Idea Presentation was held at NITK. Coordinated by Dean R C, Prof. Kulkarni and Dean R C office. Thr jury chaired by Prof. Vasudeva M, Prof. Ramesh, and Prof. Arun. The winner of the best ideas presentation was Prof. Saikat Dutta and the runner up was Prof. Anandhan. Various innovative ideas were presented by the faculty like, Innovative Porous structure using metal waste for heat exchanger application by Prof. Gnanashekaran, Dept of Mechanical Engineering, A Strategy for Production of New Material from silicone Rubber Waste by Prof. Anandhan, Dept of Metallurgical Engineering, Watse plastic into liquid fuels: turning liability into asset by Prof. Saikat Dutta, Dept of Chemistry. Effective Plastic Management through degradation, Energy recovery and reuse of plastics by Prof. Vaishakh Nair, Dept of Chemical Engineering. The program was inaugurated by Prof. G C Mohan(DIC), and Shree Ram Mohan Y, Joint registrar and Prof. Kulkarni, Dean R C, Prof. Kattimani, Associate Dean R C, staff and students.

NITK's efforts to make the campus a neat, clean and zero waste Plastic zone.

content.text: NITK Sevadal steps into the 50th week of Shrama Dana, as a part of Swach Bharat Abhiyaan mission. After the successful completion of 49 weeks of Shrama Dana, NITK Sevadal steps into its 50th week under the able leadership of Shri Ram Mohan Y, Joint Registrar, NITK. On the occasion of day 3 of SWACHHATA PAKHWADA(An initiative by Ministry of Education,Govt of India), a Plastic free March was held from NITK to Surathkal circle. Director in charge, Registrar, Joint Registrar, NCC Officers, NSS Programme Officers, NCC cadets, Teaching and non teaching staff students actively participated in the plastic free campaign to raise awareness on plastic and it s hazardous impact on the environment. Also, collected the plastic waste during the procession. NCC cadets distributed the handouts to create awareness on cleanliness.
content.original_text:
NITK Sevadal steps into the 50th week of Shrama Dana, as a part of Swach Bharat Abhiyaan mission.

After the successful completion of 49 weeks of Shrama Dana, NITK Sevadal steps into its 50th week under the able leadership of Shri Ram Mohan Y, Joint Registrar, NITK. On the occasion of 
day 3 of SWACHHATA PAKHWADA(An initiative by Ministry of Education,Govt of India), a Plastic free March was held from NITK to Surathkal circle. Director in charge, Registrar, Joint Registrar, NCC Officers, NSS Programme Officers, NCC cadets, Teaching and non teaching staff students actively participated in the plastic free campaign to raise awareness on plastic and it's hazardous impact on the environment. 
Also, collected the plastic waste during the procession. NCC cadets distributed the handouts to create awareness on cleanliness.

content.text: Glimpse Independence Day NITK and Launching of VidYug7.1 E-Trike Electrically Powered Vehicle Director (i c) Professor Udaykumar R Yaragatti launched the new Electrically Powered Vehicle VidYug7.1 E-Trike designed and manufactured by the Centre for System Design, NITK with the funding support under Campus Waste to Energy Project (CWEP) Sponsored by 1981 Batch Alumni NITK KREC. VidYug7.1 E-Trike is exclusively designed for collecting and transporting segregated organic Waste from Staff quarters, NITK Hostels for running Anaerobic Digestion Plant. VidYug7.1 E-Trike is running on a 48 V 100 Ah lithium ion battery with a controller. Once the battery gets fully charged it can run up to a 60-70 km range across the campus.

content.text: Come join the campaign. Let us celebrate the ‡§Ø ‡§®_‡§∏ _‡§ú ‡§°

NITK Surathkal has signed a Memorandum of Agreement (MoA) with Siemens and 3D Engineering LLP for setting up of an 80 Crore Centre of Excellence (CoE) in digital manufacturing at NITK. On this occasion, Prof. Udaykumar Yaragatti, Director NITK Surathkal stated that this centre is coming up with the funding from MoE and grant-in-kind from Siemens and 3D Engineering will be the implementation partner. He also stated that the 6 laboratories under this Centre would help skilling our students in domains like Product and Process Digitization, Product Life Management, Mechatronic Automation etc. These trained students would be able to get placement in Elite Industries and Research organizations like DRDO and ISRO. Earlier, he welcomed the teams from Siemens and 3D engineering and Dean (R C) Prof. S. M. Kulkarni provided a preamble to the event supported by former Dean Prof. U. Shripathi. Mr Mathew from Siemens and Mr Ajay from 3D engineering mentioned in their remarks that this centre would prepare the students for placement in variety of industries seeking trained man power in above domains.

content.text: National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal and SEG Automotive, Bangalore, signed a MoU for collaborating in the area of Automotive Technology, in particular, the EV. SEG Automotive was represented by senior GM,Head- Engineering, Mr. Krishna M, Mr. Veerabasappa, Senior GM- Manufacturing( NITK Alumni,1990 batch) and, Mr. Shyam Sundar, DGM,HR. National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal team was lead by Director, Prof. Udaykumar R Yaragatti along with, Registrar, Sri. K. Ravindranath, Dean AAIR, Prof. Vijay Desai, and the joint working group of the MoU. We thank SEG Automotive for donating a motor and, a controller for EV during the MoU signing ceremony.

content.text: Image depicting, Director, NITK Surathkal, Prof.Udaykumar R Yaragatti, felicitating Dr.Pitchaiah Mandava, for his exceptional contribution in oder make the workshop a successful one. SPARC Valedictory program, Workshop on Applications of Radiomics in Healthcare organised jointly with Baylor College of Medicine, Houston, Texas and KMC Manipal from April 9-29, 2022 as part of Fulbright Specialist program and MOE SPARC project, Exploring applications of Radiomics in Brain Tumor Assessment and treatment. The Fulbright Specialist Program, ( is a program of the U.S. Department of State, giving a unique opportunity for U.S. academics and established professionals to engage in two- to six-week, project-based exchanges at host institutions across the globe. Dr Pitchaiah Mandava, the key resource person for the workshop, visited NITK Surathkal under this program. The Scheme for Promotion of Academic and Research Collaboration (SPARC) ( aims at improving the research ecosystem of India s Higher Educational Institutions by facilitating academic and research collaborations between Indian Institutions and the best institutions in the world. NITK Surathkal is part of 6 SPARC projects with collaborating with renowned universities in USA, Canada, Japan, Norway and Australia. Fifteen postgraduate students and researchers participated in the 3 week program. The workshop involved a mix of lectures, lab work, project, field visit and regular evaluations.
content.original_text:
Image depicting, Director, NITK Surathkal, Prof.Udaykumar R Yaragatti, felicitating Dr.Pitchaiah Mandava, for his exceptional contribution in oder make the workshop a successful one.

SPARC Valedictory program, Workshop on Applications of Radiomics in Healthcare organised jointly with Baylor College of Medicine, Houston, Texas and KMC Manipal from April 9-29, 2022  as part of Fulbright Specialist program and MOE SPARC project, Exploring applications of Radiomics in Brain Tumor Assessment and treatment.

The Fulbright Specialist Program, (https://fulbrightspecialist.worldlearning.org/) is a program of the U.S. Department of State, giving a unique opportunity for U.S. academics and established professionals to engage in two- to six-week, project-based exchanges at host institutions across the globe. Dr Pitchaiah Mandava, the key resource person for the workshop, visited NITK Surathkal under this program.

The Scheme for Promotion of Academic and Research Collaboration (SPARC) (https://sparc.iitkgp.ac.in/) aims at improving the research ecosystem of India‚Äôs Higher Educational Institutions by facilitating academic and research collaborations between Indian Institutions and the best institutions in the world. NITK Surathkal is part of 6 SPARC projects with collaborating with renowned universities in USA, Canada, Japan, Norway and Australia. 
Fifteen postgraduate students and researchers participated in the 3 week program. The workshop involved a mix of lectures, lab work, project, field visit and regular evaluations. 

#NITKSurathkal
#SPARC_Nitk
#teachingandlearning

content.text: Mis. Panchami H R, Ph.D research scholar under the supervision of Prof Arun M. Isloor, Department of Chemistry, National Institute of Technology Surathkal won the Dr. Ambedkar Young Entrepreneurs League (AYEL) award, a national level competition organized by the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, Govt. of India for the innovative idea for the wastewater treatment with the funding of Rs. 30 lakhs. She was felicitated by Dr. Virendra Kumar, Hon ble Union Minister of Social Justice and empowerment, Govt. of India, New Delhi on 14th April 2022 at Dr. Ambedkar International Centre, New Delhi . ASIIM aims to identify 1,000 innovative ideas till 2024 and the eligible initiatives of SC Youth will be considered for funding up to Rs. 30 lakhs in a three-year period to be invested as equity in the companies promoted by the SC entrepreneurs. She was supported by Dr Nagendrappa H., Liaison officer of SC ST cell , NITK and NITK STEP. Currently Miss Panchami is pursuing her Ph.D research on the topic Protein separation using polymer membranes under the supervision of Prof. Arun M. Isloor, who is also Professor in charge of NITK STEP.
content.original_text:
Mis. Panchami H R, Ph.D research scholar under the supervision of Prof Arun M. Isloor, Department of Chemistry, National Institute of Technology Surathkal won the ‚ÄúDr. Ambedkar Young Entrepreneurs League (AYEL)‚Äù award, a national level competition organized by the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, Govt. of India for the innovative idea for the wastewater treatment with the funding of Rs. 30 lakhs. She was felicitated by Dr. Virendra Kumar, Hon‚Äôble Union Minister of Social Justice and empowerment, Govt. of India, New Delhi on 14th April 2022 at ‚ÄúDr. Ambedkar International Centre, New Delhi‚Äù. ASIIM aims to identify 1,000 innovative ideas till 2024 and the eligible initiatives of SC Youth will be considered for funding up to Rs. 30 lakhs in a three-year period to be invested as equity in the companies promoted by the SC entrepreneurs. She was supported by Dr Nagendrappa H., Liaison officer of SC/ST cell , NITK  and NITK STEP.
	Currently Miss Panchami is pursuing her Ph.D research on the topic Protein separation using polymer membranes under the supervision of Prof. Arun M. Isloor, who is also Professor in charge of NITK STEP.

content.text: Students of NITK express their support to save soil . Save Soil movement, a race against time to prevent soil extinction. The objective is to get citizens of the world to express to their leaders the need to save soil. The drive aims to reach 3.5 billion people globally or 60 of world s electorate who can vote to Save Soil. The movement on campus was led by 3 clubs, Utkrishta Bharath, NSS and Task Force. Show your support by speaking about soil for 100days. Below are few glimpses of the event conducted on 31st of march at NITK.
content.original_text:
Students of NITK express their support to *save soil*.

Save Soil movement, a race against time to prevent soil extinction. The objective is to get citizens of the world to express to their leaders the need to save soil. The drive aims to reach 3.5 billion people globally or 60% of world‚Äôs electorate who can vote to Save Soil.

The movement on campus was led by 3 clubs, Utkrishta Bharath, NSS and Task Force.

Show your support by speaking about soil for 100days.

Below are few glimpses of the event conducted on 31st of march at NITK.

#nitk #NITKSurathkal #savethesoil #savethesoilsavetheworld

content.text: TEDxNITKSurathkal brings you the latest edition of our Salon event, themed Is Data the New Oil? . Join us in exploring the various perspectives that our speakers bring to the table. Delve into cutting-edge technology, the thought process behind framing internet policies, and the various hurdles faced on a global scale. Live on TEDxNITKSurathkal YouTube channel on 10 th July at 5:30 pm Link in bio Inviting you all!!
content.original_text:

content.text: NIRF 2021 rankings were released on 9th September 2021 by Hon ble Minister of Education, Shri Dharmendra Pradhan. The National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal has been placed in 10th position in the Engineering Institute rankings and the second among NITs. It has improved its position by three places in the Engineering rankings (from 13th in 2020 to 10th in 2021). This is indeed a very momentous and joyous occasion for the faculty and staff members of NITK. Director, Prof. K. Umamaheshwar Rao congratulated and credited every member of the NITK family for this achievement. He also mentioned that sincere, selfless and committed work of faculty members, administrative officers, staff members and Students of the institute has led us to occupy this position.
content.original_text:
NIRF 2021 rankings were released on 9th September 2021 by Hon‚Äôble Minister of Education, Shri Dharmendra Pradhan. The National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal has been placed in 10th position in the Engineering Institute rankings and the second among NITs. It has improved its position by three places in the Engineering rankings (from 13th in 2020 to 10th in 2021). This is indeed a very momentous and joyous occasion for the faculty and staff members of NITK. 

Director, Prof. K. Umamaheshwar Rao congratulated and credited every member of the NITK family for this achievement. He also mentioned that sincere, selfless and committed work of faculty members, administrative officers, staff members and Students of the institute has led us to occupy this position.

content.text: Team National Institute of Technology Karnataka(NITK), Surathkal wishes MANY HAPPY RETURNS OF THE DAY to our beloved Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi Ji on his 71st Birthday. On this occasion, We the team NITK Surathkal pray the Almighty to shower health and prosperity on our beloved PM.

As part of celebrating 75 years of Independence, 2 Kar Engr Coy NCC NITK Surathkal has organized Plog Run and Swachhta Abhiyan for creating awareness of our country s Freedom Struggle, as also to commemorate the supreme sacrifice by Shahid Bhagat Singh, on his birth anniversary on 28th September at 7am. The Plog Run was started from Sadashiva Temple Arch on NH 66 , which covered areas upto NITK beach.Along with the Plog Run , a Swachhta Abhiyan was carried out all along the roadside and adjoining areas to promote Social Service and Community Development activities , like cleanliness, throughout the nation as also creating awareness of sacrifices made by all freedom fighters, especially by Shahid Bhagat Singh.
content.original_text:
As part of celebrating 75 years of Independence, 2 Kar Engr Coy NCC NITK Surathkal has organized *Plog Run* and Swachhta Abhiyan for creating awareness of our country‚Äôs Freedom Struggle, as also to commemorate the supreme sacrifice by Shahid Bhagat Singh, on his birth anniversary on 28th September at 7am. 

The Plog Run was started from Sadashiva Temple Arch on NH 66 , which covered areas upto NITK beach.Along with the Plog Run , a Swachhta Abhiyan was carried out all along the roadside and adjoining areas to promote Social Service and Community Development activities , like cleanliness,  throughout the nation as also  creating awareness of sacrifices made by all freedom fighters, especially by Shahid Bhagat Singh.

#swachbharat #plogrun #swachhbharat #azadikaamritmahotsav #bhagathsingh #nit #nitk #green #mangalore

LIVE TODAY Colloquia on 2020 Nobel Prizes: Day 1 - Finding Black Holes Today: 04 11 2020 04:00 PM Speaker: Prof. Somak Raychaudhury Director, Inter-University Centre for Astronomy and Astrophysics, Pune Abstract: Black holes are the most extreme environments in nature, where the force of gravity is so strong that even light cannot escape. Since we observe the rest of the Universe through light, black holes must be directly unobservable. Theories of stellar evolution predict that black holes of various masses must be everywhere in the Universe. In the last decade, direct evidence of black holes have been found in many ways. Part of this year s Nobel prize in Physics has been awarded for detecting and characterizing the supermassive black hole at the core of our Galaxy (Andrea Ghez and Reinhard Genzel). I will discuss their work, and also present other ways in which black holes are detected. Iwill explore the connection with past, present and future research and opportunities in India, in particular TMT and LIGO-India. Join Here YouTube Live: Google Meet:
content.original_text:

Abstract:
Black holes are the most extreme environments in nature, where the force of gravity is so strong that even light cannot escape. Since we observe the rest of the Universe through light, black holes must be directly unobservable. Theories of stellar evolution predict that black holes of various masses must be everywhere in the Universe. In the last decade, direct evidence of black holes have been found in many ways. Part of this
year's Nobel prize in Physics has been awarded for detecting and characterizing the supermassive black hole at the core of our Galaxy (Andrea Ghez and Reinhard Genzel). I will discuss their work, and also present other ways in which black holes are detected. Iwill explore the connection with past, present and future research and opportunities in India, in particular TMT and LIGO-India.

Join Here

Google Meet: https://meet.google.com/ztq-bjum-nfd

The Deans, Registrar, Joint Registrar, Assistant Registrars, faculty and the Non-Teaching staff participated in the unity pledge at the Administrative Block with due consideration to COVID-19 guidelines. content.text: Dr. V. Sreenath, Department of Physics published two articles, in Physical Review Letters, the world s premier physics letter journal. For the paper titled Predictions for the Cosmic Microwave Background from an Anisotropic Quantum Bounce ( he collaborated with Dr. Ivan Agullo and Dr. Javier Olmedo (currently at Universidad de Granada, Spain) from Louisiana State University, USA. For the second article titled Alleviating the tension in the cosmic microwave background using Planck-scale physics ( he collaborated with researchers from Penn State University, Prof. Abhay Ashtekar, Dr. Brajesh Gupt and Dr. Donghui Jeong. These studies open a new window into Quantum gravity signature observations in the Cosmic microwave backgrounds. Nit Karnataka Surathkal
content.original_text:
Dr. V. Sreenath, Department of Physics published two articles, in Physical Review Letters, the world's premier physics letter journal.

For the  paper titled "Predictions for the Cosmic Microwave Background from an Anisotropic Quantum Bounce" (https://journals.aps.org/prl/abstract/10.1103/PhysRevLett.124.251301), he collaborated with Dr. Ivan Agullo and Dr. Javier Olmedo (currently at Universidad de Granada, Spain) from Louisiana State University, USA. 

For the second article titled "Alleviating the tension in the cosmic microwave background using Planck-scale physics" (https://journals.aps.org/prl/accepted/cd07eYe9C961795f89528077e8b30968464907750), he collaborated with researchers from Penn State University, Prof. Abhay Ashtekar, Dr. Brajesh Gupt and Dr. Donghui Jeong.

These studies open a new window into Quantum gravity signature observations in the Cosmic microwave backgrounds.
Nit Karnataka Surathkal

content.text: The NCC unit of NITK Surathkal offered a helping hand to civilian authorities in the country s fight against COVID-19 under Exercise NCC Yogdan . The team diligently worked towards identifying a cluster of daily wage labourers around NITK campus who are in urgent need and provided groceries and other rations to them. The following officers were present: Col R K Sharma, Group Commander, Mangalore NCC Group, Col Neelesh Kumar Jha, Officer Commanding, 2 Kar Engr Coy NCC, NITK, Surathkal, Lt P Sam Johnson, Associate NCC Officer, Lt H Shivananda Nayaka, Associate NCC Officer

content.text: Congratulations! Mr. Suhas Lalinakere Yathiraj, Alumnus of NITK Surathkal (B.Tech-CS, Batch of 2004) and IAS officer Batch 2007) has been appointed the new District Magistrate of Noida Gautam Buddh Nagar, Uttar Pradesh. Suhas, who was DM Prayagraj until today, is also a International-level Para-Badminton champion, currently ranked at World no. 2 in Men s singles. His new responsibilities include containing the spread of COVID-19 in UP s Coronavirus hotspot Gautam Buddh Nagar. NITK is proud of Suhas, and wishes him all the success in his new position.
content.original_text:
Congratulations! 
Mr. Suhas Lalinakere Yathiraj, Alumnus of NITK Surathkal (B.Tech-CS, Batch of 2004) and IAS officer Batch 2007) has been appointed the new District Magistrate of Noida/Gautam Buddh Nagar, Uttar Pradesh. Suhas, who was DM Prayagraj until today, is also a International-level Para-Badminton champion, currently ranked at World no. 2 in Men's singles. His new responsibilities include containing the spread of COVID-19 in UP's Coronavirus hotspot Gautam Buddh Nagar. 
NITK is proud of Suhas, and wishes him all the success in his new position.

content.text: Mr. Vishwaprasad Alva, Alumnus of NITK Surathkal (M.Tech in Industrial Electronics, Batch of 1988-90) and Managing Director of Skanray Technologies, a Mysore-based global exporter of ventilators, has been awarded a contract to supply 1000 ventilators to combat in Karnataka. Skanray has also been working on assembling one lakh ventilators, with active support from the Union Government, Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO), NITI Aayog, Directorate General of Health Services and the Karnataka Government. NITK wishes him success in this noble work.

content.text: IET s Present Around the World (PATW) is hosting a University Round Competition at NITK! PATW is IET s global competition for young professionals and students within engineering streams to develop and showcase their presentation skills. Individual competitors give a ten-minute presentation in English on an engineering or technology subject of their choice in front of an audience and a panel of judges, followed by a five-minute QnA session. The competition happens in 4 rounds, viz., University round, Local Area National Round, Regional Finals and World Finals. The winner gets a chance to win 1000 (British Pounds). The qualifiers from the university round get a chance to win cool cash vouchers. All further flight and accommodation expenses after the Local area round will be borne by the IET! Wanna get inspired? Head over to LHC-C Seminar Hall on 26th October at 9:30 am to witness brilliant presentations and get enlightened !!
content.original_text:
IET‚Äôs *Present Around the World (PATW)* is hosting a University Round Competition at NITK! PATW is IET‚Äôs global competition for young professionals and students within engineering streams to develop and showcase their presentation skills.

Individual competitors give a ten-minute presentation in English on an engineering or technology subject of their choice in front of an audience and a panel of judges, followed by a five-minute QnA session. 
The competition happens in 4 rounds, viz., University round, Local Area/National Round, Regional Finals and World Finals. The winner gets a chance to win ¬£1000 (British Pounds). The qualifiers from the university round get a chance to win cool cash vouchers. All further flight and accommodation expenses after the Local area round will be borne by the IET! 
Wanna get inspired? Head over to *LHC-C Seminar Hall* on *26th October* at *9:30 am* to witness brilliant presentations and get enlightened !! @ietnitk

content.text: SoM-Leadership Talk series 2019, organised by Industry Interaction Cell, School of Management, NITK Surathkal saw Mr Praveen Kamath, General Manager HR Head- Global Delivery Enablement, Wipro Ltd. visit SoM-NITK on 12th October as the esteemed speaker for Human Resource domain. He spoke about his vast experience in companies like Aditya Birla and Wipro. Students got clarity into the role that HR actually plays and how they are responsible for much more than what is generally assumed. Mr Kamth spoke about Data Synthesis in Human Resource area and shared Wipro s study about trends in Big Data and relevance of it in data analytics. Also, he shared insights about job opportunities in the field of data analytics. The session also covered the benefits of Data analytics in solving HR-related issues. The event was graced by Dr Pavan Kumar S, HoD, SoM-NITK. The event was facilitated in coordination with Dr Suprabha Rajendra, Assistant Professor and In-charge- Industrial Interaction Cell- SoM-NITK, and Dr Rashmi Sudhir Uchil Wipro Limited

SoM-Leadership Talk series 2019, organised by Industry Interaction Cell, School of Management, NITK Surathkal saw Mr Praveen Kamath, General Manager & HR Head- Global Delivery & Enablement, Wipro Ltd. visit SoM-NITK on 12th October as the esteemed speaker for Human Resource domain.
He spoke about his vast experience in companies like Aditya Birla and Wipro. Students got clarity into the role that HR actually plays and how they are responsible for much more than what is generally assumed.

Mr Kamth spoke about Data Synthesis in Human Resource area and shared Wipro's study about trends in Big Data and relevance of it in data analytics. Also, he shared insights about job opportunities in the field of data analytics. The session also covered the benefits of Data analytics in solving HR-related issues. The event was graced by Dr Pavan Kumar S, HoD, SoM-NITK.

content.text: The 3rd edition of ignite with the theme Machine learning as a technical theme and Marvel DC as non technical theme . The aim of team IGNITE is to take the level of this tech fest higher and higher by raising it s parameters up a few notches by each advancing year. This year we are honored to have Mr. B - Vice president of Dell India R D Center as our chief guest and Mr. Manish Jain as our guest of honor. IGNITE 19 is a three days fest. 11 October 2019 (Day 0) :- Inauguration ceremony 12 October 2019(Day 1) :- Technical events Nexus - for college students Nontechnical events 13 October 2019(Day 2) :- Non technical events Stage events Cultural events Closing ceremony Ignite MCA TaskForce, NITK Surathkal NITK MUN Literary, Stage and Debating Society - NITK Surathkal School of Management, NITK Surathkal Artists Forum NITK
